pros: Pay is great! Way above average with commission, benefits are awesome. Free cable and Internet , you just pay for the boxes
cons:
They're a corporation and DO NOT CARE about the "little people" 
Their goals are too high to maintain, while adhering to policy & integrity. Fired the entire department, DESPITE ranking #2 in the division! if you wanted to stay with the company in your SAME position, you had to APPLY for it, AGAIN, despite tenure! So there were people coming in dressed for an interview for THEIR SAME position!

pros: Everything about the company I love, great environment, wonderful colleagues, phenomenal focus on leadership,
cons: Pay is a little low versus other companies.

pros: Excellent Benefits, Excellent opportunities for advancement, Great corporate culture
cons: Poor Public Image, but hopefully this is changing

pros:
Company Laptop, cell phone and $300 expense reimbursment.
Senior Leadership was enthusiastic and involved.
Ample freedom to make and fulfill your own schedule to meet the quota.
cons:
Direct managers had poor attitudes, which bred negativity throughout the office.
Managers proved to be lackadaisical regarding their reps engagement during weekly 'check-in' or 'one-on-one' reviews.

pros: Very start up like, open floor, ideas welcomed, collaboration is a must
cons: New leadership is not as open and transparent, lot of office politics

pros:
Flexible Schedule 
Great Culture 
Good Pay (Commissions) 
Competitive Markets
cons: Having to deal with the call center in your territory which leads to lost sales.  You definitely need to brand your business from the start.

pros: Great products, state of the art technology, sweet benefits.
cons: high quotas for sales representatives.

pros: Discounts on cable, benefits fairly priced.
cons: High stress, always changing environment, when they try to buy other companies they go through hiring freezes and that's real fun when your short 30 techs

review: Just a Solid Company To Work For
pros:
- Great benefits
- Awesome team culture
- Decent incentives
- Strong leadership
cons:
- Too many hands on a customer's order from start to finish
- Communication across organizations ranges from shaky to non-existent

review: Not a clue when it comes to ADA
pros: Free Xfinity services and coffee.
cons: The company has absolutely no clue when it comes to ADA accommodation and is quite arrogant about their ignorance.

pros: MEDICAL, DENTAL, 401 K, PET INS, DR ON DEMAND, THERE'S MANY OTHERS OFFERED,
cons: starting hours can be tough, shift bids help this.

review: Great place to work, great people to work with
pros:
Very talented teams and individuals throughout the company. 
Great benefits and pay
cons: Limited ability to work across the country. Really have to just be in Denver or Philly.

review: Great time to be with the company
pros: Great people....co-workers and the random people you meet out in the feild
cons: Cant say one thing bad...every work place has its communication challenges...its all about getting on the same page.

pros:
Part time cubicle
Free telecommunications services
Very good money for part-time work.
Felt like a real employee.
Good flow of communication.
Great office location.
Great employee recognition programs.
cons: Very slow employee process could be faster.

review: Good benefits but insane amounts micro-managing
pros: Benefits were very good (time off, medical paid for, good dental, good vision, 401K); open door policy; good supervisors for the most part; co-workers make the job somewhat enjoyable
cons: Micro-managing at it's finest; escalation policy makes it very stressful on a daily basis; unnecessary amount of emphasis put on sales--agents who excel at support and service receive no recognition but those who make sales are the stars even as technical support rep's

review: Well run company with oustanding opportunity
pros: Collaborrative culture with strong degree of autonomy and control provided to business units
cons: HR and Finance processes can be stifling at times

review: The most exciting place to work in Philadelphia....
pros:
Fast-paced, creative, entrepreneurial, competitive, cutting edge products and fun projects
Amazing benefits package, talented co-workers and great freebies
Lots of opportunity to navigate your own course.
cons:
Too many silos, duplicate projects and efforts, cutthroat battles and nasty office politics.
Fast follower approach seems dated considering the dominance of of this company in the marketplace. 
Over 40 and not a VP? You've just become invisible. Heavy and overt age bias.

pros: None that I am aware of. I guess free cable as an empoyee is a Pro. I did get to meet some decent people there.
cons: In the fall of 2008 Comcast opened it's new center in Livermore, CA. It operated and expanded for a couple years, It chose this location because it got Tax breaks and Stimulus Money from the governmnet, once the Perk was over, the downsizing began and eventually the Care center was relocated to other states that were offering new seed money, They take the seed money with no plans of staying long term.

pros: Free cable and internet, very inexpensive home phone service if you want it.  Great insurance through BCBS (for now), a full month of paid time off after one year.
cons: Horrible supervisor (the worst I've ever had), horrible local HR (got fired after I left), NO work/life balance, Salesforce, NO support for customer issues from management or tech opps, missed installs, pointless meetings, EXTREME micromanagement, XHS is overpriced and forcing reps to sell that in addition to cable, cdv, and hsi rather than having a dedicated XHS local rep made for too many products, constantly changing rates and lack of communication among management, sale support, and dsr's caused tremendous billing issues, freedom of speech was not allowed, unethical practices, etc.

review: Working in an inbound call center assisting customers with account inquires and repair over the phone
pros: Great benefits and resources and tools to complete the job and do a job well done
cons: Company moved up north Richmond, VA call center closed
job title: Billing and Repair Customer Service Representative

review: My experience at Comcast has overall been a good one.
pros: Comcast offers its employees a five week training period, along with on the job training.
cons: Training was not adequate for the job.

pros: It's hard to overlook a major employer.  As a large corporation, there are perks that come along with scale:  employee discounts, company-wide events, free parking.
cons: Like most cable operators, the company has a culture that does not reward knowledge-sharing unless the knowledge comes from the top.  Still too many bottlenecks for real efficiencies or process improvement.

pros: Company is always growing and changing keeping up with technology and advancements
cons: Customer is always first regardless if they are correct or not.

pros:
Excellent pay & benefits. 
Great training, great work atmosphere. All the managers & supervisors are very approachable.
cons: Big on sales even if your in the billing department & I'm not a seller.

pros: Discount services for Tv, Internet, and phone
cons: Management suffers, Comcast wants you in and out of a customers home in an hour which is not fair for the customer, management support lacks management skills. Don't allow you enough time to properly service customers.  The whole process of being a technician Comcast doesn't allow you to achieve success in the position.

pros: These are some of the of the good things  Discount on Services,  Additional Benefit, and Pay Rate, Community Involvement,  Great Training System for leadership,
cons: I believe that this will kill any company but here are some issues I have observed while working for the company for 7 years.  Favoritism,  Unrealistic Expectations, No work life balance, Failure of the Open Door Policy, Poor Coaching and Development Process

pros: The benefits were about the only positive part of the job.
cons: Management is always contradicting, they promise one thing then do the exact opposite.  A majority of them come from the field but as soon as they have a management position they forget about how they felt when they were treated the same way.  Front line employees are treated like a number and rated by a number.

pros: The benefits are great, allowing you to spend more time with family.
cons: Apologizing to customers, for employees who have been rude to customers.

review: An overall great company to work for.
pros: Growth, Promotion, Opportunities to Advances, Incentives and Perks
cons: Constant Changes, Politics, Lack of Input, Status Quo, Intimidation From Management

pros: Ever changing atmosphere. Always an exciting new project to work on.
cons: More transparency with regards to project work/key decisions.

pros: Benefits here are amazing. People are nice. Its great if you like structured atmosphere.
cons: Hours... have to work at least one weekend day -

pros: Great room for advancement in career, They listen and try to improve issues to make the job easier and employees happy good benefits. This is great company to work for
cons: frequent change, pay could be better.

review: Things are always changing but this is a good place to work!
pros: benefits, training and great team environment
cons: frequent changes in management and direction, not much opportunity to advance and grow (at least in my experience)

review: Out with the old in with the new
pros: The good thing about working for Comcast is the monthly commission. You get commission on every 2nd pay check of the month and the commission is based on (in my case) the number of customers you save.
cons: Comcast do not value there long time employees. Comcast brings in new employees and get find a reason to eliminate the old  employees

review: A very challenging job not learned overnight.
pros: Meeting new people everyday and getting to offer a very relatable and inexpensive product.
cons: Sales goals may prove challenging to those who have never cold knocked before.

pros: Great benefits. Decent work environment.
cons: A ton of turn over. No real direction. The training's are horrible. You have to just learn as you go, and every department is pitted against each other. Every channel provides a vast amount of misinformation. Tons of angry customers. No real ability to help or change the customer's experience. Manager's are generally nice, but the company lacks consistency. Customers are treated like cattle.

pros: In addition to free cable and internet, there's plenty of opportunities to move up, across, or wherever.
cons: Poor reputation for customer service, so it can be embarrassing to admit I work here.

pros:
1. Hommization.
2. Creative 
3. Nice leader
4. Multiple team buildings
cons:
1. Stable.
2. Cable industry is not fast developing now.
3. Not so much chance for young people.

pros: Employee benefits are awesome for a part time employee
cons: billing department needs an overhaul, too many errors and it takes too long to correct incorrect billing.

pros: Multicultural environment, good pay, free parking, cafe on site, gym
cons: Very stressful, micromanage, high turnover rate

pros: Good benefits like low cost TV, internet, and home security. Health benefits are also really good.
cons: Hard to move up the ladder in the technician filed.

pros: Great company to work for, woulf love to work there again if the right opportunity opens up
cons: Can not think of any, they are considerate and generous to all employees, would work there again.

review: Employees treated much better than customers
pros: benefits, work-life balance, financial stability
cons: company reputation is not great but it is a major focus to improve it in long term

pros: Comcast sponsors many talent development programs to grow talent and is in the midst of transformative initiative to overhaul the customer experience.
cons: A compensation review for some of the positions is in order.

pros: Alot of Great benefits, good 401k plan, company incentives and quarterly bonuses great management and positive culture in call center I loved it
cons: Alot Of calls, very very stressful job while trying to keep up metrics

pros: Great atmosphere, very positive and welcoming team vibe. Very giving and willing to go above and beyond.
cons: The customers could be pretty irrate at times and the baseline pay could be a little bit more.

pros:
Good work-life balance
Opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies
Ability to move up on the corporate ladder
cons:
Philadelphia is not easy to commute
Salaries could stay stagnant for a while

pros: Great suite of latest technology. Highly skilled people
cons: Work environment / work space very crowded.

pros: Very Professional  company and very caring about their employees
cons: They force their employees  to work as much overtime as the company neefs

pros: Comcast is a great company to work in. But I however think they can spend sometime training some of their management staffs on how to handle employees.
cons: Some of the management stuff needs their length

pros: Loved this job and the people there. Very clean environment.
cons: Hated the often hour changes and the schedule changes. They were so last minute

pros: Potential to make a lot of money.  Lots of advancement opportunities.  Large company.
cons: Can only advance if you know someone.  Nepotism.

pros: Great health benefits, located close to home
cons: Crappy shift schedules, NOT employee or customer oriented company,

pros:
Helpful coworkers.
Supportive Management.
Good focus on priorities from management.
cons:
Self serving leads, cared more about perception than project health.
High turnover, lots of contract employees.
High stress, low tolerance for mistakes, lots of time eaten by oncall issues.

pros: The techs and direct supervisors aren't bad. We have each other's backs no matter what. Freedom on the road is a plus, couldn't go back to factory life
cons: Manager and up have no clue..........they try to treat techs like dogs and the pay needs to raise. I've been here three years and make just as much as a new hire out of class, but they want me to train them. Has gone severely downhill since Brian Roberts took over.

pros: Now have competitive salary with paid training and nobody breathing down your shoulder
cons: Constantly switching softwares, codes, etc. just a lot to keep up with as industry changes

pros: Good work life balance, flexible supervisors, its nice to work in the city.
cons: Very big company which has a lot of hoops to jump through in order to get things officially approved.

review: Benefits are the only positive thing about this job
pros: Health benefits, 401K, courtesy services. You get to meet a lot of really awesome people. Monthly shift bids. Good commission if you're good at selling.
cons: High stress, low pay, poor management. Sales is a part of your overall performance, however during the interview process, and in the job description it says nothing about selling anything.

pros: Great commisions and benifits package
cons: Strong micro management of tasks

review: Great company benefits, 401k matched at 6%, good pay over time.
pros: Great professional coworkers, good pay
cons: On call, mandatory overtime, some management and policys need to be reviewed, politics of company.

pros: Great medical and 401k plans. Employers also receive free internet and cable tv service as well as discounted home phone and home security.
cons: Very fast paced environment. Must be able to handle change and quick turnarounds.

pros: Great opportunity, lots of new technology
cons: Politics, public ire... complicated culture

review: Robotic and cold, nice coworkers but company treated me like a Faceless employee and fired me for not meeting goal
pros: Free cable if u don't already owe them for a past early termination fee, it's good if u can control numbers and cheat system into giving you a promotion.
cons: I got fired for not reaching numbers they initially told us not to worry about. I was denied short term disability even though I had to have a surgery. I opened a complaint and was told that it was appropriate for me to be under review and then I was fired.

review: Great culture and people first values
pros: Family-friendly, great work-life balance, and the company is committed to making a change for the better on customer experience.
cons: It is a very large company and change is very slow.

pros: Pay is commensurate with other telecommunications companies. Free services minus equipment fees. Career growth
cons: Communication between departments can improve

pros: new pay scale helps
cons: if transferring to a smaller market you wil have to take pay cut

pros: good benefits, great comission plus hourly pay good atmosphere among employess and range of shifts that youre able to work
cons: they want you to do everyones job for the lowest pay, not very flexible once you get set ina shift no matter what the circumstances and upselling is a must though they dont tell you that throughout interview process...very by the book unless of course they like you!

review: Comcast used to be a decent company to work for before the management and HR let corporate have to intervene.
pros: The different customers you get to meet on a daily basis. The work itself is rewarding if you like to solve problems. The benefits and pay are pretty good as well.
cons: Constant schedule changes year after year are the norm. Constantly micro-managing by management and HR who are one in the same. You will put a target on your back if you ever complain about management.

pros: The Benefits package and the annual/quarterly  Bonuses
cons: Constant changes , however I do know these changes are for the better; to effectively improve the growth of our company

review: Great company, not good for work/life balance.
pros: Pay is great, benefits are really good.
cons: no good work life balance, management seems out of touch with employee needs and day to day push back from clientele.

review: The Good and the bad and it really got ugly.
pros: Discounted Services, Decent pay, and a few good people who were in for more than a free ride.
cons: Lack of true management, supervisors who had no people skills, too much greed and lots of deception. If you tried to be honest with the customer it came back on you.

pros:
Great Products
Great Comp Plan
Growing Department
cons: Constant Change, if you don't like change this is not for your.

review: A great company to start a career with
pros: Benefits and free Xfinity services
cons: compensation isn't all that great. You can go to a telephone company and make double for the same job

pros: good money & flexible if you are doing ur job
cons: not a good environment for female reps.  a lot of jealousy

pros: Lots of work to be done. Great colleagues and opportunities for process/performance improvement is unlimited.
cons: Lots of work to be done....great issue to have.

review: As long as you can produce/sale and meet your monthly quotas you will be okay.
pros: I had a really great manager. He was extremely helpful and laid- back as long as you produced (made sales) and hit y our monthly sales goal. Even if you didn't he was still awesome!!
cons: HR promises that you will be able to move forward and apply for a full time position after six months of work as a Tele-sales rep. It actually takes much longer -at least a year to move to a full time position, if it evens does happen.

pros: The current commercial bandwidth offerings are more than sufficient for the majority of potential clients in the vast majority of markets served. The ability to consistently expand the available options in this vital area has been met with a largely positive response in most sectors of the commercial category. Recent changes being tested on the residential side may bring a substantial shift in both the pricing model and bandwidth limitations for that side of the business. Plans are being rolled out which would make available additional units of bandwidth access in blocks of 50mg.
cons: Constantly moving corporate targets rather than staying the course for any appreciable length of time

review: The benefits are the only reason anyone should take a job with this company.
pros: The benefits and courtesy services. Not much else.
cons: The company has a strong culture of cronyism. They will pay for your education but have no interest in putting it to use. Comcast would rather promote less educated employees with fewer years at the company than someone who has worked hard and demonstrated their capabilities. There is a great opportunity for promotion if you happen to be the right gender, race or sexuality.

review: Comcast has empowered me to becoming a leader an role model
pros: Job security, Work schedule, Good management, Opportunity for advancement
cons: Pay rate, training, continious change in work environment without being informed

pros: laid back enviroment, i enjoyed the contest and prizes for various things..i loved my teammates
cons: the metrics can be reported incorrectly, scheduling is set in stone ,,i worked the 3-midnght for a year

pros: Fully vested for 401k date of hire, great incentives, work schedule flexability
cons: different department segmentation, and time line for services

pros:
Work/Life Balance
Compensation
Independent
Part of a team
Felt like working with and for family
Hugely Discounted services
cons: Door to door sales during the winter can be rough

review: Office Politics + Disorganized Structure = Insane Fun
pros: Working here for 2 years will bolster your value in the marketplace. You will learn and experience politics and bureaucracy which will be beneficial in your future.
cons: Organizational structure is wide, disorganized, and bureaucratic. For every 1 brilliant and driven coworker that you meet, you'll also meet 2 lazy and unhelpful counterparts.

review: Overall good experience. However Sr. Management very indecisive which created a stressful work environment.
pros: Excellent benefits. Discounted services, health insurance, 401k, tuition reimbursement, and etc.
cons: Unrealistic goals, too much red tape to get things done for customers, poor communication, poor customer service.

review: Horrible. This company deserves no star's. Honestly.
pros: Free Cable. You still pay for your boxes. Nothing is completely free.  Benefits, nothing more. Nothing less.  Commission structure stinks. Hard to advance. They create smoking mirrors in the beginning.
cons: Nothing is consistent. Commission structure is horrible,  and there ripping us off every day we work. They make things so difficult. You will never figure out your commission. Starting pay. 11.00 hr.  Every other cable company start with 13.00 or better.

pros:
Very good benefits
Salary is benchmarked withing the industry
cons:
High Pressure
HR and management can go on a witch hunt for any perceived miss-step.

pros: Great Environment, meet new people everyday, fun job, forced to think under pressure. Plenty of work, including some overtime.
cons: Slow promotion due to high demand of work.

pros: Lots of networking opportunities, great benefits and great room for growth.
cons: Sometimes hard to obtain promotion depending on manager.

pros: Free cable, awesome atmosphere, amazing prizes given out randomly and performance
cons: Training process was unprofessional, Managers constantly away from their desks,  constantly changing products, procedures, and metrics

pros: Great benefits, Great stocks health benefits is awesome. free services
cons: High pressure high turnover always worried about job security

pros: Good benefits, Discounted services, Potential growth opportunities
cons: Comcast is huge so you are treated differently depending on the department you work in. Working in NASR/ACES Tech III was particularly grueling. You have to deal with micromanagement along with constant high pressure email escalations, phone calls and tickets. You are underpaid and under-appeciated for your hard work being a jack of all trades. The department used to be technical, but now it's watered down and turning into a call center.

pros: Great Company, Great co-workers, great work environment
cons: Most of the time you will take work home with you

pros: Good benefits, decent pay, flexible boss, good incentives.
cons: high expectations, tons of lists youll get put on for anything and everything, ever increasing goals, upper management doesnt have a clue.

pros: comcast gives you discounted cable and also allows you to take your truck home they also give you a discount on the Internet
cons: Comcast is not loyal to employees. I was there for 18 years until I was let go for no apparent reason. to many jobs in one time frame. supervisors will not look out for you even if they know your right. pay doesn't reflect experience. cost of insurance outpacing cost of living. mngrs only care about share holders. Comcast is not a company I would ever recommend to anyone.

pros: Great benefits and flexible time.  Management is always on the employee's side and fights for employee needs.  Great pay.  Free services.
cons: There really aren't any to speak of.

pros: After proving I could reach targeted goals, I was allowed to work from home.
cons: Took longer than was promised.

pros: It,s a job if you are unable to find any other work. Low cost cable. worst job I ever had due to management and lack of tools/support to be able to perform the job and give good customer service. It was all about pretend to help customer and sell them something else.
cons: Not allowed to give excellent or even good customer service. I AM EXCELLENT AT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND WAS NOT ALLOWED TO DO A GOOD JOB.

pros: Great work environment. There is always exciting and fulfilling work available. Nice location in downtown DC.
cons: There seems to be a lack of diversity in the higher up positions... managament an detc

pros:
+benefits are good
+pay is pretty good
+people are generally nice
cons:
-hard to make impact
-the departments / companies are very silo'd
-hard to get promoted
-hard to move around the company

pros: Lots of performance based upward mobility. Benefits are great, and there is a lot of job security.
cons: Corporate structure can sometimes be too distant from the problems frontline employees real with.

pros: Good Benefits, Good Products, Descent work atmosphere
cons:
-Major disconnect between Upper management and front line sales forces...
-Lack of on boarding training leading to sales rep frustration and resignation 
-Hi sales rep turn over

pros:
Bonuses and prizes 
Paid training in a classroom atmosphere
cons: Waiting on lottery to get crappy shift changed

pros: Free cable, free internet, 401k match up to 4.5%, 100% vested, tuition reimbursement, growth opportunities,
cons: Promotion is dependent on people leaving the company rather than performance

pros: The best thing is the discounted cable, but overall the pay is good and the management is as well.
cons: Really no cons except for routing but our dispatchers do the best they can

pros: the actual Job itself was awesome, great team members, and co-workers.
cons: upper management does know what they are doing, directives from corporate never make sense and goals are un attainable, pay is terrible so if you want to work there expect to make nothing comparable to what the business actually pays.  If you are a tech expect to know more about the system then everyone that is a supervisor or a manager for the most part, they all do not know what they are doing which is why the customer service scores are so low.

pros: Excellent company with lots of opportunities to advance your career. Competitive salary and good working atmosphere.
cons: My department in particular started seeing such a high turnover rate that it felt like we were expandable.

pros: Everyone is so nice. Great benefits and nice pay. This is a great place to work.
cons: None as of now, I'm still a little new.

pros: Appealing package of benefits. Opportunities to purchase stock options.
cons: Room for promotion is unclear.

pros: Improving their internal and external Customer's experience
cons: People hung up on past issues and not onboard with the growth and change of culture to inspire a great place to work.

pros: Excellent, comprehensive benefits package. Training opportunities, variety of job functions.
cons: Challenging to grow your career unless you are willing to move out of state.

pros: Great people, and potential to make Good money here.
cons: No car allowance, and only compensate-able up to $250.00 per month for gas.

pros: Good pay and benefits, stock program is awesome, free cable!
cons: New commission structure makes sure you get paid less for selling products, open longer hours and now every day per week, schedules are unpredictable

pros: Great place to work . Benefits are great and stock plans are awesome. Management is very helpful.
cons: Pay could be better and no work life balance.

pros: Good Benefits and training for employees.
cons: Not a team environment.  Every department works independently of the other and never communicates.

pros: Quarterly bonus on a regular basis.
cons: Promotions to different tiers or departments you had to be literally best friends with the manager/Supervisor to get the position or the other employees in the department. No promotions for hard working employees and the raises were pretty dismal to none, any where from .5 to 1% raise every year regardless how much work you put in while your coworkers and supervisors slept on the job

review: Best Company I’ve Ever Worked For
pros: Benefits, Perks, Pay, good hours, great opportunity.
cons: I would like to move up quicker than allowed

pros: Fantastic benefits. the company really treats their employees well.
cons: call quality, most people have no intention of upgrading service.

pros: We have the best products available
cons: Supervisors and Managers have less technical skills than the majority of their employees.

pros: Good place to work I will recommend to family and friends , great perks and benefits..
cons: Depends where your office is located ..: so far no cons

pros: Comcast insured there employees knew their job.
cons: Some people didn't take advantage of the job training aspect.

pros: Employee Benefits, Work at your pace, Great Development managers,
cons: Corporate politics, and the billing systems has to improve.

pros: Company is big on wok life, home life balance.
cons: There are not many cons to this position or the company

pros: Quality Focused and good management
cons: The only complaint is lower pay for comparable job due to the fact that it's non-union

review: Would be all right if they were not constantly canning people.
pros: Comcast is a stable company with good benefits.
cons:
Stop laying people off for a while. Hiring freezes and anxiety about job losses have beaten employees into submission. No one is really focused on providing good service and good products as they are too busy keeping their heads down.

I've seen the financial data the layoffs were not justified.

review: This sales quota will get you fired
pros: The pay is pretty good, the benefits were great. They are a very profitable company so they dont cheap out on employees to much.
cons: Comcast is a great place to work outside of Sales. They have a very high turnover ratio which leads to most new hires losing their job within the first year.

review: I have had a great experience at Comcast.
pros: Great benefits and many opportunities for advancement.
cons: Need to develop a more pro-employee Human Resource department.

pros: Co-Workers, Benefits, Time Off, Training, High Tech Hardware/Software/Phones, Fast Paced, Ever Changing
cons: Bullying Female Manager, Nights and Weekends Schedule, Hourly Pay

pros: The position offers good money and a variety of opportunities in order to advance ones self within and also after employment with Comcast.
cons: Make it easier to make sales and have them pay more

pros: Great opportunities and provision of all that is needed to get the work done.
cons: As with most large companies there is a lot of bureaucracy but getting better as we go more lean and agile.

pros: The courtesy cable tv, phone, and internet services offered to employees are a great perk. Benefits are competitive, but less so than they used to be.
cons: Comcast tends to pay below average for comparable titles and job duties, but likes to claim their benefits and courtesy services more than make up the difference. Unfortunately, since pay is less than competitive, Comcast tends to retain its average and poor performers while losing its top performers to more competitive offers outside the company.

review: laying off "veteran employees" to hire veterans off of street
pros: Benefits were good, local management was great, they had company functions. Holiday pay was good. Work in local community with those in need.
cons: Unpredictable work schedule, higher management has no clue. They treat call center employees better than plant employees. some employees were expected to work holidays, but not all. Spend most of 2010-2011 worrying about NBC deal rather than there cable company.

pros: Money and people that work at the company are very helpful
cons: there is a lot of red tape but if you can deal with that its a great job

pros: When your working for Comcast, It feels like a team effort. More or less everyone is willing to help you.
cons: Some remote offices have there own culture that differs from mainstream Comcast culture.

pros: Great benefits, great goals and great spoken / written goals and vision. Good products.
cons: Terrible customer service. Alot of employees who just don't care. No one ever answers their email.

review: Old company that continues to run in reverse than looking at the future
pros: The health care package is good and you get discounts on their products
cons: One of the lowest paid companies, Management does not know the products and does things that have no relevance to the day-day process.

pros: Comcast is a great Company with great objectives, their goals are good and the company direction is good.
cons: The direction, company goals, company objectives from Philadelphia gets lost in the local markets, the individuals in leadership are put in place based on the kiss up factor and not based on qualifications factors. I have experienced discrimination of employees, customers as well as unethical actions taken by management.

pros: Reduced cable costs. Health benefits. 401k. Days off and holidays.
cons: Supervisors and managers with no experience in the field they are overseeing. This goes across the board throughout the company. Micro managing. Sales quotas determined arbitrarily for the sole reason to control your income. Sales support systems they give you that don't work and are unreliable. Promotions are filled based more on some esoteric quota system than on merit and qualifications.

pros: A family feel vibe in the work place. People are nice and will work with you to be successful.
cons: Products aren't the best.

pros: Comcast has offers great training pay as well as good opportunities for commission.
cons: The work is hard and schedule is demanding. It is a challenge getting time off. As a retention representative you take lots of verbal abuse from dissatisfied customers. Company sets unrealistic expectations for reps. For example, solve problems of customers in less than 8 minutes.

pros: Discount on your cable service
cons: Spend hours on the phone for ichat and the sup doesn't have your  back....career advancement, everyone is doing the same thing...no one job or call is better then the next,  the pay is bad to be a billion dollar company, we all should be making 15$ if not more and it should depend on your metric, that discourage ppl and keep you on the edge scared their going to lose thr job..oh they allow cx is cuss us out on a daily basis

pros: Plenty of freedom, very competitive pay, awesome people always willing to help you succeed
cons: none at the moment, new in position

pros: Constantly changing business environment constantly creates new projects and priorities.  Great team members.
cons: Cross functional team priorities.  Work/life balance is a challenge.  Constant change of organizations and employees

pros: great pay, flexible vacation hours, great benefits
cons: no support from management, ineffective training,

pros: Great benefits, great training, great team atmosphere, great managers, FREE cable, ability to advance
cons: salaries are a little low. company is always changing direction, depending on job layoff is common

pros: Great, fun, smart, thought people with healthy egos

pros: Excellent company to work for, 401K and employee perks are a great benefit when you become an employee.
cons: Peak times can be very busy and your days tend to go by quickly

review: It is a fast paced job but doesn't seem to stress you out.
pros: Benefits are great. Quarterly bonuses. Potential to get 4 or 5 raises a year. Starting pay is 12.60.
cons: Balancing your schedule. Finding time for a lunch if you can't balance well. In tallahassee they didn't give me all of my tools to start with yet all the new guys from panama city and Dothan had brand new new hire kits with every tool they're supposed to have.

pros: Great Pay, great benefits, good co-workers
cons: Very few sups have done the job, they are more like babysitters, tethered to a phone

pros: Good worker and do my job until it's done
cons: Always on time and love doing what ever job I'm doing put my heart in to that job

pros: Great Benefits! Great work/life balance
cons: I have no complaints. As long as you do your job, and communicate with leadership, you will have no problems !

pros: Good benefits, great potential to make extra money, alot of perks

review: you get what you put into
pros: flexible own your own business, learn how the world of small business works
cons: deadlines, can be a little stressful but cant complain too much

pros: Great pay . Base plus commissions.  Paid training, allowance for gas.  Company phone
cons: Use your own car. Over used territories for knocking doors.  Limited area to sell.

pros: Very great atmosphere. You get paid for what you contribute also.
cons: Your biggest competition is Comcast whether its other sales guys, customer service or techs.

pros: Great leadership and promotion opportunities

pros: great work experience, great perks, free cable

pros: Freedom and Opportunity great place to work and grow
cons: Its  hard keeping up with all of the changes that come down the pike so often.

pros: Good Money and benefits. Very nice facilities to work]
cons: Management does not listen to their employees.  Listen to your employees and get their buyin

pros: company truly takes care of you financially and has great benefits

pros: great staff and passionate people we love our customers

pros: A great company with a proven track record
cons: n/a Comcast is an excellent company

pros: Great training, amazing benefits and opportunities

review: The Products are great, Upper Management not so much
pros: My fellow employees, the pay, access to the best technology
cons: the management structure is in disarray, constantly promoting people that are tremendously unqualified and thus the culture and morale of the organization have suffered greatly in the past 2-3 years. Everything is so vertically integrated, that there's virtually no communication between the various business units, leading to a maddeningly slow response times in getting even the most minor tasks addressed.

pros: Great company to work for.  Very innovative.
cons: There are no cons, your experience at Comcast is the same as with other big companies....it's what you make out of it.

pros: Awsome benefits, 401k, employee stock options, tv phone internet courtesy services, paid time off and vacation days, commission payout
cons: none at this time for now

review: Good company with benefits, but terrible pay
pros: Great company for benefits and learning. People you work with are always great. There can be space to move and grow if you look for it.
cons: No management support. If you work under a group that has more than one Sr. Manager, you will have to float between two different agendas. Heavy underpaid. HR will say that you are paid within specification but if you look elsewhere you will find that it is not the case.

pros:
Tons of warm leads means no cold calling
Great management
Friendly atmosphere
Can be good pay
cons:
Job becomes repetitive after a while
Corporate environment leads to stress
Hard to get a good schedule

review: Great Place to work! I Recommend it to everyone
pros: Great environment to work, Amazing Benefits and great pay!
cons: It being such a large company, there is sometimes confusion as to who owns what task.

pros: Free food, great friendships and stuff to do at Call Center. Parking is great. Cafeteria and gym inside the call center.
cons: Awful organizational structure. Poor communication. Awful pay scale. Claims to have growth opportunities but stunts it. Commission is a joke because they tax 70% of it.

review: Customer Care Rep in Ann Arbor
pros: Great Benefit package and pay
cons: High stress, unable to balance work and life, constantly changing metrics to follow

pros: Great company culture & benefits, recently raised 401k match.
cons: Training is limited. Company is so big and vocabulary is very Comcast specific so it takes longer to catch on than other companies.

pros: Peers. Sales Reps. Benefits, overall corporate culture, Supervisors
cons: Regional culture, upper management, Favortism, Corporate culture is not filtered down to the regional level and the regional level is a different culture and environment. They change policy and force it on you without corporate buy in.  They also change their comp plan to benefit the company all the time.

pros: Work for yourself, Almost Free Cable, internet and phone
cons: sales are hard to come by, direct management does not offer good support or coaching

pros: great place to work, benefits are amazing,  2 weeks of vacation to start.
cons: certain departments pay is not competitive.

pros: Great for those wanting 40 hour weeks and an opportunity to move around.
cons: In my department, all it takes is 1 mistake to blacklist your career. I worked for 3 years, and was never considered for a promotion, or was even allowed to apply for a different role within the same department. When applying to other departments, I was then told by the recruiter that the application says they are looking for A, but want they really want is F, G, and H.

pros: Career opportunities, job security, skills development.
cons: No established career progression steps; one must figure things out on one's own.

pros: Great people to work with. Great benefits. Room to move up in company.
cons: So much to learn in so little time.

pros:
Excellent benefits. Accolade service is great.
Number of opportunities for Career development.
Values talent
Diverse
Great work/life balance
cons: Nothing that I can think of in my current role

pros: Very Great Benefits,  Shift Flexibility,  Bonuses , Helpful and Resourceful management!
cons: Not technically a con just have to have the patience for upset customers

pros: Great benefits, free cable, amazing culture, good work/life balance, awesome products, work from home, flexible
cons: Enormous corporation so there can be some confusion between internal partners

pros: good compensation if you can meet your targets, great employees with a helpful culture
cons: high quotas, lots of work from home after hours, fulfilment struggles based on the use of multiple systems

review: Cheap - but seems to care for employees as a rule
pros: Depending on management structure, Comcast seems to care for its employees.  Comcast is involved in the community.  Go management structure changes have been made.
cons: Up to director level, VPs must sign off on any purchase.  There's no latitude to make spending decisions.  Corporate Comcast seems to be a little cut-throat.

review: It is a grind and very matrix oriented
pros: Opportunity to make change and impact customer.  Outside techs are great!
cons: Management is not open to field leader ideas.  Decisions are developed and driven top down.  Very matrix oriented.  Difficult to define and implement strategy.

pros:
Great Co workers
Pay is great
Free Cable, Phone, and Internet 
Several Schedule options
cons:
Micromanaged by upper management.
Unfair shift bid criteria.

review: A few good and shining spots but mostly clueless fudge
pros: Depending upon place of work and department, there are a lot of good opportunities to explore. The company has good benefits and there is a lot of focus on employee development through focus groups.
cons: Much like any other big company, the bureaucracy, politics and lethargic energy runs rampant.  Too much money gets thrown around with little accountability for results. This makes "measuring success" extremely subjective and most part non existent.   Some obvious decision making can take a long time.

pros: Good company, great pay, training is entertaining
cons: One store manager from another location didnt like me from the beginning and went out of her way to get me terminated

review: The work can be challenging but rewarding. There is a lot to learn.
pros: There is a good work balance. Flexible schedules.
cons: You have to bid for start times, and it is based on seniority.

pros: Fast-paced, industry-leader, exciting to be a part of!
cons: Limited career path for those in the later part of their careers

review: I had a great experience with Comcast

cons: Corporate did not have a close relationship with field individuals.

review: Good Environment - Pay Not bad with commisions

cons: pay for the type of customers that call..most are no satisfied obviously...thats why they are callng

cons: Workload is often unmanageable and stressful, promotions are unlikely unless you know the promoting mgr, hard work is rewarded with...more work, upper management never takes responsibility for actions and always looks to scapegoat lower level employees, CYA is BAU, often unethical behavior is covered up and tho an Open Door Policy is promoted retalian is commonplace

pros: They promote from within.  They have different programs to help you succeed.
cons: It feels like it's hard to move up in the call center versus the administration building.

pros: Love that they realize you have a family and it's not all work
cons: compensation - wish they would check the market and pay their front-line employees better or provide bigger bonuses.

Commuter benefit.

Pay could have been better. 
Philadelphia city wage tax.

cons: Very difficult to grow within the company.  Very poor at communication. Continually removing perks.  401k contrubution reduced.  NCTI certs are no longer reimbursed.  Removed potential 2% raise for taking NCTI certs.

pros: Good benefits, good employee development.  Culture of respect for people and consensus building.

It is tough to stay positive in this type of environment, raises are not good... the company really doesn't care about creating program which can promote career advancement.

pros: Interesting problems on many teams, good work-life balance, management is OK

review: comcast not fair to non white employees
pros: because its hard finding another job in this area. you have to have a degree for most other jobs.the one good thing i will say about them is they will hire a lot of people
cons: just about everything. they still use the good ole boy network.most techs who live on the east coast in good neighborhoods have to have more than one job.they are bad at keeping pace with the bad economy,they really just dont care about all employees.meanwhile managers and supervisors drive ford f150s for no reason at all.they drive there families around in the trucks but we can't

pros: Career opportunity, benefits and perks (freek services) are good.

pros:
There are many people with knowledge and willingness to share it; the folks doing the work are pretty friendly
Benefits are better than average
Very interesting technologies to work with / problems to solve
cons:
Political savvy is the most critical element of your success
While technology is very interesting, the political situation seems to determine most outcomes
Relentlessly focused on quarterly financial reports - delivering service seems to be a hassle on the way to making money (no shame in this, but some organizations demonstrate real passion for their business; the passion has been squeezed out of most of the folks by now)
Minor value placed on working as a team; a savvy and loud individual will get ahead and do well -even with poor technical skills

review: Average corporate job, exciting in the beginning and mundane in the end.
pros:
Good start pay
Decent paid on the job training
Flexible shifts as long as your numbers are good for the shift bid
Great benefits
cons: Depressing job.. most phone calls are negative and can get under your skin. As with most corporate jobs... you are a number, not a person.

pros: Great employees and a fun environment to work in.
cons: They need to continue sustaining the business while increasing focus on customer experience and new product launches.

pros: Get free cable and high speed internet and the phone for only 4 dollars a month and great discount In many stores.

pros: I enjoyed the people I worked with and the pay was great.
cons: Working outside in all types of weather conditions.

pros:

review: Excellent Working Environment With Challenging Roles
pros: Great benefits, best in class in industry.
cons: Processes need work and fixing.  Would be a great candidate for Lean/Six Sigma.  Moving the business forward takes away from Work/life balance.

pros: Pay and benefits are good.
cons: Salesforce has become the corporate big brother. No work life balance. Not enough support for back end order processing and all task become the salespersons. Design engineers are overloaded and have to many reps to handle the volume. Construction does not follow through with site surveys. It is basically like you are doing 5 peoples jobs and your own at the same time.

pros: Benefits,largesse,opportunity to relocate.A great company if you aligned within a group with the corporate vision
cons: Location specific detractors. If alligned with corporate its great!

review: Churn and burn Business account executives
pros:
Great benefits including reduced cable services
 pay is better than average however the commission scale is often changed to control income.
cons:
micromanaged, 
churn and burn culture... I saw the entire sales force turnover 3 times during my 4 year tenure... life expectancy is less than 1 year.
expected to do work at home and before / after normal business hours...lawsuit waiting to happen.
promotions in Comcast are based on filling diversity quotas.
company is in constant state of reorganization and job elimination... are you next??

review: Fast paced business, working hard to be employee-centric
pros: Good benefits and salaries. Company goals and direction are focused on all the right things.
cons: The nature of the business makes it hard for work-life balance to be created.

pros: Great benefits, decent pay, great working environment
cons: Shifts are horrible at first. FMLA/Short Term Leave insurance company isn't very good

pros: great pay and benefits. free cable and internet. they truly appreciate their employees and show it.
cons: none at all none none

review: A lot of potential...but very poor training
pros: The possibility to make money is definitely there. Great benefits and you pretty much make your own schedule as you are out with clients all day.
cons: There is absolutely no training on what your day to day processes should be. There is no training on the system and programs that you must use on a daily basis. There is absolutely no structure of because of this it is very easy to fall behind.

review: Great job. Lots of room for your strengths to how.
pros: Great local management team. Really enjoy working here.
cons: Long work days and high stress

pros: The only pro is free cable.
cons: CUSTOMER SERVICE IS TERRIBLE. Everyone is more concerned about numbers, no one cares about customer service. No one cares about customer satisfaction. If you sale Comcast, you will hear more complaints, spend more time working on your days off and forget family life. You belong to Comcast. They will throw you out to the wolves without properly educating you. Other departments steal your sales. After you sign up a customer, should the customer call into the 800 number to ask a question, the operator is stealing your sale. Keep a log of your sales.

pros: Opportunity to grow within the Company.
cons: Stressful position due to the nature of the job.

pros: Great Benefits vacation time, sick time and float hour is always a plus new employers start out with 2 weeks vacation  after 90 days

pros: Friendly people, great perks, bonus structure, Competitive wages + commission and a bonus structure, Paid time off,

pros: Good benefits, coworkers, and the company really takes care of you.

pros: Laid back work environment. As long as you do your job, no one is looking over your shoulder and micromanaging.

pros: Good base salary, benefits, vacations , people

pros: Innovating, Growth Oriented, Fluid, and Rewarding

Management.

Everyone in awhile corporate will go through and fire tons of managers and supervisors and this creates a lot of disorganization in the building. Corporate will also implement changes regularly that creates confusion in the job as well.

pros: Outstanding benefits, good wages, great leadership!

pros: The benefits and culture of the company phenomenal
