pros: Professional Workplace.  Services competitively priced with marketplace.
cons: Downward changes to salary structure; lack of career advancement opportunities.

pros: Room for advancement  and very friendly people and surroundings
cons: Management  neet to connect more with workers

pros: Work is mostly independent and self-paced. Good pay and benefits.
cons: Pressure to get work done by deadline but without OT. Nighttime work on random days messes up sleep schedule.

pros:
Overall, I loved working at RCS1. They will make sure you grow within the company. 
 Team Metrics Competitions
Great work atmosphere
cons: Shift bids are the only thing that i didn't care for.

pros: There are great incentives and very  lenient attendance policy after 90 days.
cons: The company changes their commission pay out ever 8-12 months. They tell you that it will benefit you, but it won’t. The highest commission in my 4.5 years with them was $3,200. With the new commission plans you are expected to make less than $1,000. If you do overtime to make it up it will only go against you due to the number of disconnects taken.

pros: Great perks, great benefits, good work environment.
cons: High pressure and very metric oriented, changes can come often and without much notice.

pros: great company you can buy stock in this company great commission great pay education oppurtunity
cons: wishing for lower prices for the ederly

pros: Great benefits and engaging work. Can be stressful but there is great working culture and change is continuous.
cons: Change is continuous. Must always be emotionally prepared for changes.

pros: The people at Comcast make it a great place to work
cons: Living 20 miles away make my commute timely.

pros: It is a place to get a paycheck
cons: Many! The job is for sales, but that means taking all calls from angry customers, to people that have had their bills change, to anything. Customers are usually not happy with Comcast when they call in, due to the company's business practices. When customers realize they can't do anything to lower their bill they get madder. Comcast doesn't allow lower packages for customers to pay less. Also, people walk around on eggshells like they are afraid they won't have a job. Makes it very stressful.

review: Good benefits. Culture depends on department.
pros: Great benefits, good people. Interesting products.
cons: Lots of politics - definitely an old boys club. Pressure is intense if in business sales departments.

pros: They take very good care of their employees. One of the best compensation/benefits packages I've ever had.
cons: They didn't have an office where I needed to move to. (East Texas)

pros: It's a good company. People are nice. Allow me to do m job.
cons: Not a lot. i have been pretty happy with my experience since i started.

pros: The health benefits, cable benefits, and also we get discounts with over 1000 major retailers and travel companies.
cons: The hours are terrible. Remember we are open seven days a week and you will most likely work on weekends. I will not suggest this job for single parents or students. Also we do not get paid for all that we do. Yes we make commission however we are technical support  and customer service and mobile agents and our pay does not reflect that.

review: Love working for the company, benefits, services
pros: income, services and discounts, benefits, close team
cons: hard to get relocated to another state and even willing to drop the pay cut just to relocate

pros: Good pay and benefits.  Flexible schedule and relaxed workplace.
cons: A lot of red tape and process.  Confusing direction.  Constantly changing priorities.

pros: There are many perks and incentives along with the great pay good benefits
cons: Management sometimes gets in the way of progress the Departments are separated and communication is lacking between the Departments

pros: Huge global brand.  Great content and ppl
cons: A lot of executives are lazy and near sighted - dont have people's career path in mind.

pros: Great benefits and able to work from home
cons:
Just make sure you do your job and you won’t have to worry about being fired.
Metrics are VERY important to the company.

pros: amazing company with great benefits
cons: once your in the call center its a black hole you cant leave

review: There were quite a few changes that were going on at the time of my employment.
pros:
Community Focused 
Cost Effective for Small Businesses
cons: Pay grade is lower than most telecommunications companies.

pros: Helping people is always fun.
cons: Getting yelled at for service not working or bills being too high.

pros: Good employer-employee relationship and excellent benefits.
cons: Too much working hours..almost 12-14 hrs work/day.

pros: good pay, good management support, high technology, keeps you busy, promotions, benefits, commissions,
cons: angry customers, can get repetetive, high expectations of sales levels, long hours, sometimes work Saturdays

review: ok place to work if you have good upper management
pros: salary is good, left alone if you perform well
cons: hard to advance, impossible to transfer to another state

review: Very Successful, but no longer values employees
pros: Enjoyable place to work.  Great team members.  One person does many jobs, so exposure to many areas of the business.
cons: Consolidation after consolidation of work force understandable in "big business", but has resulted in an incredible amount of layoffs of long-term, valuable and dedicated employees. Preparation not done prior to layoffs, so things get lost in the shuffle, and no one knows who or where handles what.  Company used to value employees, but now feels like we're just a number.

pros: Great benefits including cable tv, internet, home phone and home security. Good health, dental, vision and retirement benefits
cons: Cut in hourly supposedly made up for increase in commission. Unlikely to hit goals stuck behind a counter doing billing and customer service. Very difficult to move up.

pros: great place to work everyone tries to work together to get the customers taking careof
cons: as with every company there need to be some policies looked at and revised other than that no complaints

pros: Good benefits, compensation & training
cons: Corporate/managers are constantly changing matrix/procedures/reorganization.  Call it "management by confusion."   Job security is uncertain as next month they might decide to move your group to a different city or state.  Things hopefully have changed. The last year I worked there I had 5 different bosses and was laid off as my job moved to another state.

review: I have worked at Comcast for 9 years
pros:
Plenty of leadership training
As long as you can navigate the political culture of a large corporation there is lots of opportunity to grow
cons:
Tools are outdated
Processes are cumbersome 
Reporting is not timely

pros: Free Cable, fast paced, awesome people. top talent, innovation, creativity, leader in the market
cons: merit increases are typically cost of living increases

review: One of the worst jobs that I have ever had
pros: Excellent benefits and generous paid time off
cons: The focus was definitely on quantity of work instead of quality of work.  The equipment given to be installed was defective more times than not.

review: no micro-management, decent paying, but no job security
pros: good pay/benefits, very flexible hours, no micro managing, reasonable goals
cons: no communications, department has been dismantled twice in 3 years, have to reapply for own position every time the department reorganizes, lack of job security, no advancement opportunities.

review: Started out good, but they are now looking for low paid, inexperienced "robots" instead of skilled sales reps
pros: This was good paying sales job, but corporate is changing that.
cons: All freedom to use your sales skills are being removed and you're GPS tracked and forced into tiny territories. Don't expect your customers to be taken care of, I was told to "wash my hands" of existing customers, "just go find more".

pros: Great working environment but, assistance with customer's could be better.
cons: The biggest challenge was trying to sell products when resolving billing issues.

pros: Good Company, Great Benefits, potential for advancement.
cons: Like all large companies, sometimes the bureaucracy overshadows a lot.

review: A great and not so great place to work depending on which department your in . Customer account executive was my title
pros:
Ok startling pay 13.25hr
Very diverse group of employees
Commission on sales can add a nice bonus
cons:
No support from upward management
Office politics can get overbearing
You never know when your last day might be there.
High turn over rate....

review: Amazing start to my call center career!
pros: Commission. Quarterly bonuses. Extremely cheap Cable/Internet/Phone/Home Security.
cons: Personal Growth can be far out and limited. Night supervisors fail to assist their teams.

review: Universal Studios Orlando  City Walk Park Services
pros: Hard work pays off. Supervisor and Managers always looking for employees with potential.
cons: Little full time options

pros: I love the leadership where k work. Very supportive, the company definitely cares about your well being.
cons: Products need to work a little better and better communication between departments needed.

pros: Good experience. Employees were willing to teach and guide interns. Also taught us how to network.
cons: Intense internship, requires dedication and hard work. Have to be interested in work to enjoy.

pros: Excellent training, support staff, and management
cons: lack of communication sometimes lead to confusion

pros: Good pay about 12 an hour plus commission averging out 25 an hour with commission
cons: No stability or room for growth

review: Not a good place to work if you are sensitive. This company has alot of upset customers mainly for no reason.
pros: Sales department gets all the $$$. Other departments complain and suffer because they do not pay enough for what u have to do.
cons: Shift bids. Hard to work morings. Hard to take vacations or use personal time.

pros: Fast pace, access to innovative products and services, company is always striving to compete with google and apple which pushes them to be innovative, pulling away from "traditional" cable
cons: The fast pace usually means running without thought, very light on the big picture, much is producing for the sake of producing, not because it's the right thing to do. They launch products and services before testing

pros: One of the greatest benefits you can receive, besides the pay, is being able to receive all your tv, internet, phone and home security for free while type an employee.
cons: The one week training was a joke. It was nothing like you would experience in the actual Comcast centers. You would be better off just jumping into it day one.

pros: Good Atmosphere, Opportunities and 401 k plan
cons: Nothing bad to say about this company

pros: Its a very collaborative environment. The dev teams work hard and have fun. There is plenty of support to keep projects and tasks moving forward. This is one of the best companies I've worked for in regards to moving the needle.
cons: Heavy in corporate politics. Executive team is not great at making decisions and sticking to them, which causes a lot of swirl within the supporting teams.

pros: Freedom to work by yourself and management gives you plenty of space if needed.
cons: Low pay and sometimes overworked with unrealistic metrics.

pros: great benefits and perks.
cons: a bit demanding and a lot of micro managing.

pros: decent pay good benefits good vacation time. 2 week vacation plus flex and floating vacation
cons: not getting home on time sometimes overall its good

pros: This is a great place to work. It offers very competitive benefits. Management listens and attempts to address issues as soon as possible.
cons: Work life balance is a challenge.

pros: Reasonable pay on base + commission structure.  Fixed hours.
cons: Unprofessional conduct by co-workers and management.  Late nights closing.  Mandatory meetings scheduled during off hours with little notice.

pros: Great work atmosphere and an amazing company to work for, who really cares about it's employees.
cons: Retail sales is still new, and due to changes, mistakes can be made.

review: Ok, keep busy with archaic processes
pros: Flexibility, benefits,  peers
cons: Don't put too much precedence in education.

pros:
By far the best company that ive worked for.
-aweome benefits.
cons:
I am pretty sure there are some cons but it depends on the person.
I personally can't think of any.

pros: Quick promotions possible and a lot of benefits to take advantage of.
cons: Job can get redundant and issues that may involve working with another are very difficult to resolve.

pros: Bonus every 3 months. Great health benefits. Good learning experience if you focus on your work on not on the ppl around you.
cons: None good company to work for

pros:
Good company 
Always growing 
Good benefits 
Free cable and Internet 
Clothes-van-gas card
Quarterly bonuses around 400$ for techs 
Quarterly bonuses for supervisors around 1300$
cons:
The pay is not great in Florida 
Techs start at 13.50
Supervisors start at around 50k
Metrics are constantly lowered and unattainable 
Treats even long term employees as a number
Terrible progression 
Very hard to move into management 
Definitely a buddy system with local management 
If you have a chance to work somewhere else, do it.

pros: Full time work plus over time.
cons: Lots of safety hazards customers dogs electricity etcetera, at least once a month your job gets harder and you don't get additional time for that but the scrutiny of your performance does get more stringent.

pros: Growth, pay, benefits, retirement, training.
cons: Politics are an issue as well as monetary resources for training.

pros: Good perks, nice people, great office location on the studio lot in LA.
cons: Not enough work for interns, no company coordinated intern activities in LA.

pros: I love the people on my team.
cons: I hate that the customer surveys effects our commission

pros: Cheap cable(if you can get it), good amount of vacation time
cons: absolutely no growth opportunity. They play favorites. You can have a supervisor do absolutely nothing,have the worst team, and get promoted for a job well done. If you are liked you will move up. If you are not you will be stuck. All the so called "leaders" come from the same place so it is very buddy buddy. It's your typical call center with a very high turn over rate.

pros: Its a great company to start working for, benefits are great
cons: The hours suck due to the nature of the business, growth can be stagnate at times

pros: Benefits are great, and so are the people.
cons: I really do love the company, I however am ready to move on to something else. Inside or outside of Comcast

pros: Good benefits, friendly environment, nice people. training are really good.
cons: wages are lower than other companies for the same work

pros: Technology company, exciting projects, cloud technology, smart co-workers.  Great cafeteria and gym in building.  Co-workers and staff are incredibly nice and welcoming.  Great employee resource groups  .
cons: Internal advancement is based on who you know.  Jobs are normally filled before posted or filled by outside contractors that are later turned full time.  No opportunity for internal advancement.

pros: Comcast has a great culture and there is room for advancement. Great benefits
cons: The starting wages for the position is below the minimum compared to other companies. High employee turnover

review: terrible if you are not Christian
pros: Good opportunities for advancement, great perks and benefits.
cons: If you celebrate holidays that aren't national holidays- they all come out of your vacation days which they are very strict with. Rarely let people work remotely if they are in accounting. They don't educate the rest of the employees to be tolerant and respectful of other emplyees religious accommodations. They make transferring between accounting groups unnecessarily complicated and difficult.

pros: The pay is good and they offer a lot of benefits to the employees.
cons: It is forceful sales environment. There is no customer service if there is no sale.

pros: Training, benefits, very helpful management,  free cable
cons: Long hiring process, took almost 3 months to finalize everything.

pros: You can set your own pace and achieve the pay you desire if you work hard.  Culture based atmosphere.
cons: Cant find other jobs that meet my current pay scale.

pros: Incredible benefits constant training managers have an open door policy
cons: Battling the Weather as its outside sales and certain customers.

pros: (Worked in Minnesota region). Strong culture, good senior leadership. Good group of supervisors who care about their employees' career experience.
cons: Large organization so the business moves quickly but policies/procedures change slowly

pros: Excellent company to work for.  Challenging position and keep employees happy.
cons: Hard to find full-time positions

pros: In this position it is ll about solving complex issues within 3 business days.  This means setting the correct expectation with the customer, typing lots of emails and constantly on the phone with leadership and building relation
cons: HIRE about 15 more people like the rest of the countries ECR team and stop over working your people

pros: Benefits, Career Opportunities, Leadership, Technology, Culture
cons: Shift availability is he only problem I would say for a account executive. Other than that it is wonderful company.

pros: Good Benefits and Friendly co-workers.
cons: 45-minute commute to Fort Myers.

pros: Benefits, flexible schedule,  employee discount
cons: Training, pay level for entry level positions

pros: Intelligent leaders, company led by a visionary, continuous learning environment, innovative technology, and evolving job opportunities.
cons: Stressful, work extends beyond normal office hours

pros: Great environment in and out of the office. Great benefits and advance products that steady a head of all others
cons: Some long hours during certain time of the year

review: Great place to work with some common flaws
pros: Great benefits, decent salary, and generally good work enviornemnt
cons: Short staffed, pay decent but won't cover your expenses if living in the metro area

pros: Benefits, employee free services, good co-workers
cons: Promotions are based on who you know, not what you know

pros: management willing to train you  and expect you to know your stuff
cons: If you are new hires, they expect you work weekends, holidyas, and weekends

pros: Great place to work, friendly atmosphere right in the heart of Center City.
cons: The elevators take too long in the morning, great problem to have.

pros: Working on your own is nice, benefits are decent, perks like tv and internet are great, over all decent culture.
cons: Work load issues can get frustrating.

pros: Great pay and easy to earn commission
cons: It’s collecting money on past due accounts, some customers get angry but most aren’t too bad.

pros: Great benefits and I loved my team
cons: I was retaliated against for cooperating in an investigation and HR didn't protect me.  The entire Comcast Listens system is a joke.   I was the top performing Supervisor in the network and jealousy from peers continued to cause Comcast Listens complaints against me.

pros:
Open communication with Supervisors
Easy access for training and growth
Emphasis on technical knowledge
cons: Will always be a major corporation first. Very susceptible to layoffs.

review: Read all the reviews before deciding
pros: Free Cable and Internet with Ok Benefits
cons: Overworked, underpaid, no time to do the jobs right.  Communication is almost non-existant.  If you really want to know what it is like to work here, watch the movie "Office Space."  That movie really hits it on the head.  Weekly meetings of "Is This Good For The company," people frantic about their job, 6 different bosses "coaching" you when you make a mistake which includes the customers.  I am not here to bash the company, however before you decide if you want to work here, do your homework on it.

pros: Benefits and pay are okay.  Some people, as anywhere, are really great.
cons: Never question management.  First knee jerk reaction is "you're the only one telling us this."  Then if you use the open door, it's the next day's news.  HR only takes side of management.  The joke was if a manager came in naked and shooting.  They defend that manager until they can't anymore.  Then as soon a a manager is gone, they bad moth them.  Not very nice people.  I was there numerous years and saw many similar cases.  As it was explained to me, they have all these policies, but only employess must follow them.

review: Great opportunites for Advancement , very flexible
pros:
Great opportunites for Advancement 
Flexible Schedules
Fair and Understanding Leasdership
cons:
Pay could be better
Better Communication between departments

review: Overall good. lower pay scale, easy work, good support
pros: great product/ 401k and benefits from day one (with matching), advancement opportunities
cons: lower end of hourly payscale compared to other companies.

pros: Great work environment, clearly laid out goals and expectations and the resources available to meet said goal, great compensation packages, family feel
cons: job can get tedious at times

review: The Upper Level Managers at Comcast in Lynnwood are complete idiots!
pros: Free cable and internet service.
cons: Senior level managers are completely disengaged from their employees and only about "me me me". The HR department is about the worst group of managers I've ever met in an organization. They are selfish, do not care about employees, are constantly on power/control trips and have no business working in human services. No room for advancement unless you're literally kissing a Director or VP's behind. Pay sucks too.

review: Good company, comes with the corporate world bull
pros: Free cable and Internet and fairly competitive salary
cons: Once you are here, pay raises are laughable

pros: Get to work with lots of really smart people working on cool projects, that will be used by millions
cons: Things can move slow at times with a company of this size

review: comcast is the best company i ever worked for
pros: good pay mgmt cares great benefits
cons: got laid off because they went to a all retention center and dont have tech support anymore in the spgs

review: Wonderful company with great cable tv service.
pros: One of the best cable services in the country. They have some very talented employees.
cons: Upper management has a very twisted outlook on their employees. Churn and burn them is their motto. Marketing is exploited because they are not regulated and can attack competition in the media.

review: Love being part a company that's a leader in technology
pros: Great work environment and awesome benefits
cons: The train ride in is a pain when the weather is bad

pros: steady work,good benifits.,nice people.,uptodate equiptment.
cons: out of state management. has absolutely no idea on how a warehouse is being run.

pros: Chance for better opportunity and advancement. People seem to really care if you succeed. They actually give great advice on how to act and position yourself.
cons: None thus far.  Just started employment.

pros: Great benefits and free cable and internet
cons: Limited ability to advance due to long tenured management

review: Superior career with Comcast Corporation for Four Years
pros: Great Organization and superior leadership
cons: Antiquated and Stagnated with helping to advance careers

pros: Fun environment, down to earth management, descent pay, a lot of perks and incentives
cons: unruly customers, must have tough skill to work in the billing department

pros: a lot of perks. 401k match, free cable, great people. huge work place - room for growing.
cons: none. this is a great place to wkr.

pros: They have great benefit, free cable, internet and phone is cheap, prizes and promotions and flexible schedules
cons: Its a call center.  Moral is not as high as it should be, management is all about its on teams, no support when need for escalations.  There are opportunities for growth but usually you have to know someone in the departments

pros: Very good money and benefits and extremely flexible hours.
cons: None of the managers truly care about their reps.

pros: Raise about every 6 months
cons: The only advancement opportunities is to accept a position with Maintenance or Commercial department.

pros: Great Leadership Training Courses, Cutting Edge Technology Products and Services for selling opportunities, Outstanding benefits and 401K package!
cons: Most Field Sales Managers and Sales Supervisors lack outside selling experience. Most are technological savvy but have insufficient training and staff development skills.  These traits are well known by all and greatly affect the sales department morale and create other problems.

pros: Great company to work for if your looking to advance your career, pay is reasonable to industry standards
cons: Proficient training for new hires in this paticular position.

pros: Good company to work for
cons: not many cons, really like my job

review: They were okay to work for
pros: Discount on cable and internet service. Benefits such as the amount of time off and sick days that you get per year are good
cons: used to be a great company to work for but over the years they got to be too big and too greedy and have lost sight of quality customer service and product.

pros: Earning potential,  benefits, flexible hours, good culture, great training, and others
cons: Potentially stressful situations, late-ish hours on weekdays, vacation inhibiting commission structure

pros: Tons of terrific perks, free cable and internet, stock options, stock purchase, 401k match, and options of benefits.
cons: Attracts traditional telecom sales reps but does not allow enough time to understand the cable culture and how that can benefit them.  They spend too much valuable time mining old accounts to learn most can not be serviced, then the clock starts to tick for them to build a pipeline, but too many run out of time and are released.

pros: competitive pay , healthcare ( $350 month and $400 delectable ) 401K , big cable/HSD discount ( not totally free) quarterly bonus,
cons: They have no concern for the lives of the people that work their. Lots of night work, and on call a lot.  lots of last minute work

pros: The company matches my contribution 100%! Up to 4.5% of my contribution.
cons: I had to wait 90 days for it to kick in

pros: Great leadership, work culture, salary and benefits
cons: there is pssure to sale customer and AHT metric is hard hit based on the call flow

pros: This company is an excellent place to work for.
cons: Communication for this company is not as good as it can be.

pros: Good benefits free cable and internet and career and free school money.
cons: More training for new hires

pros: Love the hugely discounted rates for home cable, internet and phone service.
cons: Micromanagement at it's best by mid-level managers who are unorganized and lack proper follow up skills to enable their Sales Professionals to do their jobs efficiently and effectively. Too much political nonsense that doesn't make sense and the excuses for their behaviors don't add up.

pros: Good benefits, Good people, strong values.
cons: Not much room for development. Pay is OK but could be better.

pros: Benefits, team mates, compensation and love
cons: Poor Supervision, poor compensation (expensive) terrible hiring practices too much micro management of minutiae

review: Exceptional company to work for, depressing job
pros: Exceptional company to work for, depressing job
cons: you deal with grouchy rude customers all day

pros: Great Store Managers. Managers should be promoted or made able to make decisions that affect customers and employees.  Managers are invested in the growth of their employees.
cons: Mid-level managers are threatened by front line and front line leadership.  They focus on negatives. Favoritism at the regional level. Some higher leaders don't even speak to the front line.

pros: Company vehicle, advancement opportunities, good pay, great benefits, down to earth management
cons: Can be hectic at certain times of the year

pros: Great company with good benefits and interesting problems to solve
cons: Big company where it is hard to get things done some of the time

pros: Great benefits, upward mobility, fun place to work
cons: negative work-life balance. Long hours and tons of stress

pros: Amazing Company, Competitive pay, Great Benefits
cons: long hours, harsh conversations at time with customers

pros: Excellent benefits, great company to work for.
cons: Company in located in an area where I am moving to.

pros: Very good place to work, would recommend a friend
cons: Too much metrics . Almost every year metrics changes, and it gets  tougher.

pros: The co workers and staff are great, good benefits and decent pay.
cons:
High turnover rate... I was hired for one job and 6 months later they thought it would be a good idea to change all the billing reps into repair agents. Stressful!!!
Comcast makes it seem like they value their employees but in the long run you will just be another number.
 If you enjoy getting yelled at by customers on a daily basis, this is the job for you!

pros: fun environment. ever job at every house is different. Technology is updated regularly.
cons: upper management tends to show favoritism versus someone who has done or knows the job at hand over 5+ years. moving up can prove very difficult as every year metrics get tighter and tighter.

pros: Amazing benefits!! Such as healthcare, time off and courtesy services
cons: Customers are overwhelming sometimes

pros: Great company benefits, opportunity to grow if you are willing to relocate.
cons: Poor opportunity to advance your career if you work in a remote territory and cannot relocate.

pros: Great pay, great benefits, solid products and attainable quotas
cons: Poor upper management, inability to navigate change

pros: Great benefits. Free services for employee. A lot of paid time off after probation period.
cons: Even as tech support the company requires all agents to make sales. Policy changes, changes to systems are not communicated in a timely manner to efficiently do your job. Call volume extremely high with not very much support.

pros: Dress code isn't strict, benefits are amazing
cons: Advancement sometimes seems to depend on relationship and not necessarily work ethic

review: Pretty Good Company to work for if you can work with little supervision
pros: Take the service vehicle home, discounted services, independent working environment, good training.
cons: lack of engagement with management team.

pros: Positive work environment that promotes positive attitudes, hospitality, and fair treatment.
cons: Company is large so interactions with higher-ups can seem impersonal, but overall not a huge issue.

pros: Collaborate, supportive atmosphere. Forward thinking, creative, and flexible.
cons: There are a lot of politics you need to navigate.

pros:
Work at your own pace while maintaining a set schedule
Management is good
cons: worklife balance is tuff if you dont plan your days better.

pros: The benefits are great and the pay is comparable
cons: Getting the necessary parts to do the job can be challenging at times.

pros: The people in this company are truly invested in helping you succeed
cons: The company is so large that learning what is going on in the business is very challenging

pros: Lots of room for growth and change of role within company.
cons: Takes a year to move to a new position once starting work for them.

pros: Comcast has great perks and benefits.
cons: eveything else, turnover is rampit and you are expected to train new hires while having to meet your metrics. nothing matters except metrics, which is get when you know how to fudge the numbers which is easy to do. But everything goes off metrics, so don't do any extra because none of those things are conisder in your reviews. It's just your metrics, that a supervisor prints out right before they give you your review and just read off your stats.

pros: The benefits. Free cable services and the tutition reimbursement are great. You can't beat free TV, Internet, and $15 a month phone service. And management is always willing to adjust work schedules to fit school schedules.
cons: Only way to get promoted or to move to another department is to know someone. Favoritism does rule this company. The company only cares about getting services installed and not about it working correctly. There is no accountability on the field techs to do their job or the customer service reps to do thiers either. Only thing anyone is held accountable for are their sales metrics.

pros: My colleagues at comcast were some of the best I've ever worked with.  If it wasn't for them, I wouldn't have stayed there as long as I did.
cons: The work at Comcast was very monotonous and I felt that the hardwork I was putting in wasn't appreciated as much as it should've been.

pros: It is a job to have in order to find another job. Very easy to get hired, will hire anybody who walks in asking for a job. You get free cable and internet with all the channels. You also get access to alot of different discounts for different products through the company. They have contests and giveaways for different reasons. Paid holidays off.
cons: The supervisors are ghetto. Everything is very unorganized and the pay is crappy and for telesales you can only do part time. If you work on special projects you get LESS commission. I quit as soon as I was able to locate another job with better benefits I fled.

pros: Easy job,  no skills needed.
cons: Very Stressful. If Cable goes out for 10 min some people flip out and go crazy.  Some of the on site tech's are outsourced and lack customer service skills.  If they even show up at all.  This makes people very mad and they will take it all out on you.  CAE's customer service highest waited metric is sales and not the ability to fix anything or help people.

review: A busy place with lots of problems to solve.
pros:

pros: Benefits, pay, and moderate flexibility

Goals are clear but how you go about attaining them is lacking guidance. Supervisors arrive to work late, go to lunch, and then leave early. They preferred not to be bothered. 
People really do not like door to door sales people.

review: decent company to work for with same culture as most other big corporations in US
pros: competitive pay, good perks & benefits, paid vacation, friendly atmosphere within your team
cons: very little room and opportunity for promotion, odd rules and regulations, upper management with their ideas is definitely from another planet with no common sense at all, lack of communication between departments

pros: Lots of good people, excellent benefits, growing company, cutting edge technology
cons: Very bottom line oriented.  They are not happy with earning 50% margins, which other companies would kill for.  If you are in what is considered "administration" i.e. finance, accounting, HR, Gov't relations, etc, your job can be eliminated at a moments notice.  Once you leave the company, it's virtually impossible to get back in.  Older workers looking for mid level managerial positions are not in demand.

pros: The company takes care of its people financially with perks and benefits. The product is by far the best on the market.
cons: It is very apparent why Comcast is consistently in the bottom of customer service. Its a communications company that doesn't communicate very well. Many of the higher level employees have no idea what is happening in the bottom levels of the company.

pros: Smart management team with some talented employees. Strong engineering focus and product vision.
cons: Overly opinionated with old school ways of

pros: Great medical and dental benefits.  On-site cafeteria is cool, although they should try to serve more food that is actually healthy.
cons: Salaries are less than average.  Inexperienced managers that hide in their offices.  No real leadership.  Boring, gray cube farm atmosphere.

pros: Collegial atmosphere.  Everyone works together.
cons: Compensation is not on par in the Sales Support Group.

pros: Room for advancement. Energetic atmosphere.
cons: No one has any authority. No cross training.

pros: Very employee friendly in pay and benefits.  Opportunities for career development.  Mature leadership team.
cons: Constant structural and strategic change create a lot of uncertainty for employees.

job title: Care Agent, Tier I, Business Services

review: It is a decent place to work for.

I have not one god thing to say except that if you are looking to work for shady managers and an even more shady and unethical director, then this is the place for you.

review: Is verbal abuse really worth it $13.50/hour??

cons: No time off phones for any reason.  Verbal abuse from the public that you can't do anything about but sit there and keep your mouth shut for fear of being "un-hired". You NEVER have a perfect call rating and the Voice of the Customer survey rating system is quited flawed, as admitted to by the company, however even after call review, the score cannot be removed and in the end it affects your rated.

review: Do not waste your time with this company!

cons: The Direct Sales Department is extremely disorganized. The management team is inconsistent and often shows favoritism so the work environment tends to be political. Dishonest practices are well known yet ignored my money hungry individuals of management and the company does not provide enough internal support to maintain the sales after they have been acquired. They are only satisfied with the initial sale.

pros:
Almost free cable package,
The company wont go out of business
The building has heat and air conditioning
cons:
To succeed, you must mislead and lie to customers daily.  
"trust me, adding the tv saves you money"  wink, wink...not really.

If an existing customer calls in with a problem with their service, we are required to go through a series of questions aimed at trying to sell them something.  We do this, rather than transferring them to the department they wanted to speak with, and can help them with the problem.   But we all still must remember ...."the customers experience is our best product!"

pros: Good company if you get the system down.  You can make good money

Comcast will only thrive with new and innovative thinking and a true commitment to the customer experience.

pros: Great people to work with in house, great benefits, and perks.
cons: If you want to work here and are a dedicated employee for 14 plus years and treated like a number and are let go for something you didn't do, on a loop hole they found to get rid of you, then this job is definitely for you! Top Management are Robots

pros:
if u live close you can take your van home
Most people you work with are helpful

My schedule
cons:

pros: Good job, friendly staff, flexible, Overtime
cons: Mandatory overtime, pay is not so great

pros: Company vehicle, discounted video, voice and internet. Fun outside work.
cons: Some days are a lot harder than others.

pros: solid training and forward thinking always changing to keep up with the industry
cons: constant change is a plus but it can be a challenge as well.

pros:
Great benefits 
Paid Time off

Work/Life balance hard

pros: Tuition reimbursement, free cable, medical benefits and room for promotion.
cons: None that I could think of, the company as a whole takes care of their employees.

pros: Great leadership, lots of potential
cons: Travel for training, lack of communication when starting job

pros: Stable business offering various career opportunities.
cons: Top heavy organization leading to misalignment and confusion around collaboration process. Multiple stakeholders with competing priorities.

pros:
Great Benefits 
Compensation
Nice office environment
cons: New products released with known issues that required work arounds

pros: Great benefits for employees. Great technology which is innovative.
cons: They need to focus more on employee work life balnce.

pros: Good Benefits. Take Home truck. Discounted Cable services
cons: Held to standards that most supervisors can't do. Disconnect within the company i.e. The cae will promise a customer something that we just can't do, and we have to do it. Every mistake the company makes falls on the fulfillment tech. Training is non-existent. The cable plant is terrible which is why it goes out all the time. Very hard to get promoted..! Favoritism.

pros: Good benefits, time off, work environment.
cons: Management doesn't seem to take mental health seriously.

pros: Great Benefits, Great personal and a good atmosphere.
cons: No advancements and no room to grow.. Job security very low but overall a very good company.

pros: Free internet / cable for employees, good time off policies and other benefits
cons: Projects can move slowly at times with too many stakeholders

review: Average Corporation. Some great people in some departments
pros: Medium Average Pay. Great Benefits. Some managers have good flexibility
cons: Some managers :(. Tend to stress out over nothing.

pros: Relaxed work environment with good leadership and great chance to work with new technologies and good people.
cons: The benefits and the pay are not the best.

pros: Great perks.  Leadership changes over night.  Good pay. Nice offices.
cons: No balance. Leadership jumps all over the place.  Very hostile towards peers.

review: Customers can be overbearing at times....
pros: I really enjoyed the work environment. Everyone was quite helpful and friendly. I was hired as a customer accounts executive, working primarily with customer billing discrepancies. If you have tough skin, I would definitely recommend the job.
cons: I didn't realize how stressful the job was. The customers were very overbearing at times. I dealt with customers consistantly cursing at me and using racial slurs. Management was often aggressive in terms of sales. I didn't realize that sales was the main focus of my job.

pros: Good benefits, great pay, quarterly bonus, free services
cons: Meeting stats each month, having to sale products to angry customers

pros: My co-workers were great and I loved my employees that I supervised.
cons: Upper management really did not seem to care about the front line employees and did not take our say in the matter into consideration much.  Felt very dictatorial.  Customers had unrealistic expectations.  No cross departmental communication.

pros: Work ethic is excellent and higher management is awesome!
cons: I am from Dallas Location and prefer working from remote or from dallas location.

pros: Employees are treated well and the management genuinely cares about staff.
cons: Some departments have high turnover and lack competent staff causing poor customer experience.

review: Great pay and benefits. Horrible anything else company wise
pros: Best thing about working here is the pay, commission, && benefits. Do your research && make sure you're ready to deal with this type of work
cons: Dealing with the customers issues && having to fix them even if it wasn't possible. A lot of calls were due to techs not doing their job or billing cold transferring calls just bc they don't wanna deal with the customer. Now you have to take responsibility of an issue you know nothing about.

pros: Excellent benefit package, nice building, great location and interesting work.
cons: Health insurance doesn't start until after your 3rd month with the company.

pros: Great innovative company,  Hard driving, goal motivated ,
cons: Comcast is a hard driving company most like the pace i did

pros: Great people and working environment
cons: Management tended to overlook slackers and have others carry the weight

pros: large organization with opportunities to move
cons: slow to make decisions.   Many projects go nowhere

pros: Great commission structure, great money.
cons: They have taken away a few advantages to making selling Comcast an easier buy.

pros: Great People, great team, Colorado Management is not right for New Mexico
cons: comcast needs to spend more money in New Mexico

pros:
Co Workers are a plus, 
Some of the benefits like discounted service. 
Nothing else... really.
cons:
Management doesn't care about employees.
The pay is ridiculous for the amount of responsibility and work your doing daily. 
Long work days 
Not enough time off for family.
Will never highlight your good qualities but very fast to get you on paper for 1 or 2 mistakes that you might make.

pros: Great place to work with great benefits!
cons: Sitting at a desk all day on the phone

pros: Overall great working environment and lucky to be a part of.
cons: Very slow in getting things done as a company

pros: Great coworkers! They compensate the fact that we barely receive any assistance from supervisors or even management.
cons: All of the supervisors on the floor show available on the chat, but rarely answer any questions. It's a pain in the butt to escalate a call to a supervisor. It makes the job very stressful.  Supervisors don't work at all. It's sad but true.

pros: Excellent training and the compensation is phenomenal if your a producer. Snowflakes and excuse makers need not apply.
cons: Typical bureaucracy of large corporations

pros: Customer facing and direct contact employees are great at what they do.
cons: Upper management lacks knowledge of the department they run. Technicians are in a hostile work-environment. Poor competitive wages compared to other companies.  Being innovative and creative is not encouraged.

pros: Benefits, Pay,  and Policies
cons: Shifts, Management ,  and work life balance

pros: Benefits. 2 weeks vacation given automatically to new hires. Ramp commission to get you into the flow of things.
cons: Have not been present with one yet.

review: No work life balance at all
pros: free cable and internet and that's about it
cons: angry customers, angry customers, angry customers. no one is ever happy to talk to Comcast. late hours, little choice in your schedule, my manager was always socializing..I had to ask her to provide coaching, etc.

pros: Work tasks can be a bit challenging but nothing that one can't overcome
cons: Great benefits, Family enviornment, career growth and development

pros: Good pay and Great people to work with.
cons: When I mean allot of change I mean allot of change.

pros: Gives their employees a lot or perks and benefits.
cons: None that I can think of at this time

review: It really sucks I wish I could leave but can’t find anything else to do .
pros: Free cable and internet, take truck home, and if you do your job right.  You doubt have to deal with management bs
cons: They take care of new employees much better then the loyal and more experienced techs.  Culture of fraud, management always falsifies documents to make number better to meet bonuses.

pros: Great schedule, flexible, management was amazing. They promote from within.
cons: With promoting from with some supervisors were not successful in building skills within their team members.

pros: Good pay for the work, good benefits, great couple workers. Mostly great supervisors.
cons: Really I can't think of any cons. It's a great job overall.

pros: So many great benefits! Dr on demand, free cable, internet, home security, they treat their employees very well.
cons: The company is hated by many people.

pros: Great culture and opportunity to move up and around.
cons: Sometimes work goes with you when your off

pros: Great benefits package, medical, vision, dental, and retirement
cons: Inexperienced managers are hired to run teams that have been successful.

pros: You can progress within the company
cons: Not enough hours for me. I would like more

pros: Great Place to work and fast to grow
cons: Metris that should not be accountant for the position you are in.

pros: A good company to work for.
cons: Medical Benefits are pretty bad

pros:
Great company and benefits
large payout if you stick around
You can go just about anywhere in the company
cons:
New pay scale
slow moving up

pros: Enjoy working a sales team, company perks and benefits
cons: Different departments don't collaborate on a common goal

pros: Benefits package and 401k matching
cons: metrics system for promotion, for TechOps, is flawed. Underpaid for what we did.

pros: Great Benefits, 4-10s work schedule, Medical, Dental, Education Assistance, quarterly bonuses. Easy to advance throughout the company
cons: Pay starts of low but with time raises

pros: Pay, benefits, there are a few really amazing leaders.
cons: Politics, you're at the mercy of "opinion wars" more often than not, egocentric leaders.

pros: free cable, phone and internet and pretty good health benefits. They do provide materials and clothing so thats a plus. but I'd rather earn more money than ecieve free work gear.
cons: Lack of consistency and commision pay scale changes. It seems everytime sales reps make headway and good money they change pay out criteria and lower your pay. Meeting s are like broken records or cds same thing meeting after meeting. products are over priced which makes for tough sales. lack of sales support. my office has 30 reps and one order entry person. do the math and figure that out.

review: Living in constant fear of losing my job.
pros: Great benefits, free cable and internet, lots of paid time off.
cons:
Mostly Inept middle and upper management
Complete shut-down in communication
No job security
Promotions not based on merits

review: I enjoy my job and the people I work with.
pros: The compay does care about it's empoloyees.
cons: Lots of pressure to get better.

pros: Decent pay for the area. Great benefits. Free cable and internet. Huge discount on phone service and home security.
cons: Raises are sometimes based on things out of your control

pros: Free cable, great benefits, and reasonable hours
cons: Inexperienced management, extreme pressure, insults, high school drama atmosphere, very unprofessional

review: A great company to work for!
pros: Great benefits and understanding about family.
cons: Sometimes pay does not match effort and hours.

pros: Large stable and reputable company
cons: Too many employees, you become a number to most.

review: Comcast is good for services, but bad for prices
pros: Internet is very awesome to use
cons: I hate the poor pricing due to state taxes for services.

review: I have had a pretty good experience with this company.
pros: Good pay, they treat their employees fairly, the products are good, they listen to feedback from their employees, cheap cable for employees!
cons: Customers frequently complain about their support, corporate makes decisions that might save them money in the short term, but hurt efficiency and cost money in the long term.

pros: Pays was competitive, good training, not much room to expand an IT career in the IP support.
cons: crazy shift hours, your schedule depends on your groups performance.

review: Like everywhere, it's all about the people
pros: Great benefits, good people to work with, and the ability to be heard
cons: A lot of secrecy...everything is hush hush

review: Comcast is a stable company, as a Field Tech, if you do your job you will have a job.
pros: Once you are employed all the communication services are free to employees, at least when I worked there.
cons: They should be more realistic about the amount of quality work a Tech can do in one day. This could be better now, when I was there a tech could have more appointments than he could ever meet.

review: Constantly changing but very little improvement
pros: Great co-workers and wonderful benefits (free cable and internet). Working in the new tower is very nice. Great views of the city.
cons: Lots of incompetent managers who only care about moving up the corporate ladder. Lots of turf wars. Pay is generally lower than industry standards.

review: Loved it at first - then restructuring twice in one year was too much
pros: Good salary and benefits; good technical infrastructure and support; loved people I worked with
cons: Training was minimal; company values were positive on the surface, but once you had been there a while you saw this to be untrue. Too many changes, restructuring, and reductions in force in small period of time left a dissatisfied culture.

pros: Benefits and Salary not much else.
cons: So much, where do I start?! Sleazy upper management that does whatever they want and are NEVER there to support their newer staff members. Metrics are not reasonable in sales, they treat staff more like children, uptight, no room for growth no matter what they say to the contrary, the environment is dog eat dog ( sales staff steal each others sales. Literally!) Sales staff will go into database, remove your sales rep ID and put in theirs. That is ridiculous, but the only way to meet the quotas. This is by far the worst job I have ever had!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

pros: Benefits and i love the culture
cons: schedule is sometimes challenging but i love it

pros: Absolutely just a job. If you cannot find something else, this is a place for last resort. If you like to lie to customers, smile in there faces and cheat them, this job is for you.
cons: If you refuse to screw customers Comcast will screw you. There are billing issues in store locations which they will tell you if you fix them you will lose money. If a customer comes to disconnect it goes against you. Also if you get three bad reviews you lose 283.00 dollars for that month, voice of the customer. If a customer is leaving Comcast you will get bad reviews.

pros: Good Benefits, great atmosphere, nice perks.
cons: No room for advancement from my department

pros: Great experience, benefits, lots to learn, Lots of innovation going on
cons: If you work in downtown be prepared for commute time

pros: Comcast really promotes networking and networking events for its interns. Employees are very friendly to newcomers.
cons: Dull intern work. To be expected.

review: Most professional and employee focus job I've ever had.
pros: Fun Environment, Great benefits, Great Training.
cons: I havent found any so far.

pros: A 4 day work week, company vehicle goes home with you everyday, discount on company services, good benefits as far as medical, dental, and life insurance.
cons: Mostly all non union shops, starting pay is very low considering the type of work required of it technicians. On going changes to the technology with very little hands on training prior to using/installing the new products.

review: Take the good with the bad
pros: Great benefits and time off
cons: Numbers are more important than customer service

review: If you are a white, male, automaton, Comcast is for you.
pros: Good benefits. Nice physical workspace in the Comcast Center with lots of natural light.
cons: Culture of employees was one of just working for a paycheck versus thinking about and building innovative solutions to address the needs of customers.

pros: Great medical/dental, 401k, and service benefits.  Company is stable and continues to grow.  Will always be a company in the top tier of the communication business.
cons: Management scared to make decisions.  Pushed for numbers rather than reinforcing the processes that make the numbers.  Everyone looks out for themselves rather than what is right.

pros: good pay, training is paid 20/ and hour and commission is good, 401k, health insurance
cons: not flexible work schedule, coaching, always changing policies

pros: Great place to work, good perks
cons: Compensation on Low end of the pay scale for Atlanta. Should be comparable to other large cities

pros: Great perks like free tv & internate. Great wok / home balance, The commission structure is well configured,
cons: not to much communication between dept.

pros: Great people to work with, extra help when requested if needed. Uncapped  soon  Commission.
cons: The rules should apply to everyone.

review: Great at the local level...Frustrating at the corporate level.
pros: The Springfield crew is very competent and a great group to work with.  Once the job gets to dispatch or sales, good luck!
cons: The job pays well, but comes with a lot of stress mostly induced by the dispatch system.  Basing a job on points and expecting a tech to uphold all your installation standards doesn't mix.

pros: Great Company that is nearly everywhere in nation and courtesy cable package for employees is nice otherwise Not many here since 2012 company has been setting unrealistic gates to obtain commission within comp plan, have to be self motivated individual.
cons: lots of driving around mileage expense was done away with and expect to work every weekend as well as nights.

pros: Good benefits, great  commission,  you meet many people at such a large company
cons: When someone's making money the others losing money(customer)  so often times many struggle with ethics. Mostly management is way to comfortable. Not a company you want to stay long at. Get in and get out!

pros: Great company to work for as a college student. Great innovation. Great pay. Lots of fun.
cons: Not really any cons for being an intern.

pros: Co-workers are mostly nice and helpful, extensive training(though it is not adequate.)
cons:
Training department is not given accurate information.
Management acts like they care, but actually are out for themselves only.
Organization is "a family" but actually is mostly individuals who are mostly out for themselves.  Lying is common from management.

review: Best Place I have worked for
pros: Comcast values their employees, tons of growth opportunities, benefits
cons: When you say you work for Comcast, people like to complain

review: Good when in the right department
pros: Excellent benefits. PTO and vacation. Job security.
cons: If you're in sales or business services, you'll love your job. If you're in technical operations it's not favorable. The departments don't communicate well. There's never ample enough training for success. You can virtually never leave tech ops and transition to other departments. They base growth off of politics and emotions, not whether or not you can do the job. They also very seldom promote women in this department.

pros: Good pay and resonable hours
cons: Set your performance and pace in order to move up.

pros: The executive leadership team is very transparent and wants everyone's feedback about different projects.
cons: I can't think of anything

pros: Large territory to sell, great benefits, stable Company, a lot of freedom to sell, free cable. 2014-2015 were the best years to work there.
cons: Upper management in 2016 is the worst in the History of Comcast. B2B Sales is no longer what it used to be. Lack of communication between Sales Reps, Tech Ops, Order entry Team in Manchester which on the end affect the customer experience. Base salary for a BAE is really low compare to all the other companies.

pros: Great benefits, 401k, bonuses. Also you get really good discounts for your cable
cons: It is very hard to move up, and management is very disorganized

pros: Fast paced, team oriented, and lots of opportunities to contribute and learn.
cons: Typical communication gaps with large companies but it is improving.

pros: The amount of commission you can make is great. They have other great incentives as well like trips and they gave away a car one year.
cons: No one is ever happy to speak with you and it can be emotionally draining. Especially when the calls are back to back all day.

pros: Fast pace  and exciting environment with
cons: Unable to resolve some issues

pros: Quick application and interview process
cons: Door to door sales is a thing of the past

pros: Great company who appreciates my talent as a corporate instructor/coach.
cons: On an airplane way to often.

pros: Only really speaking to the technicians and others who understand the product
cons: little notice before change often times nobody including upper management knew that anything changed

pros: Great benefits,matching 401k, stock option, deeply discounted cable services
cons: A lot of overtime depending on weather conditions, supervisors don't really support your thoughts on problems

pros: Paid training all uniforms and travel expenses paid. Tools paid for no layoffs
cons: Miscommunication between sales and customers, techs deal with the repercussions

pros: Great work culture, good benefits and very stable environment.
cons: Some times its tough to maintain your job as managers can be very demanding.

pros: Great people, great benefits, ok to make mistakes
cons: Very hard to move up

pros: Great work environment with wonderful people in upper management.
cons: As the center has grown it has lost some of its original liveliness.

pros: Great health benefits and PTO. Discounted services from Comcast and other companies. Tuition reimbursement.
cons: Large company. Comp is below industry standards.

pros: Best place to work as a software developer .You will learn alot working here,.
cons: I donot any cons to convey.I enjoyed working here

pros: The work life balance is great, compensation, managers, food, flexible scheduling.
cons: There really isn't anything bad about working here.

pros: Flexible schedule and laid back. Great Morale and energetic work enviroment
cons: Traffic commute to work is bad , and there is no overtime.

pros: Recognition for hard work, steady progression
cons: Long hours with overtime many days

pros: People are great, partnerships very strong, profitable company, benefits are great.
cons: Work/life balance, culture is an issue.

pros: Environment, training, benefits, salary...way too many pros to list!
cons: Schedules can change frequently, but they always try and work around your schedule.

pros: great place  to work for anyone looking for a career with customers
cons: not enough management to handle everyone

pros: Liked the technical aspect of the job. Lots of job perks.
cons: Just had a hard time with one manager who would blame others for his choices.

pros: Great Benefits and Great Pay
cons: activity is micromanaged.  There's too much focus on doors knocked and what time you start knocking

pros: Great perks, good insurance, a lot of room to move around the country but stay with the company
cons: Getting cursed out about cable

pros: Good People, Fast Pace Environment, Good Benefits/Pay, Flex Time, WFH Policy
cons: Leadership within the IT Environment is often lackluster, longer term vision isn't always available

pros: change, career path, growing company, benefits
cons: reputation and feeling stuck in a current position

pros: Care about employees and customers
cons: The company's bad reputation with some customers and with net neutrality

pros: Videography, editing special projects, working with clientele
cons: Job has become mediocre, not challenging enough

review: Review of an era in the life of a Tech Supervisor.
pros: Gain experience in the telecommunications field and achieve self worth .
cons: Some in leadership possess motives and ideals that are dangerous to the atmosphere that the company possesses. Some are not held to the same rules as others at a lower level.

pros: Work life balance, great leadership,
cons: Customer can be very disrespectful at times as you might expect.

pros: Big company, good pay, entry level sales job, support of a big corporate entity
cons: Workers are just cogs In the machine. Political games played all through the company. Company reputation is horrible . I was laid off as a restructure right before christmas

pros: Very customer service focused - strives to be better
cons: Be very careful with what you say anything that is heard will be shared at meetings

pros: Emerging tech company, ambition beyond simply selling cable and Internet
cons: External perceptions, still too slow at decision making

pros: Great tools to help do your job
cons: Repetitive work when you are assigned ticket work

pros: Solid benefits, a lot of opportunities to move around the company.
cons: Salary could be better and the inline promotion system could also be improved

pros: Great benefits, Set hours, Great Commission
cons: High call volume, unrealistic metrics, rarely any overtime, Very stressful

pros: Great Benefits,   Best-in-class products,  Awesome Earning Potential
cons: They're working on back office support. Not quite where it needs to be... just yet.

pros: Great benefits, Employees have a voices,
cons: Workload is non-stop, Pay increase is based stats

pros: Comcast is a good job good benefits ok pay
cons: Pay could be alot better forthe scope of work

pros: Great benefits with cable and tuition reimbursement.
cons: Sometimes work days can be long than expected.

pros: 3 days off per week; good benefits
cons: Too much micromanaging; mainly poorly trained contractor work

pros:
Good benefits
Once you're in...you're in.  You have to really mess up to get fired as a perm employee.
Work isn't difficult.
Middle managers have a good rapport with their employees
cons:
Senior Management yells at employees during stressful times.
Pay is low.
Peers seem unmotivated...gov't type atmosphere.
Office is terrible.  They didn't even provide coffee for their employees.
Training is unorganized

review: Best pay ever as a sales rep
pros: Freedom Pay Management  Company life Schedule
cons: A lot of change all the time

review: My experience at Comcast was great!
pros: Complimentary service, good pay for position, great environment, bonuses and incentives, superb benefits package.
cons: Moved jobs out of state

review: With a good focus, you can go anywhere
pros: Great benefits and fun culture.  Trainers and co-workers really embrace a team ethos
cons: Office politics, as with any professional career field

pros: Great experience for new up and comers to sell and learn the telecommunications business.
cons: It is competitive, so don't look for a hand out.

pros: great company benefits were great
cons: Working in a call center environment was great just making sure you stay in compliance. Which at times can be hard.

pros: Professional atmosphere to work. Able to move within the company. Superior products and a great price. I love the people I work with.
cons: The inner communication at Comcast is bad at best. There is difinately room for improvement there. Also, there are two many sales reps chasing too few businesses. The compensation plan was good, now its horrible.

pros: Good for a paycheck if you have the motivation to get a door slammed in your face all day
cons: Micromangement, No room to advance because once someone has an administrative position they never leave, easily pigeon-holed as a salesman for life, many mid-level positions are filled by outside hires.

pros: A lot opportunities to do great stuff.
cons: Watch your back, and around.

pros: Free cable, phone, and internet
cons: There is a high risk of injury when having to go up the poles to run cable

pros: Money is great, overtime is almost always available. You really determine your check based off how hard you work with commission.
cons: Disorganized company, rude and always angry customers, lots or pressure from supervisors/managers and higher up but very little support to help you do your job.

pros: Great benefits and ability to move up
cons: Trying too hard to be like google but without the salary to back it up

pros: Great work environment. Plenty of support
cons: Because it is expanding so quickly, it may be difficult to adapt to the always changing procedures.

pros: Overall a good place.  Good benefits, usually a good work-life balance and plenty of resources to accomplish projects.
cons: Sometimes antiquated software, processes and always fast-paced.

review: The work was interesting and challenging.
pros: A solid company with a lot of opportunities for advancement.
cons: working in the city requires paying the city wage tax

pros: everything i needed to know was explained in detail.
cons: they conduct behavioral interview. i feel that this type of interview is ineffective.

review: It's okay for entry level work
pros: Tons of paid time off; Holidays, vacation, sick.. You only see your managers once a week.
cons: The company is getting too big and starting to miss what customer service is about.The dollar signs are blinding corporate. There is no more "get it right the first time," anymore. It has become "do it the quickest way possible and customer service be damned."

review: Fun people but lack luster management
pros: Good pay and flexible hours and a friendly environment as far as coworkers are concerned. If you meet your goals everyone leaves you to your own devices.
cons: Management struggles with understanding the needs of the team as far as our daily schedule goes. Also the job includes a lot of customer service problem solving which is not in the job description.

pros: The job is super easy and it is REALLY  what you make
cons: There are alot of numbers to adhere too, and the sales ethics is... well, its getting better. ;/

pros: good pay and benefits package
cons: internal conflicts with employees and managment

pros: great hours, great pay ; difficult job with a suprising amount of flexibility
cons: axed my department; cost saving decision

review: Should have listened to the reviews
pros: A bunch of time off. But needed from all the negativity.
cons: Felt like a slave, sell sell sell, a lot of the call where customers who you really couldn't help because they were older people who barely knew what a remote was. When going back for orientation, one worker stood up and said "Lets see how long this class lasts!" Getting cussed out for half your shift and all this for 11.00/hr. Yep I left. Right to work state in Tennessee and really happy where I ended up. Nobody I talked to there liked the place but for them, it is a job.

review: Good Company to grow a career
pros:
Biggest employer in Philadelphia.
Good products.
Friendly coworkers
cons:
Compensation could be more competitive.
Watch out for layoffs at the end of the year

pros: Benefits are good, pay is okay, leadership listens well mostly. Room for promotions very possible
cons: Bad work life Balance for certain departments

review: Never a dull momement, constantly changing, always something new
pros: Supportive working envirenment from leadership to co-workers
cons: work/life balance, buggy applications and systems

pros: Great company outings, 401k match,working independently,good group of other sales reps,cheap tv internet phone costs.
cons: Using your own vehicle for sales calls. Selling home security. Clients didn't pass credit and needed deposits. Techs that were late for start up service. Clients were just pissed off about comcast.

review: Good place to work... if you can deal with all stress.
pros: Great benefits. Great workplace culture.
cons: Too many stats to achieve and very irrate customers.

review: Great sales environment, lots of room for growth!
pros: Ever expanding company, lots of upward mobility, strong pay.
cons: Public Image, large company = plenty of red tape

pros: Excellent company to work for. Great opportunities to grow!
cons: Providing opportunities for a diverse workforce could some times be a challenge.

pros: company really does take care of their employees, benefits from day one. Great management for the most part.
cons: Sale goals can be difficult.

pros: Co-Workers, Benefits, Opportunities, Casual Work Environment
cons: Slow Advancement and Low Salary Base

pros: Benefits, Training, Advancement, Family Atmosphere, Flexible,
cons: Favoritism, Short staff hiring, A lot traveling, Work load, Bad equipment

pros: Almost free services nice people
cons: Hard work for terrible pay

pros:
- great work atmostphere
- proper training (3 months)
- team oriented business
- awesome benefits/PTO
cons: - cusotmers will get the best of you sometimes.

pros: Being able to interact with customers, building rapport and being able to transform the customer's experience.
cons: No downsides. I loved my position

pros: Strong leadership and management. The ongoing drive for new ideas is great.

Xfinity Home is a joke and should not be sold to anyone.  The product is junk  The general public despises Comcast and will despise you for working for them.

Lastly You must wait 2 months before getting commission on what you sold. Don't work here in sales!

pros: Great pay and good benefits
cons: Door to door and weekend work

review: Better than average call center environment
pros: Coworkers are friendly and professional. New opportunities outside of customer service are frequently added. Management is generally supportive. Customers will provide you with positive feedback when they are satisfied.
cons: Bureaucracy. Comcast is an enormous corporation and many of the processes are far from streamlined. Job performance metrics are constantly changing, sometimes positively, other times in ways that boggle the mind. Internal IT and software frequently crashes or is unavailable on a daily basis.

pros: I have free time to spend with my family and do things personally for myself.
cons: no downside to this company

pros: Comcast name on resume. Free Cable.  If you are fresh out of college this may be an ok place to start.
cons: Unless you are great at internal politics and schmoozing your manager and their manager's rear end, you will not get ahead at Comcast.  If you are a great producer your income will still be capped and you'll only earn about 10 cents for every dollar you deliver to the Company.  Most people in this position earn less then 6 cents for every dollar the deliver to Comcast.

pros: great benefits package for the family
cons: not payed enough for what the job takes

pros: lots of growth options
cons: must be in one position for at least a year

pros: Best Products, Best Prices, On time Pay
cons: Poor Customer Service, Billing problems

pros: A great work environment, all the departments worked together. Definitely a place I would recommend working for.
cons: Lack of recognition for achievements

pros: Money and benefits and culture

pros: Free cable and full time benefits on a part time salary

pros: Can be lucrative through earning commissions.
cons: Huge problem with favoritism, giving select employees lead advantages, and has rules in place that make many sales not count toward quota. Cannot have two bad sales months within 6 months. Sales territories change constantly in which can affect your success. Some sales managers micro-manage while others do very little to support their team.

pros: This is a place you want to work at.
cons: Can't think of any at this moment.

pros: It was a great experience, had fun working there

pros: Comcast was a great employer before the 2010 centralization of most business processes. Now, it is still a decent place to work but the sense of family is gone. Reduced costs for cable and internet (essentially free for employees) is awesome.
cons: Work/life balance can be challenging.

pros: Great people, Fair compensation, great benefits, ideal work location

pros: They remodeled and improved the offices. The company functions were nice. The breakfast burrito in the cafeteria is a real treat.
cons: Management was a mess across the board, a complete joke. In my year and a half there I had three different managers. There was a constant influx of new people because they were either quitting or being fired. Trying to get anything done or approved was near impossible, the amount of red tape is insane. Once they get a customer installed and things go wrong (they always did) you were basically stuck dealing with the same horrific customer service everyone hates.

pros: Good pay, excellent set of co workers and lots of progression if your metrics are spot on.
cons: Upper management tends to drop the ball. The job can get repetitive. Techs tend to get over worked with out compensation.

pros: Great personal support from company

pros: Comcast really takes care of their employees- excellent work life balance

Great benefits

The work is challenging and not for everyone. There is also a risk of injury at anytime if you're not safe.

review: Great Job, Good Pay, Absurd Hours
pros:
- Commission rates are very competitive
- Lots of support from upper management
- Company is making big steps to improve customer service
cons:
- In the office by 9:30am, don't leave the field until 9:30pm
- Not compensated for handling escalations, recruiting, training, interviewing
- Override is not worth it for the position unless you have an outstanding team

pros: Highly ethical and values oriented company

review: As bad on the inside as on the outside.
pros: Benefits are top-notch, including steep discounts on cable
cons: Completely disorganized on every level.  Uneducated management.  Terrible morale = high turnover = low standards for employee hiring.  Internal communication is a mess.

pros: Good people, culture and friendly atmosphere

pros: Plenty of opportunities to do new stuff

pros: part-time hours, two different shifts, benefits, and courtesy services (lots of opportunities for prizes)

review: Comcast is a Great Place to Work

review: Good, but not so much for front line employees

Commission structure decreased every year

They say they promote from within but they don't
Customers hate you
Cant be off the phone for 5 min or they start paging your supervisor
Schedule was promised to be changed every 6 months but stayed the same for 3 years

review: AMAZING company with great benefits and treat their employees like royalty!

cons: Sometimes schedules are not too accommodating.

pros: Profitable growing company, Great benefits, great diversity, market leader
cons: Big company with lots of red tape, product and technology advancements faster than internal process

review: I literally got fired on purpose.
pros: Employee Discount, solid base & benefits.  There were a ton
cons:
No structure at all. No support. I was often wasting valuable selling time trying to figure out where my paycheck was.  
Your Commission depends upon their ability to install, so you can sell 20 contracts but get nothing but written up because the building is unserviceable. 
My manager was ridiculous, not supportive and had no idea what she was talking about.  Although it was clear to everyone around us, they kept her on board and let several of us go.
The Department was growing to fast for the back end support to keep up.

pros: Free (pay for box) Cable, Free (pay for modem) internet, Free Phone

pros: Free Cable and Internet. And that is it!!!
cons: Avoid this place and the (Alpharetta) location at all costs! This is a nepotistic place of business. The staff are from a former Comcast location from Tucker, Georgia. Two of the managers are close friends and long story short they are sneaky and low class when it comes to ethical morale! One word to describe this place is GHETTO and not to mention the bed bug infestation! Also don't ever get sick and call out...you will get fired. And let you leave before the fire you..they will over charge your account! It happened to me!!!
