I tried calling my point of contact yet again that HR gave me with no response still - then I checked my bank account and my final check had been deposited with NO explanation of what I was being paid for?! They never called me as was stated in the administrative leave letter, people knew that I was fired permanently before I even did!! I have no paperwork on my final check or COBRA etc! Nothing! A company like this sure did handle this incredibly unprofessional with NO respect or even common decency to an employee who gave them nothing but years of hard work and loyalty - it’s very disheartening and I’m disgusted that they treat people in such a manner here in Tucson and in general! Their job was to contact ME once the decision was made and nothing!

pros: A great place to gain knowledge of the cable industry. Though they have cut back on training quite a bit.
cons: As long as your a "yes sir" kind of employee you will do fine at the company. But I wouldn't rely on voicing your opinion.

review: Was a great place to work at one time.
pros: Free Cable, Benefits, can not think about much more
cons: Poor Training, Poor Supervision and Management, Threatening your job, Ridiculous Metrics, Always finding way to take money back from their employees without providing to why. Bulling and no one talk to unless you have solid proof even with proof, you are told that it was checked and you are wrong. Employees have been accused of saying something and when questioned about it, and then being told it was being investigated and come up with the answer that they found fault , which was totally false. Every year you have to take these online about how Comcast is there for you and how Comcast Listen is there for you. Is a JOKE!!!! There are about 6 online program and testing you have to take every year  It is true or false questions.  No positive giving.

pros: Decent pay and glos benefits
cons: No HR for xfinity etail.  Company so big you could work there 10 years and nobody would care. No organization outside of the call center or corporate office

pros: Meeting interesting customers. Free cable. Fellow co-workers.
cons:
Horrible evaluation system impossible to meet expectations (you cannot advance unless you get near perfect values in about 50 different categories - most people have given up and get stuck at the low level position for 5 years or more). Rules of conduct not upheld as applied to management. Too easy to get in trouble - even fired. Changes / additional "requirements" are made with no regard to impact on productivity or extra time needed to do the extra tasks, and no input from the workers. duties piled on with no adjustment to time given to do it. Overall negative opinion of Techs - as if they are all out to cheat the company. Rampant abuse by Supervisors who are never held responsible fr their actions and left alone to treat people however they feel. They do not honor their 30 minute radius from home working area, sending Tech up to two hours from home and will ignore you if you speak up about it. They pile on jobs, actually giving you several jobs expecting you to finish them in less than the allocated units you are supposed to have to complete them. They can write you up for ANYTHING and fire you after only two write-ups - no matter how minor or felonious they are. Its a club, and you aren't in it. There are Supervisors and Managers running things who are functionally illiterate and just holding onto their position because someone likes them - its all sad, really.

Pay is low for the industry (ATT, for example, starts at 21.00 per hour, while Comcast starts at 14.00 per hour in my area). Hours are long and they dont care if you work until 10:00 PM and then have to drive home 2 hours - unpaid.

review: Dangerous job, underpaid, management sweeps major issues under the rug and passes blame unto technicians.
pros: Benefits package, 401k, tuition reimbursement
cons: Daily workload, poor workforce management, unpaid, playing the blame game, and crab in the barrel syndrome in promotions for techs.

pros: i liked having the freedom of being out and about all day. It was nice to have a company van.
cons:
working in dirty houses and horrible weather were the major setbacks as fas as i'm concerned.
not too much else i can say

review: My experience with Comcast was very disappointing.
pros: The Environment was clean and well equiped.
cons: You are not a customer service representative. You are a sales person, account representative, repair person, billing specialist and genral sounding board for each caller.  You are only given 7 minutes to handle each call and if you go over it counts against you, if you do not sell something it counts against you.

review: Have to rely too much on others
pros:
Company wants its sales people to succeed, give you the tools.
As good as it gets in Telecom (which doesn't mean much)
cons:
So many outside problems that distract from your sales. 
In my area our service sucks so its a hard sell, not really a problem for most other areas.
My manager is a serious pain, but I've met others that are ok.

review: Good Company, bad lazy management at Morgan Hill Location.
pros: Great benefits (health, dental, etc). This rec=view is of he CALL CENTER.
cons: Overall good company.  This Morgan Hill location however had many lazy managers and supervisors who didn't give CSR's proper sales support.  Annual rotation for select days/hours (shift bid)  didn't happen.

review: You don't want to work here
pros: Free cable, tv, internet.  Good health insurance and benefits for now.  At one time this was a great place to work.  There was a sense of community in the different locations.
cons: the management is horrible.  Stressful environment.  Everyone is afraid for their jobs.  Long time employees are being let go and replaced with kids right out of school.  Significant pay cuts in every department.  No one knows their co-workers anymore.  Antiseptic environment.

review: Fast paced and often things are overlooked.
pros: Fast paced, good people, interesting products.
cons: Strong bottom line mentality- results driven to a fault.  Internal culture is not one of support but rather one of cut throat politics.  No mentorship programs available.  Sink or swim attitude.

pros: Benefits...Free cable internet and phone
cons: No flexibility in schedule.  Salary is so insufficient comparable to the company stocks prices soaring after the acquisition of NBC.  Company should share the wealth amongst its employees as well because they are the backbone of the company.

review: A bipolar roller coaster of success and failure
pros: Good employees, potential for good pay, autonomous, good benefits
cons: Increasingly more regulatory and oppressive management

review: It use to be a good and honest place to work.
pros: It pays well if you hit your quota.
cons: Management allows DSR to do some very dishonest practices to get sales. It's so common and deeply rooted in West Michigan, I would call it institutionalized dishonesty.

pros: Great benefits, fair compensation. Provides a quality entertainment product to their customers and is always looking or ways to improve on products and services to achieve the utmost customer satisfaction.
cons: Over past several years, many changes have been made to better organize the structure of the company. This has created angst and uncertainty with frontline employees as well as leadership.  More changes to come..

pros: Lots of free stuff like mugs, water bottles, t-shirts. Most of the people that work there are great, typical rumor mill in the call center
cons: They're only concerned about the numbers not the people. They will work you to death. There is no such thing as work life balance, it's work hard, work even harder.

pros: No micro-management, benefits, decent pay.
cons: Disorganized, zero customer service, dishonest employees.

pros: I had a great few years here , I asked a lot of questions and learned a lot and even meet long  term friends there , well so I thought I meet friends.
cons: Human resources , supervisors. And the were a lot of things that the story will explain

pros: Free cable is included with position, cultivate company culture early on, quick hire process, Perks and benefits, product offerings
cons: Lack of support from leadership, terrible intranet system, Poor sales blamed on employee, lack of quick resolution, Coworkers treated workplace like high school

review: Good company, not the best for advancement
pros: Great benefits (nearly free cable, good health, etc), nice people.
cons: Advancement opportunities are severely limited for a company of this size, once personal human resources were outsourced, HR is used as a weapon more than assistance for Humans. Pay is low compared to others in the space  because of the constant fight to keep unions out.

pros: Great pay and benefits.  Excellent training.
cons: Opportunities limited to those who are in favor with management.  Many of the good, honest reps that want to do their job honestly and with integrity get passed over for opportunities.

review: Lousy hours with unsupportive management makes for awful customer reviews.
pros: You get substantial discounts on your phone, cable, and internet.
cons: The shifts and days off can be horrible.  Late nights mid-week off days and schedule changes every 6 months by bid.

pros: Reduced cost cable,  Steady work
cons: treat people wrong, when you strive to work above and beyond they expect that to be your new normal.

pros: Cool product set. Unlimited capacity. The organization had access to incredible delivery tools and then had ownership of content as well
cons: The organization was new to delivering business grade voice and data products and struggled to meet the expectations that were in the market.

pros: Great benefits - esp the stock options and super reduced internet phone cable. Decent health- same as most large companies
cons: The workday/workweek is never done. You better be available 7 days a week 14 hours a day

pros: Free or discounted services if you live in a comcast service area.
cons: Management .  Too much of a good ole boy hiring system.  Very hard to promote .  Management belittles employees.  One employee was actually fired because they lost their work phone while working.  They say that it falls under your performance.

review: Each day was a struggle to go to work
pros: Coworkers were nice and benefits were really cool. Employees are given free cable as long as you live in a combat area.
cons: Micro managing all the time and if you don't get a good schedule is hard to switch. Plus you have to deal with some crazy people over the phone constantly.

pros: Good benefits, nice to get nearly free services, easy work.
cons: Pay in a Support Department is not commensurate with the work done when you are in a department that is responsible for assisting Sales agents closing their orders and getting their orders entered in the first place, you shouldn't see a pay gap of $7 from the Sales department to the support department.

review: Not the best, Not the worst
pros: Opportunity growth and competitive wages. Good benefits.
cons: Poor leadership and administration at local levels. Poor local business choices and direction. No real input from staff and front lines. Too many moving parts and stipulations.  Poor work / life balance. Numbers game and you are not genuinely appreciated. Definitely not, nor ever will be a top 10 best place to work.

pros: Great products and service is getting much more focused on the customer experience. Excellent benefits, customers like and want to talk with sales people due to the brand. Pay is o.k. for entry to mid level sales people.
cons: A meat grinder for sales leaders and front line employees. Many people are treated like a number at Comcast and the culture embraces this mentality across the company.

pros: steep discount on cable, bonuses paid out every quarter
cons: promotions with in your group are limited, you have to change groups within the company to move up.  options are based on salary not length of time with the company. a lot of re-orgs.

pros:
Ability to grow in the business.
Skill Trainings.
Employee perks.
Community events.
Fair wages.
401k
Insurance Coverage-medical, dental, vision
Ability to work from home.
cons:
Open door policy is false.
Comcast Listens does nothing to help employees.
Asking for help with harassment gets you empty results.

review: Selling overpriced 25mbps connections to businesses who have gigabyte options for half the price
pros: Room for advancement great PTO/Holiday plans. If your in the right group/department everything will probably be a breeze.
cons: If your in the OBSR department your pretty much on your own.  High turnover rate

pros: The people you work with most become family, it pays well. It does come with benefits and 401k
cons: You do have to be use to a lot of constant  changes. The benefits aren't the best but they're there to help.

pros: Good hours, a few opportunities for overtime, good pay, and benefits
cons: Lack of managers,  putting new people on teams where they stay the latest out of the entire team, lack of resources for them.

pros: Benefits,  work environment,  401k,
cons: Management,  Upper management, No  Job  Security,  A bulling environment that is allowed, if you are not like the majority,  lacks diversity, very  cliquish,  employees encourage one another to not reach / or not exceed sales goals to keep all quotas lower.  Ethic policies are not followed.  Company business conduct is not followed.  Many reps sale things to customer with out telling them.  This is a market issue.  I think other geographic areas probably / hopefully  follow company policies.

review: Poor pay for how many jobs you do
pros: Company vehicle. Discounted cable services
cons: Supervisors have zero voice to upper management and micro manage like crazy. The tech position is not  valued in the company. Constantly apologizing for company mistakes to customers. Always picking up lots work. And forced to do more and more.

review: Can make a good income if you work hard
pros: The commission structure was great. If you work hard, you can earn a great income. They offered great benefits and vacation time off.
cons: The hours were not great. You had to be available to work every weekend . Management also had their favorites, and if that wasn't you then your hard work could be overlooked.

pros: Free/Discounted Cable / Phone / Internet Service.
cons: Not sure how Comcast gets the title of "Best Place to Work in XX".  I walk into to building and see unhappy customers waiting in line EVERY DAY (all the VPs and Directors don't seem to care EVERY DAY) and walk into the office where empty cubs everywhere.   Very depressing place to work.

pros: Free cable, 2 weeks vacation plus another 2 weeks in flex days. Don't  have to interact with customers often. Understanding supervisor.
cons: Very political. Its about who you know and not entirely what you know. Unable to rise to the next level without crucial experience. Feel like a robot doing a job. The quintessential mcdonaldization experience.

pros: Comcast provided a very relaxed office environment and the workload was typically on the moderate side making the job not particularly stressful.
cons: There was little opportunity for advancement. Employees typically remain with their assigned team for a few years before having a performance review. The office was also incredibly disorganized, with many employees not receiving their company badge for months after their start data.

pros: Great benefits and a diverse range of opportunities to grow in other departments.  They are growing through acquisition and don't appear to have much competition.
cons: They have what appears to be a highly fluctuating corporate structure.  Comcast has a very bad reputation and practice in customer service.

pros: health insurance , 401k, Great employees, time off and vacations, Life insurance
cons: ever decreasing salary + commissions, Stressful , no job security, heath issues... If you like to be yelled at the whole time you work this is the job for you.

pros: Cheap cable! Freedom and flexibility when you are in outside sales
cons: No career advancement. When yo are a good sales performer, they want to keep you there and will not help you move to corporate or other departments.

pros: Working at Comcast has given me the opportunity to develop myself; take the time to grow and learn, and that was really important to me during the time in my life when I joined the company. If you have the drive and ambition, there are a ton of ways in which you can grow into a leader if that's what you want to be.
cons: The reputation of the company is difficult, but the style of the company is to stay humble - I've never seen the company defend themselves against the harmful and discrediting news that exists.

pros: Steady calls from customers. Great investments in to company, 401k, stocks, medical, and dental. Cool people to work with as well.
cons: management. They micro manage us hardcore! However you will have that with a lot of sales positions. It does hurt your sales numbers though. they would be better off leaving a lot of us be. It's more customer service oriented then sales driven.

pros: Good company to work for, has in-office promotions and discount on all services offered. Call center environment, you will be coached regularly. Good employees to work with.
cons: Inbound call center, you will deal with rude people. Big emphasis on sales, "top down" approach and goals set higher than the national level. Non performers or those who struggle to sell are stuck in their positions.

pros: The sales compensation payout is better than its competitors. What I enjoy about working for Comcast is the fact that commission is paid every two weeks so there's no need to wait 30 days.
cons: Getting the sales aren't an issue however, getting the installation done is a major issue within the organization. As a sales rep, you only get paid when the installation is completed. The company does not even have a POS system on the iPad for their outside sales rep and have to call a third party company to put the sales in.

pros: None - cable discount if you can get it
cons: Women of power goes their head and only promote their own gender.  Arrogant management attitude to underlings.  No one cares about service, only cut off those customers who complain.  If  you're in Florida, count on your cable going out everytime it rains.

pros: Steady work and benefits. Company wants people to take ownership of there part in the company.
cons: The work load is heavy and short staff. The corp level people move around and up. The system level the is designed now to keep you at the system level. Techs are hand picked who does what and who trains for advancement.

pros: Comcast has some of the best benefits out there . The health insurance is great and other discounts that you can get as an employee are great.
cons: Comcast doesn't pay the very division that makes them the most money market value. They lead you to believe in interview process you can make all kinds of money when they actually continue to cut employee pay.  Horrible schedule as well.

pros: Opportunity for advancement after 1 year in position, company does a lot of things to keep the momentum.
cons: It's kind of hard getting out of your dept unless you know someone.  Hire someone with a record and then fire them for the same record years later and 3 different positions later.

review: The House of Broken Promises and Shattered Dreams
pros: Free cable, internet, and home phone system.
cons: A revolving door of hatred, depression, nepotism, and unfulfilled promises. The company will continuously tell us how committed they are to customer satisfaction, but continually undermine their lip service by increasing prices, changing the channel lineups so you have to pay more, and hiring people that are grossly unqualified for to give customers a high level of quality service. The kicker is  management are aware of how unqualified the majority of the staff is...Because they are related!

pros: The benefits are good although the payments are kind of high for them. They hourly rate is very nice for a call center.
cons: Micromanagement ia rediclious. If your on a call, and its your break time, evey minute your not taking your break counts against your overall  adherence score for ypur schedule.

review: Treats customers the same way it treats employees
pros: All employees receive discounted services and it's great company to have on your resume. Exposure to many different types of career if looking to continue your growth.
cons: Low pay, very long hours, not a lot of  opportunities if you are not a higher up, very disorganized and not enough employees to support the workload.

pros: Decent benefits as far as medical, dental is concerned.
cons: Greediest company on the planet. Their priority is to cut every employee's pay  in every way possible. They give you vacation time but it is impossible to take. it. Supervisor barely help anyone and most of them don't even bother showing up to work. Very stringent process if you want to move up or even to a different department. The only way to succeed with Comcast is if you are know how to kiss some serious A

pros: Health benifits are good.
cons: A lot of miscommunication between departments that are supposed to work together. Too many changes causing great and consistencies for the customers and for the agents. Poor management. Treat seasoned representatives as if they are less important than new hires.  Extremely high turnover rate. Whenever the company invest in something new they cut the commission of their representatives which is unfair.  The company forces out many representative that have been loyal to the company then hire new staff who would have a lower base pay.

pros: commission is good when it is good when you are up you are gonna bank
cons: when you bank save it, when it slows down it really slows down and the sales goals do not go down and you can lose your job

pros: Good competitive pay structure and benefits
cons: Terrible company culture. Seems as though you either need to have a stay at home partner, adult kids, or neglect your family. That was the trend at all levels, including leadership. Many of the women had stay at home husbands or husbands that had flexible jobs because of the demands of Comcast.

review: Culture of fear and passing the buck
pros: Good benefits and some of the best people to work with.
cons: Management only knew how to motivate through fear. Have never been at a place where people were scared of losing their jobs which led to a a lot of passing the buck and people only working to stay below the radar.

review: Good place to work to gain experience.
pros: Good benefits and free cable.
cons: There is no reward for top performing long term employees at Comcast. You are treated the same as the lowest performing person in the group.

review: Was rated worst company of the year for their service....well try working there
pros:
paychecks were steady
Bene's were tolerable
cons:
No room for advancement.
Management was clueless and would turn a blind eye to any issues their people would show them.
SLA's was a joke........if someone calls back for anything even if it's not your dept you work in your are penalized which lead to my termination.
Split days off = stupid.
Huge Turnover

pros: For the  most part you get free services and discounted box rentals.
cons: To many clique within the company.  Makes very difficult to promote even when your work speaks for itself.

review: Good most the time but then consistently was going down hill.
pros: Good pay. Good Benefits.Company Vehicle.
cons: Management micro manages. Management does not care about you as a person/employee, only about the numbers.

review: Not the best company to work for
pros: My coworkers were great to work with and always wanted to do the best they could
cons: Everything but the coworkers.  We worked hard to b e successful and unless you had "friendships" at work, you would never get promoted.  Having relationships got you promoted, not your hard work.

review: My experience at Comcast has been overall good, but has its challenges as every job does.
pros: Uncapped commissions. Flexible hours. For the most part, you get to manage your day with little supervision.
cons: Can have odd hours. Sales driven. Don't hit your numbers, can be out of a job

pros: Free cable and decent benefits
cons: Pressure to sell and having to deal with sales generated anger from customers who feel they were never fully informed. Their customer website says it all, its smoke and mirrors. You get promotional offer as long as you are increasing services but try looking to down grade and the "disocunts" disappear.

pros: Great benefits and pay.  Top notch technology.
cons: This is a large company and I do not pretend to know everything about it.  The department I worked in had about 10 supervisors.  It was a case of the haves and have nots.  I unfortunately was assigned to a supervisor with below average skills.

review: Don't expect much rewards for your accomplishments
pros: Benefits such as paid time off, shift differentials, and insurance are what made me stay.
cons: Employees are not rewarded as much as they should be for hard work, especially when it comes to accomplishing an irate customer's needs that other employees failed to take care of the first time.

review: You gonna work for that money
pros: A regular nine to five. Hours was good
cons: I start there not knowing what to do cause the staff just leave you hanging. Then when your on the phone with a customer and dont know what to tell them, their is no one around to help you at all. Its very frustrating. I hated working there. And they was some crooks, always finding ways to make customers pay for services that they made up names for

review: Great place if you are willing to deal with customer issues all day long.
pros: Great benefits. Loved my supervisor but his hands are tied too.
cons: Horrendous support.  You work your butt off creating great customer relationships and then lose them because another department screwed up.

pros: - Opportunity for learning latest technology
cons:
- Bureaucratic
- Lack of focus - too many initiatives and constant priority changes
- Political Environment
- No one cares
- Demoralizing environment

review: great company but by the book
pros: great company, ok salary, great location, absolutely by the book, you get trained and you do your thing, great work-life balance
cons: very square minded supervisors, company culture is very strict, career development is kind of difficult since the structure is pretty flat.

pros: Salary and benefits, including on-site gym, etc.
cons: Immature IT organization. Re-orged three times in as many years, finally outsourced much of IT Operations to an outside firm.

review: Terrible training program, no support on my sales team, no morale, bad compensation!
pros: Benefits are offered and are okay although worse than last 2 companies I've worked for.
cons: Many challenges to perform my job including the compensation. Too many issues to list here within 20 words.

pros: Great compensation, a lot of incentives and games . also a lot of great benefits working there and paid training.
cons: scheduling was not very flexible. No choice but to work late shift no matter how good sales are. Very busy work enviroment

review: It's OK. At my position in my mind
pros: Bonuses, decent money, decent benefits, bring work van home. Something new everyday. Pretty easy to learn.
cons: Immediate management is "hard to deal with". A little stressful. Have to be in some really dirty homes. Feel over worked at times.

pros: Great video and internet products. Flexible work environment. Very good benefits.
cons: Comcast has been sited by numerous publications as the worse company in American. There are many reasons but none more important than their customer service. Our team went nearly a year w/o upper management locally. Too much red tape to truly be efficient on the sales side at Comcast.

pros: Great Company with great benefits. Room for growth since there are many departments. Ever changing environment due to new products and services.
cons: Not enough training to help customers the first time. Some departments avoid helping either customers and internal employees. Hourly pay isn't competitive in the sales department.

pros: Good health care benefits. Free or low-cost cable tv, internet, phone and home security services. 401k with employer matching.
cons: The market is highly competitive for residential services. There are decreasing demands for cable tv and land line phone services.  Commission rates have fallen over the past three years.

pros: They are always coming out with new products and systems that are better than their competitors. They are at the forefront of the industry.
cons: Pay doesn't match the Labor! The amount of work technicians do  a day is nothing compared to what you get paid. And they make it very hard to progress in levels

pros: Comcast supplies all your tools, uniforms, and vehicle. Winter clothing also provided, and steel toe boots.
cons: Managers and supervisors only care about themselves. Hard to advance within company. Everyone that moves up is who is the best pet to management not how well your production is!!

pros: The services are discounted for employees. That is about the only good thing when working here
cons: The expectations of the job are sometimes unreasonable. Calls are rated and the metrics they use are hard to maintain. Everyone even those.not in sales are expected to sell and must meet a certain  sales requirement each month

pros: Good company to work for in your skill set matches the job
cons: Hard to get into this company based on experience, because they believe heavily in promoting from within.

pros: Some good benefits leadership is good, all training is provided plus company vehicle start work day at home end work day at home.  Little to no commute
cons: Low starting pay and raises are low also.  Promotions and raises and payn in general are kept a secret, so it can feel like.  Also you never know when your day will end.

pros: Good benefits, pay and relocation possible. Great coworkers. Innovative products and services.
cons: This bussiness moves fast. Management needs to prepare each employee in advance of pending changes. They need to train and support each employee. Try Harder. Always.

review: I worked at Comcast full-time (More than a year)
pros: Pay was great, the freedom to work on your own and supervise yourself was great also. The weekly meetings were encouraging at first.
cons: Management was disorganized, there was a lack of communication, some mutiny overall morale rapidly fell. Employees were rewarded for sales even though they were not following company guidelines...ultimately screwing over other honest employees.

pros: Low cost Comcast Services and Health Benefits are good.
cons:
Lead by confusion on everything, leaves only the lowest being accountable and inherits responsibility when Managers foul up and confuse, which is their leadership style.

They never want to improve their operations, they talk about improving all the time, but that is just so they can report that they are trying to improve, but they never do.

review: Company is focused on making money above all else
pros: You are given free internet, WiFi while an employee and they generally pay well.
cons: Magement levels  filter issues, so hard to make progress.   Too much lip service about getting better at customer service.

pros: Work alone, work as a team if needed. Provides tools, uniform, truck and everything needed to perform jobs. Great benefits and perks; internet and tv services are little to no cost.
cons: Depending on the market you can be doing a lot of driving of job to job. You’re working in any and all weather, working some holidays, even if I’m standby (people need cable).

pros: Many opportunities for advancing your skillset.  Great benefits.  Good pay.
cons: With every opportunity comes great frustrations with the inability to get anything done at this facitlity.  Former and current management seem to be besieged with great pride to pursue dead projects.

pros: Has a great benefits package ,the products that they have are some of the best in the industry when they actually work
cons: Mid to upper management where clueless ,very untruthful with  to what they say and then what they do

pros:
Dont have to worry about doing a good job because it isnt expected
Same mundane in and out everyday if you like that
cons:
The list is miles long
run by Morons
No one cares about anything especially customers
The people you work with are stupid.  (the smart ones already left)

review: Employees treated as poor as customers
pros: good benefits, free services, potential to make a lot of money in sales.
cons: employees are treated like turd, all of our positions eliminated right before the holidays, starting to outsource to foreign countries more and more

review: Not Given The Benefit of the Doubt
pros: Great benefits for health & wellness
cons: Bend the rules for some...very strict with the rules for others

review: Metro - E sales job with simple product suite
pros: Company is focused on building fiber and is a competitive alternative to the telco's/type two providers.
cons: All management is based on Salesforce activity - there is little or no coaching.

review: I liked working for them for the first nine and a half years I was there
pros: Good pay, good benefits and perks.
cons: You hit a glass ceiling rather quickly. Even if you take additional schooling, you will never get into the area you want to work in if you do not have prior "Corporate Experience" doing that work. They don't tell you that when they are saying how much they will help you get to where you want to be.

pros: Commission, Vacation days, incentives,free lunch
cons: Lack of communication through departments. Makes the business run un organized. Which creates a hostile work environment with customers. Metrics are insanely unattainable which will drive you into a anxiety attack!

pros: Discount services good health benefits your gonna need a lot of anxiety medication for this job. Good dental and vision.
cons: Training was very limited on what really happens when you go on the floor. Total deception.  Equipment is crap and yet your forced to push and pushed to put disgruntled unhappy customers in higher plans.

pros: Phone always rang, good ramp up, benefits and perks, decent training and somewhat flexible hours with a star next to that.
cons: It's a mill, limit on number of calls per day like 5 or less. Made you work two Saturdays a month. Inexperienced mgt, bad call filtering, unfair sales rules, not thorough enough training, managers are young and unprofessional, you are completely expendable even if your the best I saw it happen when I was there.

pros: The pay was decent benefits too
cons: Easy to get fat because you are at a desk all day, the company rips people off and over chargers their customers, you get yelled at, called names, and verbally abused over the phone. It was the most annoying job I ever had in my entire life.

pros: i really enjoy the freedom to come and go as you wish. As long as you do your job you will enjoy the perks.
cons: sale goals become tuff due to weather, this position requires going door to door, so there for bad weather affects the job

pros: A lot of functions, constant incentive drives. Great deals with employee services. Very good benefit packages.
cons: Not high on the list of  work/home balance. Low commissions on all sold products. Micromanaged high turnover levels.

review: Whoa, turn around now before they get you thru these doors.
pros: It's a steady (very small) paycheck, it's kind of a peaceful work environment between customers screaming at you and managers trying to write you up... wait what?
cons: Ha, I'm going to have to attached a separate website for all the cons. No advancement, raises of any magnitude take almost a year to achieve. The managers they switch out constantly and the training is laughable.

pros: Good Benefits, company vehicle, work schedule, in general a good place for a young individual to start and build a career. Company tuition and enough free time for school or something else.
cons: Its complicated to understand but its a big company where corporate management becomes very detached from local operations. To big to care for their customers or individual employees.

pros: Lots of money to be made. Management was flexible with my schedule.
cons: Working with people who steal your sales and management not doing anything about it. It seemed they didn't care how sales were generated as long they were made.

pros:
Great Benefits
Company Perks
After some time, consistent daytime working hours
Pay was really good
Call center was usually clean
cons:
Parking
No support from management
Commission structure decreased
No ability to put vacation time in past 6mos of notice
Too many hands in the pot for sales

pros: Good pay when you put in the hours and capitalized on sales, minimized on disconnecting accounts.
cons: You are faulted for 3rd party contractors who screw up custoemrs account. You catch a lot of angry comcast-customers.

review: Good job, great benefits, and the work is easy.
pros:
Not having to pay to commute to work
Company provided phone, iPad, and vehicle
Great health benefits
Matching 401k and stock purchase plans
cons:
Long hours. 
Work weekends
Micro managed pretty badly
It's frowned upon to not work overtime
Supervisors are hard to reach

pros: Free cable and internet! The agents were obligated to only pay the rental charges for cable boxes, modem, and tax.
cons: The sales department went three years without a director! There was absolutely “NO DIRECTION” On October 29th 2017, the department closed! We were provided options to move to a different state or take a severance package!

pros: Great Benefits, very work-life balance friendly, plenty of direction to go in, pay is great
cons: Middle management to involved, especially for reps who are top performers, too many changes year to year and sometimes month to month

pros: Even as a telesales rep with little hours, pay was pretty good, timely, training was very good, customer service was good also. There was a sense of community and family.
cons: I didn't like the fact that the rate of commissions was so low, and no opportunities for advancement.

review: Comcast Care Department in Houston is not a company you should work for.
pros: Great Benefits and the pay is pretty fair.
cons:
If you have any type of personal problems, don't expect any help from Management. Your supervisor will attempt to help you but their managers don't care as well as the Director and the Vice President. 

The Call center expects you to be a robot. It's all about metrics and attendance.

pros: Good hours, great people to work with, good insurance,get free lunch everynow and then. Have fun while you're working
cons: Some employees take advantage of management lazy way of supervising,needs to have managers that will step to the plate and fire these people that don't work,while all the good employees work twice as hard pay sucks,horrible working conditions.

pros: For the most part, very smart and friendly co-workers.  Good focus on "the big picture" and growing market share through new products.
cons: Very heavy-duty office politics; sometimes people don't want to hear about problems/issues; it's a "who you know" kind of company.

pros: Good benefits. Free cable, phone and Internet. Only work 40 hours per week. Solid company.
cons: Pay is low. Morale isn't great. Try as I do, my manager doesn't seem to like me. I believe race has something to do with it.

pros: As a field technician, Comcast is the In-home leader for internet, tv, phone and home security/automation services. Great benefits, free cable services, housing allowance in some areas.
cons: Terrible customer service.  Great Network techs are overworked and underpaid for their skillsets.  Advancement issues. Dealing with customers who are angry at times.  No stock options, only stock purchase programs.

pros: Good Perks, Free Cable or Discounted Cable. Working outdoors with a great team members.
cons: Inconsistent Goals, Low Pay, No Lunch, No Breaks, Management out of Touch with what is really going on. A lot of office politics with little focus on customer service.

review: A mix between great and horrible
pros: A Great pro for working for Comcast is that you get paid really well and the bonuses are extremely nice. Great benefits too.
cons: It is extremely stressful and you have to kiss lick and scratch butt to get promoted or keep your job.  It's so sad

pros: Benefits as far as ESPP and Health Insurance is great. Comcast University is one thing that I will always stress to employees to take advantage of because you wont be there long so, get the education while you can.
cons: You never know when your day is going to be up, no matter how good youare at what you do. They would rather hire someone straight out of high school and train them than keep you around

pros: None except discounted cable, internet, home phone and alarm service - however the customer service is awful for these services
cons: As a Enterprise Account Executive - I sell fiber or ... This company has by far the most favoritism I have ever seen. Management is corrupt and a never follows through with any tasks. If you don't have a personal connection to the leadership and will be given leads do not come and work here

review: Telesales is a good way young people can start their careers
pros: The pay was decent considering if you are a person without much responsibilities in life.
cons: Company image may hurt the commission of sales people. It is difficult to meet goals when the customers you are offering products do not see the value of their existing ones.

pros: great benefits, great co-workers and managers, fair pay
cons: EVERYTHING is CONSTANTLY changing... not normal everyday corporate type change... in the one year I worked there I had 8 different supervisors (counting 2 trainers) and sat in 7 different seats... this is the norm there was nothing special about my position.

pros: Lots of money to be made with Sales
cons: Very transactional. You have 49 days to close an account or an internal employee can resume the sale. There are also too many operational walls to climb to get an order approved. ?

pros: Free premium cable package/internet/phone service
cons: Working here was probably the most stressful job that I have ever had. Customer service jobs are already difficult at times but then you add in the inconsistent policies/procedures, crazy expectations for metrics, along with managers who are unable or unwilling to help and it just makes the situation even worse.

pros: Great benefits, free Cable, lots of training opportunities to grow your individual skill set
cons: Very political, coworkers will step on you to get ahead, no collaboration, classic example of the "peter principle" within all levels of management.

pros: no one hanging over your shoulder. You get to manage yourself for the most part
cons: To big of a company, you are replaceable.  The metric system they use for promotions is impossible to hit and does not give a accurate depiction of your work

pros: Great money , along of freedom plenty of leads to work with and the boss hounding you all day and excellent condition today
cons: Travel , independence expectations communication with people

review: 90 days in and wondering if I should stay
pros:
Good Work/Life balance compared to most companies in the field 
Ability to move up
Employee Experience- Resource Groups
cons:
Operational Support for sales teams
Customer Experience 
Pay is ok, but health benefits for a family is outrageously expensive

review: Corporate positions are nice. Lower level positions can be tough to move out of.
pros: Good opportunity to move up within the company with the right motivation
cons:
Phone positions aren't lower paying and repetitive 
Managers weren't helpful in aiding you into corporate positions and sometimes tried to put roadblocks into your way.

review: Great company to work for but no work/personal life balance
pros: The job is a great opportunity the benefits are great. Very cheap cable, health benefits and many events held to help ease your mind off of work.
cons: Takes up your days, somewhat dangerous, pay advancement has become the hardest task within the last year.

review: Ok place to work but only if you don't speak up
pros: Benefits, co-workers, locations, and schedule.
cons: Treated like a number and will not listen to your side of the story.  Horrible advancement training.  Have to be "in" with upper management to advance.

review: It's an okay place to work, but wages have been falling
pros:
Benefits are great
Most coworkers are great
cons:
Bureaucratic
Limited opportunity to interface with managers if they are not in the same state
Very competitive promotions, often leaving deserving coworkers waiting several years
Very small raises, well below the cost of living increases for the area

review: Great Perks Not So Great Communication
pros:
It's an okay place to work as long as you don't mind facing the horrible truth from our 1+billion customers....
Really good hiring practices. Definitely an EOE!
cons: The good workers are usually overlooked

pros: The salary is nice and the commission is very good.
cons: It is one call after another and you never any leeway between calls.  Many of the supervisors are only concerned with themselves, not really in tune to their agents.

review: Great Company to Work For, until I was given the wrong Supervisor
pros: Great Benefits , Free Cable, Paid for Unused PTO. If you can advance and get out of customer service, then you can adavance and have a long career.
cons: Low Pay, Supervisors may work sabatoge and work against you.

pros:
Pay (when you’re salary)
PTO (after 5 years)
cons:
Politics
Unethical Behaviors
Anxiety Disorders 
More Than I Honestly Have Time To Share

pros: Free cable, Co-workers are nice. You can make good money.
cons: Management is poor. You’re a number. They say you’re not, but you’re easily replaced.  This place used to have giveaways, events, and management listened. Now your out the door if you disagree.

pros: Great vision; great engineering staff; great staff level people; great women leadership.
cons: Extremely poor leadership at the director level. Unclear planning and execution. absolutely a reactive culture to the executive director level. Poor, poor, poor leadership.

pros: Great benefits and health coverage. Free services
cons: New hire are not trained well enough to do their jobs after training. Tools are not effective and break down.

review: Just got called for my first interview
pros: Received a phone call for a face to face interview within one week
cons: Only part time, wish it was full time so I can really get paid.

pros: Excellent benefits, free cable, training, works hard to stay ahead of the competition
cons: It can be difficult to advance, management can take too long to make decisions, customers have a negative opinion of the company, top heavy management

review: AN established leader in the technology industry
pros: I enjoy working at Comcast because they consistently make the moves necessary to stay ahead of their competitors. Comcast is a true powerhouse.
cons: While they offer tuition reimbursement, in my opinion, the amount the offer is to little.

pros: Good Pay, Benefits, free cable/internet.
cons: Numbers and Metrics reign supreme, focus is more on what is best for company rather than what is best for customer.  Constant changes in what is expected in performance.  Bar is set very high and leaves very little room for unknown and uncontrollable variables.

review: Unethical salesperson-you will flourish.Otherwise, always watch your back.You're only $ to Comcast.
pros: Great perks of huge discounts in Comcast services, 401k employer match, health benefits, employee stock purchase discount, trying new technology before it's released.
cons: Upper management, constant changes that conflict with the company credo, stressful work environment, job security, company reputation continues to get worse making it difficult to be proud of the company you work for 40+ hrs for each week, long time tenure isn't valued even for highly respected employees among their various workgroups.
job title: Service Center and Retail Sales Manager

pros: Take home truck. Medical Benefits. Discounted cable services.
cons: Supervision and management.  No one is on the same page. Lack of real training

pros: Product Discounts are wonderful and its a laid back environment
cons: Office Culture is unprofessional and leadership poorly trained in customer service departments

review: Rewarding and frustrating at same time
pros: Good benefits.  Company is definitely focused on positioning the company for the future and turning around its image of being a utility/cable company to a technology company.
cons: One hand doesn't always know what the other is doing.  A lot of favortism.  Much is done last minute / on the fly.

review: Worst place to work in America
pros: The pay check does clear every two weeks into your bank account via direct deposit. You can manipulate the vacation system and take double the amount of the time off and get paid for it all.
cons: The company is a mess.. It is too big and they can not manage it. Metrics and quotas change without notice. In the Alpharetta call center, the big boss only hires mostly ghetto folks.

review: I worked in the call center.  It was fine.
pros: The benefits were good.  Ok.   oh yeah, pool table, movie swag, nice lunch room with TV's.  This is my twenty word minimum.  Not much else good.
cons: Mediocre pay, sit at desk stuck to the phone all day .  Needed more pee breaks without getting yelled at.

pros: Great benefits from medical and having cable for little of nothing with every channel. Having 401k match . great tuition reimbursement.
cons: No room for advancement. You can get stuck. There are not that many jobs available.. working weekends and holidays.

pros: Working here there is a lot of control given for maintaining daily schedule. Free time.
cons: Lots of change going on. The pay is not what it used to be. Major setback, unfortunately.

pros:
great benefits, including total free cable / phone / internet packages

good management team - friendly executives

nice location
cons:
pay could be better, but almost any person will say that about their current or former employer.

work life balance is average

pros: Benefits are outstanding.  Medical is cheap with superior coverage, 401k is matched high.
cons: Base pay is sub par compared to other areas, with more work required than the other areas perform.

pros:
Work schedule benefits and co workers
Hard to grow with in the company  it's a good overall company for you if you like to talk on the phone !
cons:
Not enough income it's good for partime 
Min training I wish they would teach us more about the actual product at hand instead of being all about the money

pros: Great place to learn if you are starting out your career
cons: Unfortunately the longer you are there and the more you know the more you are targeted, especially if you get a new manager, that does not fully understand the business.

pros: Fellow colleagues are helpful and great to work with. Benefits are good and work life balance is descent.
cons: Turnover is very high. No marketing support for Metro - E products. Process are very Arcadic and doesn't support a effective sales environment. Upper manager is not supportive, very negative, views individuals are numbers and likes to lead by intimidation. Very unprofessional!

pros: Free cable , free lunch for call center sometimes , really good with personal adversity
cons: Overbearing supervisors, low pay , crazy customers. Lbs. That 12-9 is like death !!! ND u accumulate points way too fast . Really a half a point for being 10 mins  late ??? Get over ya selves.

pros: Some opportunity for advancement. Exciting atmosphere, with participation in rewarding projects and a sense of being part of something bigger than yourself.
cons: Extreme pressure to produce. Unreasonable demands from management. Not-very-thinly veiled threats of termination commonplace. Irrational behavior rewarded.

pros: The environment is typically enjoyable. Met some amazing people with a diverse background, from the customers to the employees. For the most part, the job is easy. Great benefits and perks
cons: During certain months, aim to high for numbers in my opinion causing the job to become stressful.

pros: Good pay, bennefits, 401k medical, dental etc.
cons: Managment says once thing and does another, its all about the $$$. Poor career options for those looking to get off the ground floor.

pros: Great benefits, team work, experience in field pay is great and grows with the more you learn in the fielding areas.
cons: The company have very little tolerance when it comes to being tardy, while Also they do not have much room for advancement due to limited position.

pros: Benefits are great. Discounts are even better.
cons: The company could be more organized. Do not see any urgency when it comes to stuff need for reps, from personal things to progression time period. Stats are really not in favor of retention represtatives; be prepared to be sales at the end of the day.

pros: good marketing teams & good local engineering support.   brand recoginition
cons: operates enterprise business like a cable company........shady charges & not customer responsive.  benefits were expensive for the size of the company.    Comp plan was good, but targets not realistic from market to market.  Salary was low compared to competition.

pros: Benefits are good and complimentary internet and cable
cons: Extremely unprofessional management.  Everybody talking about everybody, management befriending their agents and gossiping about employees etc. Does not promote from within very hardly to move up.  Most employees move side to side so to speak.  Just moving around to other departments but not moving up the corporate ladder.  Lay offs of whole departments without any notice.

pros: Comcast takes care of their non-management employees
cons: Comcast is so paranoid about the non management employees becoming unionized that they have a very broad "open door policy" that renders it impossible for first level managers to discipline insubordinate employees.

pros: I like the people I work with and the company is always looking forward.
cons: Unrealistic expectations on the Supervisors.  Difficult to manage time when there is so much expected of you.  Over the past several years, departments have been cut or eliminated and those job duties get pushed onto the     Supervisors.

review: It is like being inside a tornado (in a not good way)
pros: Compensation and Benefits are good, compensating for City Wage Tax
cons: Too much email, and too many meetings.  Nobody pays attention during meetings, because they too busy reading their email.  It is often hard to figure out who is in charge of what.

review: If you like to get laid off - Comcast  is your company
pros:
Free to deeply discounted service
Diversity 
Friendly and open thinking culture 
Good Benefits and perks
cons:
Lay offs
Lay offs 
And more Lay offs 
Quick changes that sometimes seem as they were not fully thought out

review: Used to be a good company; wouldn't recommend worst enemy to work there now.
pros: The best part of this job was your team and other co-workers who needed to band together to try and reach a common goal.
cons: Office politics, broken promises of benefits, cutting of benefits (parties, food days) due to budgetary reasons despite getting e-mails of record-breaking quarters.

review: Good solid company to work for.
pros: Very flexible most of the time which offers a work-life balance. The culture is very laid-back. Get benefits and incentatives!
cons:
Base could be more, charge backs are the worst (reps are held accountable for 120 days on each account they sell). Weather: Extreme heat and cold
Work Saturdays

review: Daily frustration with outdated processes and procedures, Senior management is extremely political
pros: Free cable, internet, and phone
cons: difficult to grow within the company, outdated procedures and policies, most people are overworked and have too many responsibilities.

review: Truly a horrible place to work
pros: Deep cable and internet discount,  decent benefits,  employee stock purchase progran
cons: Hostile environment, lack of focus (changes all the time on which metric they will fire over), dishonest recruiters,  favortism with the same metrics,  high turnover rate,  poor morale,  lack of consistent policy,  hands tied behind your back when trying to help customers,

pros: Light work load, free lunch every now and then, and close commute
cons: Most company employees have a superior complex while in the company of contractors, rarely speaks even when spoken to, and makes you feel un-welcomed and uncomfortable.

pros: Discounted cable and internet (not free). Direct deposit. free parking.
cons: No work life balance. Poor pay relative to cost of living in area. Excessive micromanagement. Inhumane lack of access to restrooms. Incompetent middle management. Customers hate Comcast and Comcast doesn't care Tech support is caught in the middle to take abuse from customers and management. Insurance is costly and garbage as co-pay nearly exceeds income.

pros: Decent money in commission if able to meet the high quotas
cons: High quota, loud environment, quota driven, crazy HIGH amount of calls you have to take. Horrible management, feeling guilty for the lies they make you tell to meat quota. AVOID.

pros: Good benefits and easy-going workplace
cons: Really corporate atmosphere that fails to make the workplace a fun and easy place to work. The call center job is looked at as entry level and not as a career path in my eyes.

pros: Good benefits. Fair amount of paid time off. Close to home. Telecommute options. Big incentives given away. (cars)
cons: It was good pay till they restructured the commission.. now you have to steal sales, work overtime, not be upfront with customers just to meet the same goals.

pros: Benefits are good, pay is pretty good. (Almost) free cable, huge company so very stable. Management stays out of your hair.
cons: Little to no room for advancement and management does not encourage movement within the company. Commission pay is all over the board, cannot count on stable commission amounts.

pros: Discounted services, beautiful building, nice area
cons: It seems to run as if it's its own separate company, there isn't any communication amongst management to employees. The pay is way below what a company of this magnitude should pay someone who works full time

pros: Talented people, good benefit coverage, good technology, responsible for the communities
cons: Self-centered culture.  It is all about "how do I look, and make me look good".  High ego.  Micro-management.

pros: Great benefits such low price for Cable and internet. I get to occasionally enjoy lunch on the Company.  Meet a lot of different people.
cons: You will begin to care less about people. You might get desensitize of people's problem cuz you have the pressure to increase their bill even though they can barely pay what they have.

pros: The only pros for working with comcast are pay and benefits
cons: shift changes happen to frequently, which makes it hard to give you a balance life outside of work. Especially if you have kids. The Orlando call center just takes over flow calls from other centers so there is little room for advancement.

review: A endless time of trying to stay in good graces of the management.
pros: Excellent benefits within the company.  Health, dental, eye and retirement not too good but nice.
cons: Low pay, Bad Management, Good old boy system of promotion and recognition.

review: Ok but not great place to work
pros: benefits, great co workers, discounts
cons: job stability, training, communication with senior management

pros: Courtesy services, lower management cares
cons: Work/life balance is not great. Pay is always decreasing. Unrealistic goals that are ever increasing.

pros: Decent compensation and benefits overall
cons:
Big corporate culture, which means middle management throwing you under the bus to save their cushy jobs.
They lure in with razzle dazzle of working with a big stable company & promises of career growth, but they don't live up to their promises, micro-manage the heck and squeeze the life out of you.
How do you think they got so big...by professionally squeezing & rough-shoding people & smaller companies.

pros: Immediate supervisors are great most of the time. They will help pay a little for school if you can squeeze it in.
cons: No room for growth they only lie and pick close friends to advance.

pros: Office culture is nice, and the company encourages internal growth.  If you are good at what you do, and you have the drive to succeed, they will invest in you.  An obvious pro is the huge discount received on Xfinity products for the home!
cons: Benefits are well-covered, but expensive compared to other companies.

pros: was able to  work  with a  great  group of  co-workers and enjoyed talking to  customer in person.
cons: office was short  staff and I  was given the role of management but  was not a promotion nor no acknowledgement was  notice  by  upper management.

pros: Benefits and Perks along with time off.
cons: Turn over rate is bad, mildly hire within and no help with internal dept. Seems like people are for self and not the customers.

pros: This company provides great pay, commission, bonuses and benefits.If you're interested in sales, this company will be perfect for you.
cons: Very repetitive work environment which lacks in resources and tools to do job properly. Company expects you to do more than what you were trained to do. Unrealistic goals. A lot of mental abuse from customers.

pros: Steady pay check, little travel, they have chairs.
cons: Revolving door of sales people that are not qualified in the first place. Management may not comp AE's for deals but they get paid. Upper management not qualified to lead. Management team old boys club, be careful  Poor products not competitive, no flexibility with product set. Product road map a moving target. Products are me-too. No benefits for 90 days, stock options are 5 year not worth the paper.

pros: The work itself was not too hard and the pay was okay. There is a wide array of specific jobs you can do.
cons: Working with customers was the worst. Most of the time they did not understand anything I was saying. The management was terrible and supervisors were not good.

pros: Great benefits, free cable, Internet, phone and home security, flexibility, get an iPad, cell phone and gas allowance, great co-workers
cons: Expect you to knock on doors after dark, management  plays manipulative games among co workers, favoritism, unfair work practices, do not enforce rules to all employees

review: friendly and very helpful co worker
pros: great environment  friendly  co workers many perks always have events with food and prizes offer medical ,dental, and vision  benefits, free services if you live in  foot print
cons: very focused on sales even if your tech support agent  customers yelling about bad service , high call volumes during outages

pros: Great benefits.This company is very generous with vacation time and planning company events.  Free cable/internet
cons: long hours. High work load. Sometimes a bit overwhelming or a bit high demanding when new products release

pros: Nice atmosphere, great diversity, free cable, excellent pay!
cons: High pressure sales! Its all about the bottom line. Little room for advancement or lateral job change. High turnover.

review: Decent experience. Company is always changing their direction.
pros: They have good benefits. The company gives you a lot of time off. Management was friendly. Mostly everyone was friendly.
cons: Job itself can be tough especially during the winter. Commission structure changed. Always changing directions and never knew what direction it was heading.

pros: Great co workers, facilities are new. Great technology for employees to get job done.
cons: Micro management. Technicians are over booked with appointments and are not paid enough for the work they do daily. Metrics set by management are unreasonable.

pros: Excellent benefits + helpful and thoughtful co-workers.
cons: Tyrannical managers are allowed to run employees into the ground with no repercussions. Turnover rate is high.

pros: Plenty of challenge in technical skill, great people to work with, great training.
cons: Tough to advance. No raises or promotions. Be prepared to work multiple shifts often. Little recognition of hard work.  They hire temps for 6 months then fire them to avoid having to give benefits.

pros: big company with lots of perks
cons: chaotic, frequent re-org at the top.   You have to be in the "old boys club" to get ahead.   The company has great diversity but does not treat non-white men nor women well.  Extremely condescending people

review: A Means To An End.... Unless You're VERY Patient
pros: Benefits, Discounted Cable Services, Employee Discounts
cons: To BIG for it's own good, Claims to be for you, but failed to prove it

pros: 401k, and full benefits package.
cons: Unfortunately benefits is about the only good thing working here you'll work long hours for low pay extreme oversight no trust in employees often looking for ways to just find something bad about you after 16 years left the company with extreme bad taste in mouth.

pros: Good money and free employee discount
cons: I was the top performer but the company is the worst I ever seen. Horrible company culture, discrimination. If you are not caucasian, don't go. People gonna make fun of your nationality, race and even your name. If you are military don't go, they gonna laugh your military career. Bad leadership team, only care their money and coach you how to lie and cheat to make mone for them.

pros: Work environment and people are friendly.
cons: Large corporation, so everything is slow and office politics cause policy changes to swing back and forth before policy reaches some equilibrium.

pros: Benefits are great, Free Cable
cons: Senior Staff did not listen well to ideas to improve service. Were more motivated to cut call times down. This led to communication gaps between departments due to hasty calls and representatives that lost interest.

pros:
Free cable, Internet 
Paid 2 week vacation
Health life dental
cons:
Excessive workload
Point system rules every aspect of your job
You will never have a full weekend off unless you use vacation/sick time.

pros: stable company, lots of profits in the near future, decent benefits
cons: inspite of big talk about hiring and emphasizing software engineering to compete with competitiors like Netflix and Apple, they dont really understand what software can do, just following silicon valley tech and that too poorly, remind me of AOL 7 years ago

review: Middle Management wouldn't know how to sell door to door....
pros: Good money selling Door to Door, before ATT Uverse send cult members around tricking people into signing contracts. Can't imagine how bad it is now with everyone viewing TV shows online.
cons: Middle Management. Three to four managers directly above two sales teams? Grand Rapids and Lansing.

pros: Their products are very good.  Actually the best in major markets, still leaves a bit to be desired in more rural areas.
cons: The constant change, the restructuring that goes on every 18 months. As a low to mid level manager wondering if your position is going to make it into the next budget year.

pros: Heavy discount on cable, phone, security, and internet service.
cons: Low pay with a lot of policies and procedures that make what would be an enjoyable career very stressful.

pros: free and discounted services were nice
cons:
lower pay compared to similar companies
they don't see you as a person just a drone (they actually sent an email one day that basically said "be careful in the parking lot we don't want you getting hurt we need you on the phones")

pros: A great paying job with tons of benefits and excellent insurance.
cons: Company is losing touch with its customer service roots and is heading towards script reading as opposed to actual customer service.

review: Why do people hate there ISP.
pros: Pay was decent and lots of free giveaways. The training was nice and had a good instructor.
cons: Constantly getting yelled at by customers. Not getting much help from supervisors.

review: Disliked by the public but a good company to work for.
pros: Excellent benefits, including very good health benefits and reduced cost of services, nearly free.
cons: They sell you on personal growth when you start, but it seems as though it is harder to climb then they portray, although there is a lot of competition to get to higher positions.

pros: Good company, good benefits and low cost cable services.
cons: Call center environment is stressful along with the stats you have to make every month. It is hard to move to other departments cause it is not what you know it is who you know.

pros:
Benefits
Size
Ability (if they get out of their own way)
Brand
cons:
Leadership seems to manage from a spreadsheet
Lack of personality 
Small minded
Fragmented messages

review: Working environment is very tense.  No office culture for the employees at all.
pros: Monthly commission if obtained is good.  Performance determines commission. Benefits are good as well as company stock options
cons: Performance techniques can be questioned sometimes depending on what dat it is...

pros: The benefits are pretty standard for a large company. I've excelled in my position in a short amount of time. However, excelling was extremely hard work with little reward.
cons: Almost everything is a con with Comcast. Customers are not the only ones not happy. The pay isn't too great either.

pros: Although it is a sales job there is a base salary that helps (but it is minimum). The commission really motivates to sale more, The more products you sale your commission goes high.
cons:
Work during the weekend is important
There is quota so there is stress
Hard to sale because COMCAST is not competitive except for its internet

pros: Benefits, don't listen if some one says there are no cons
cons: Sales environment is treacherous,  competition within the company is a major problem. Some people are given company leads with no adjustment to their goals.  The sales environment is an absolute mess.  Run run far away.  Inside sales reps are given better deals to offer customers.

pros: Decent Pay and benefits it the only pro of working here.
cons: Stressful work. I drank every night after every shift. You must be a robot, if you are a passionate and caring person, your emotions will be effected everyday working here and going against everything you know is right.

pros:
Benefits are fantastic (especially the free cable and internet)
gives you an insight most wouldn't have to the workings of a major cable corporation
cons:
very repetitive work
no clear way to advance in your career
hours are tough - first shift was 3pm-midnight

pros: You get free cable and internet and know all the up to date tech.
cons: They try to push you to do the impossible and don't communicate very well.

pros: Really good benefits and competitive compensation. The company has lots of opportunities for growth. The salary is competitive compared to the rest of the industry.
cons: It is a huge organization and there are areas where structure is lacking. The company has a really bad reputation and it is hard to change customer's mind

pros: The Money is good if you hustle. That's the only good thing about this job
cons: Backstabbing environment, don't be No 1 in sales, or else you will be audited constantly.  You will find yourself hesitant to sell certain products due to the fact that the Company will never deliver what is promised.  Top management suffers from bipolar disorder, no continuity and zero discipline.

pros: They have great benefits and the customers will usually love the fact that you are to fix their issues.
cons: Rushed time frames yet expect quality work. Supervisors can treat every job the same so they wonder why a job where everything needs replacing doesn't take the same time as just hooking up new devices.

pros: You get Free cable, but all the free cable in the world does not make up for the low pay and hours you will work.
cons: Company likes to run a barebones IT organization. Company is top heavy. For every 1 Director you have 1 Engineer. Comcast pays much lower than most other companies.

pros: Decent benefits and salary.  Room for growth.
cons: Employees are no more important than a jammed piece of paper in a copier.  The company used to have a sense of decency when it came to its people.  I'm afraid that has passed.

pros: Great Benefits with free cable and Internet. Great people to work with.  Fiber product is expensive but amazing and reliable.
cons: Micromanagement at its finest. Too many reps for Utah market. You are a number to corporate.  Day to day processes are cumbersome and difficult.

pros: Great Benefits, Good Pay, Freedom to work from home
cons: Internal Competition is your biggest enemy.  Quota is not easy, especially with current market saturation.  Your assigned territory can make or break you.

pros: Large company , has a path to leadership,  many benefits
cons: Low pay, Long hours, Not family friendly, No roll over vacation, Large company with many things falling of plate.

pros: For years, the job was empowering and motivating.  There was a family atmosphere that made you excited to work there. Unfortunately...
cons: Changes in regional management changed the job.  It was a great place to work, but management changes led to negative culture changes.  I hope that this gets fixed.

review: A good place to work, but not great.
pros:
- Free cable for employees
- Stable environment
cons:
- There is not much internal focus on investing in the employee workforce.
- Innovation of products is not a focus.
- Compensation is a closely guarded secret by HR.

pros: Co workers are great but the level of working together as a team has GONE away
cons: work is no loner enjoyable but rather a burden. Never Know when your going to get off work. you work until your done with your route. hard to plan anything for home life.

pros: you take a vehicle home, free services, off on stat holidays gas card to put gas in your van that all
cons: the schedule sucks becuase your going to come in working a 10:30 to 7 schedule getting a day off sucks. they make you do everything under the sun the pay is horrible a downright insult

review: Declining worker compensation/bene's while Comcast profits soar
pros:
Local relationships with peers
Facilities
Commute
Home access to work website/info
telecommuting option
cons:
Diminishing benefits year over year for Frontline employees.  (Healthplans, 401k, bonuses, etc)
Wasteful spending on non-productive items (Comcast Jeopardy, etc)
Excessive Middle Mgt positions 
Work Load
Excessive Exec/Mgt pay
Service
Excessive daily mgt meetings that do not get results/productivity

review: Regional Business Sales Mgr in the Big South Region
pros: Comcast is a very large company, growing at a fast pace.  Financially stable.
cons: Worst company I have ever worked for in my entire career.  Incompetent leadership, lot of racial discrimination lawsuits. Right to work is totally misunderstood in the south.  Morale is extremely low. No minorities in upper management outside of human resources.

review: Tough culture to change, nice people.
pros: People were nice.  Benefits like free cable were great!
cons: The culture is difficult to change

pros: Coworkers were great and Comcast offers great perks.
cons: Management have no idea how to motivate and in some cases how to do the job the reps they are managing have to do.

pros: They offer a comprehesive benefits package.
cons: As a CAE it is one of the worst jobs.They consistently harass you about keeping your phone calls short,but also want you to sell services,even when your tech support. When you try to spend more time helping the customer they complain about the time.When you get your time down,they start complaining that your not spending enough time helping the customers and selling services.

review: Great company to work for as far as benefits but you are not rewarded for your hard work.
pros: Great Benefits and work hours are great!
cons: Pay rate is low for the amount of stress placed on you and the amount od calls and service you provide.

pros: Its a great job with lots of challenges plenty of OT and great pay you also have a take home vehicle and courtesy service.
cons: The on call could be rough at times especially when there is lots of storms you have to adjust your body to being called out anytime doing the night

pros:
Free cable, internet, and phone. 
But you pay equipment costs and still have some sort of monthly bill.
cons:
Customers are always angry over some billing issue. 
Agents are adding things to customers' accounts to meet sales quotas. 
We can't tell customers about that 
One of the most stressful call centers you'll ever work at

pros: Great Benefits, great team building environment, excellent training.
cons: Big machine not support for job stress related issues and God forbid EMS come to get you, you're  practically written up as you're carried out.

review: I don't know. I got the job but it was filled.
pros: Cheap cable I guess. Can't think of much other than a decent starting wage. Not sure how they treat their employees they actually hire AND work.
cons: Again, wish I had some idea beyond the bad experience through the gate. 6 weeks of promising interviews and testing only to get the door slammed on me last second.

pros: Very caring people and working environment. health insurance and employment benefits are great. Very good for someone who is going to school and working full time.
cons: Keeps restructuring and reorganizing which leads to layoff and shutting departments down. Career growth isn't that great and you have to know someone to raise you to the next level.

pros: Excellent benefits, Large MSO, Health and Dental benefits top notch, focus on revenue, great place to learn the basics
cons: Huge ship so very hard to turn if you know what i mean, difficult to implement any new ideas.hard to be heard unless top management, focus on revenue

pros: Decent salary and benefits, including 401k.
cons: You will be expected to work ridiculous hours and be on call 24/7.  Your work will not be recognized when review time comes around.  Your manager and director will not be on the same page regarding priorities.  Very bureaucratic, which should not be a surprise.

pros: Great benefits, the cheap internet and cable along with the medical made it almost painful to leave
