cons: Constantly nit picking and changing policy on a whim, favortism, unorganized management. Policies that prevent you from actually helping a customer, ever if the company is dead wrong

review: getting hired on is the easy part and training is a breeze the info may be a bit overwhelming
pros: you get to enhance your communication skills and build your resume for the future you get vacation time an flex time after only 90 days of employment
cons: telesales is difficult you have to meet expectations but sometimes its impossible

pros: Employee Resource Groups, great manager who was willing to work with me to succeed, supportive coworkers who helped me get acclimated in the role. Love that internet and cable were free, only had to pay for the equipment. I miss that a lot!
cons: I was not there too long, so I am not sure.

pros: Good pay with decent benefits
cons: horrible management with awful hours a lot of broken promises

pros:
+ Off site management meeting
+ Big discounts on cable bills
+ Immediate tech support
cons:
- Career growth for new employees
- Old school mentality across technical and business areas
- Resistance to change across HR, Engineering, and PMO teams

pros: Great internet service when working...
cons: They lie to their customers about their prices and services. They have multiple layers of adjusters that are qualified to give different discounts to certain people.

pros: you get free cable and internet ... commission checks help during the rough weeks. you dont ever have to work past 9.
cons: you might have to work weekends and the people you deal with might be pissed at you cause they hate comcast

pros: - Good company to get your feet wet and learn the systems that support the cable industry.
cons:
- Micro management style from top all the way down to the production floor.
- High stress environment
-

pros: Met really nice co-workers. It’s a job just to get some money.
cons: Yelling & angry customers consistently.  Take about 80 calls or more a shift.  Shift always changes.  Hard to even go to the bathroom without a supervisor yelling at you.  Supervisors breath down your neck.

pros: The job paid well and was pretty easy for the pay. The benefits of the company were great.
cons: It was very difficult to promote inside of Comcast! If you werent a "friend" of management, then you were looked over, every single time!

pros: Large company in 38 states, good benefits, talented people, Comcast's services are high in quality: most content for video, fastest internet speeds in the country - new home security is sub par.
cons: One of the worlds most hated companies, poor customer service, customers tend to despise the company.

pros: Management takes notice of you quickly when you exceed expectations and put forth your best efforts
cons: Employees with seniority does not like new competition; upper management has no clear direction to low level employees and quick to take sides

review: If you want corporate politics, this is your place!
pros: Good training, good pay, and free stuff. Worked with some great people that were there to do their best.
cons: You really start to feel like a number after awhile.  Management changes like the wind and it gets tiring.

review: Working for Comcast is like being a Comcast Customer
pros: Free Cable, Internet and Phone with every single channel, Cool People to work with. Good Benefits and Group Discounts
cons: Limited Earning Ability, Very Big Company and the sales process goes through several chanels which sucks when you close a sales and others drop the ball.

pros: leadership positioning company product for the future and expanding, free cable.
cons: Work priority always changing, and most of the time what the priorities are can hardly be re-conciliate. Not very good in terms of career advancement and pay rate increase.

pros: Great uncapped Commission, meet alot of new people in stores, no real supervision
cons: Managers only care about SALES! They never leave the office to see what it's like in the field... If you don't sell you get the boot!

pros: Training, Development, Organizational perks discounts on all services,  Growth potential, benefits. Engagement with front-line employees was good.
cons: High school atmosphere, promotions were based on who you knew and not necessarily your work ethic or success.  Leadership didn't take well to constructive criticism. Billing and repair reps are not properly compensated compare to other departments.

pros:
Great working environment 
Mainly friendly Management
Good benefits and pay
advancement opportunities
cons: Call center flow is usually pretty heavy, and there aren't many times for breaks to aid in the advancement process. There isn't very much down time due to usual high call volume to get off the phones and make steps for advancement

pros: The building is a tourist attract especially around Christmas, there are some great people to work with, you really feel like you're in a corporate atmosphere
cons: It's very hard to get a permanent job here if you're a co-worker, some of the people you work with

pros: They try to help the customers as best that  they can so that helps with keeping the customer base large and gives sales more opportunities
cons: The pay is kind of low so that's really the worst thing I can think of but that's part for the course

review: Pay is good, Customer service is horrible
pros: Great pay, vacation and 401k.  Company has cutting edge technology in the field of communications
cons: Metrics constantly changing, customer service is horrible and needs to be fixed, achieving pay raises becomes difficult because of changes in how production in graded

pros: Bonuses and PTO were great and some pod mates were great.
cons: Whats needed to get the bonuses hard work and the need to mislead the customer to think prices are unchangeable.

pros: Great Benefits!!  Rapid growth.  Well known company
cons: Change commission plans mid stride.  If you make too much, they change comp plan to isolate total payout

pros: Benefits, and decent pay, as well as the ability for growth within the company.  Also having 3 days off in a row.
cons: Long hours, you are in the weather all day long.  Hard to be heard since it is such a big company.

pros: Changing people's lives on the phone. Great people to work with. Lots of company parties. Full time and over time.
cons: Supervisor are new and just learning their job, so they are in the dark with you. The health plan doesn't cover anything.

pros: You get a discount on services.
cons: I am ok with change, but it seems like a lot of the changes affect the front-line employees the most; and not in a good way. They make the front-line employee's feel less then, like they are not good enough to go to other departments.

pros: Free cable a diverse and therefore entertainment based career. High resolution is a day to day challenge all day every day
cons: Customer service hard to overcome , parking a day to day challenge , facilities could be more up to date for a fortune 50 corporate location

review: High stress but good pay/benefits for industry
pros: The work environment is wonderful and the benefits of working with the company are great. Staff is personable and understanding.
cons: Working with customers can be very rewarding but is very stressful at times. It can be high stress  and high anxiety a lot of the time.

pros: Easy and straight forward with great training and very supportive teams.
cons: Managers that do not understand advanced Leave policies

pros:
Almost no physical labor
Free Coffee
Free Cable
Commission
cons:
Stat Requirements (Gates)
High Turnover
Misrouted Calls
Poor solution system

review: it gets harder and harder everyday doing more work with less people
pros: Lots of open opportunities if you are willing to relocate.
cons: It's a big corporation, looking to get bigger every day.  There is a lot of red tape.

review: The company was good initially but laid off older workers in the Denver, CO area.
pros: Has the potential of being a good company for the worker but must improve.
cons: Does not seem  to care about the older workers .

pros: Great Tech, good people ( some ) Great way to get into telemommunications
cons: High Turnover, get rid of good people

pros: freedom for now, livable pay, discounted services.
cons: micro managed, anti union, very clicky and political
job title: "Finanz-, Einkaufs- und IT-Direktor / Mitglied des Vorstands"

pros: None never nothing ever !!!!!!!!
cons: No work life balance, expect 24/7 with no compensation. Make you miserable so you resign. Management makes you suffer, does not mentor anyone. HR tells lies to buy them time to find faults so they can terminate employes.  There is no value. Management rather tell you they are too busy to listen than help fix issues. Senior management needs to be cleaned out!

pros: The befits were the best that is why I stayed so long, one benefit is almost free cable, phone and internet -- you have to pay for equipment
cons: the schedule were awful   -- no matter how long you were there and they changes each year .

pros: Clean work environment. Benefits. Free coffee :)
cons: Terrible management team. Incredibly hard to schedule vacation time. Commission takes a huge hit for taking time off. Constantly changing commission to benefit company by lowering commissions. Turn over in amazingly high. No consistency in the direction of the department. Day to day changes that only muddy the waters not improve them. 4 new directors of the department in 4 yrs doesn't help with any stability.

pros: Benefits, ability to move up, supplied with over two thousand dollars worth of tools exactly a week after starting
cons: No cons to speak of at the moment but haven't been at the company long

pros: Large, well known company with pretty decent benefits.
cons: Lack of opportunity for growth, not a lot of advanced training opportunities, the pay, and the company culture really started to shift in 2015. There is a lot more micromanaging going on.

pros: The benefits and the people, also great work life balance!
cons: Too much politics in the work force, it's all about who you know, versus what you know!

pros: The experience of working for Comcast is better then you would expect from their reputation as a customer.  Still not very good.
cons: Do I really need to spell out the evils of Comcast?  It's everything that is wrong with working for a giant anonymous corporation with none of the career benefits.

pros: Innovative, fast paced environment.  Senior leadership based in PHI are very savvy.
cons: Long hours, resources can be limited at times.  Addressing of customer service needs have been a top "priority" for way too long - employees are tired of all the "talk" and lack of progress in this space.

pros: Free cable phone internet occasional giveaways decent pay
cons: Abysmal treatment of employees awful policies that are bent consistently for favorites systems failure constantly

review: Best benefits package, Best place to work until you get sick
pros: Amazing benefits. Blue Cross Blue Shield, Delta Dental, pay a little extra for eye, LT and PT disability.
cons: HR is a nightmare. Whatever the opposite of personal and empathic is, they have mastered.

pros: I enjoyed my co-workers, and access to benefits and retirement was nice.
cons: Some managers just didn't care. And we had to switch supervisors every six months, so I went from working with two great supervisors my first year, to two awful ones, who only cared about stats and not the customers.

pros: Growing company - - benefits - improving focus on the customer - no micro management - freedom to pursue entrepreneurial objectives - great caring associates
cons: Constantly changing challenges - politics - deadlines may be unreasonable and directed not collaborative - decisions driven too much by qtr to qtr results, not ROI

review: OK job if you want to learn how to do it.
pros: Freedom in the field. Good pay and benefits. Great starting point. Overall simple to understand if you teach yourself
cons: Very little training on how to properly install everything. Customer service is not the best, and the techs pay for that by dealing right w/the customers.

pros: You will become friends with the other interns. The pay is salary and commission, you are provided transportation to and from the field, and have a flexible schedule
cons: Low commission on sales, Salary is below minimum wage, Long hours, Poor training

pros: The reduced prices for the service is the only reason to work here.  The pay is barely above minimum wage, certainly not enough for the hammering you get from the customers and being hung out to dry by the 'leadership'
cons:
The 'leadership'
The pay structure
The customers
The company culture
Goals are WAY too agressive and unrealistic to achieve without being dishonest to customers
Office politics
Cliques 
And the 'leadership'

pros: Benifits, stable hours, no travel
cons: Pay is severely lacking. Most of the benefits of working here are gone.

pros: Pay is decent, matching 401k, great benefits
cons: Poor management, will dance around questions that could help a potential sale. Every year they tend to lower the commission pay and expect employees to exceed unrealistic goals. Call routing is broken so sales calls is rare.

pros: Free Cable services for employees
cons: Idiots in middle management, No voice in any real changes, low pay.

pros: Lots of vacation time and paid time off. The company issues you a phone and iPad. Your schedule stays consistent.
cons: Customers are often frustrated upon your arrival, micromanagement, difficult working conditions at times, and an overall misunderstanding of actual customer experience.

pros: There are No pros to this job, only CONS
cons: High pressure area to work in, the turn over rate is extremely high, here today, gone tomorrow. Supervisors and managers are in the job because of their non-skills, ONLY way to get ahead is to go drinking with management

pros: Base Salary is on the low side but the benefits are pretty solid. Some product training throughout the year and a little sales training from local management
cons: Too many reps in the same territory plus an inside sales/telemarketing channel that is feed leads in your territory through an aggressive marketing campaign

pros: Free cable, vacation, remote van privileges, most tools paid for.
cons: Position becomes static without long term goals.  Feel as if you have to brown nose to get anywhere (which is not a personal strength).  Uncontrollable graded metrics.

pros: Discounted Cable, Good Insurance
cons: inconsistent, or lack there of, explanations for: (1) Average 40% drop commission pay, (2) call routing, and (3) blatant acts of sexism and racism in the call center.  4920 Centennial Blvd, 80919

review: Office closed moved to Pittsburgh was good until the last 2 years leading up to the move
pros: Benefits  good people good supervisor safe work place.   Discount cable
cons: Training wasn't up to par basicly had to learn on are own time.

pros: Free tickets and okay discounts. Good pricing on food.
cons:
Very hard to advance and even if you do its not worth it at all. 
Raises are a literal joke. 20 cents a year.

pros: Excellent Benefits with Flexible Spending Acct/401k and you get company stock at discount/Open door policy with management and human resources
cons: No disconnecting calls when customers are extremely irate or vulgar. You have 8 metrics you have to meet, 2 of which are not under your control but the customers

review: Devote years of service to them for nothing.
pros:
Free cable and Internet
If you like to eat they like to feed you.
cons:
They promote on the "good ol' boy system"
They will fire you at the drop of a hate
They are ADA compliant facility wise but will fire you for a disability.
They do not practice what they preach.

pros: As an Intern, you can be treated as a full time employee with your own cubicle which helps you feel that you are capable of contributing just as much.
cons: Unfortunately, it can be hard to stay busy most of the time.

review: Great experience however, lacks job security.
pros: The benefits were phenomenal including the fact that the organization still contributed a company match to 401K.
cons: Poor communication amongst the various levels throughout several departments.

pros: Benefits and the experienced gained.
cons: Upper Management in the West Division are arrogant and could careless about their people.. Way to much politics. Loyalty means nothing to them. The longer you're with the Company the less money you make.They take advantage.

pros: The only thing about this company that is positive, is it will not be closing anytime soon, so it is a stable job.
cons: Treats customers and employees like garbage. After working in the Customer Service Center, I will never subscribe to Comcast even if it is the only thing available.

pros: my staff was a great group of workers. Always willing to go the extra mile to complete major projects on time for me.
cons:
Upper management, had bad and unethical practices due to AOL background.
Did not care about staff that didnt below manager if they weren't programmers or had an interest in programming

review: Met at lot of great people, job was very difficult and had its up and downs.
pros: Great pay, also paid for mileage, coworkers.
cons: Knocking door to door during the winter, schedule was 11-8 M-F and depending where driving from sometimes would not get home until 9. Constantly being micromanaged.

pros: Variety of projects, innovative, collegial and collaborative environment. Pace of work. Flexibility of schedule.
cons: Long commute. Fragmented office culture. Being disconnected from headquarters and centers of power.

review: Chatt FTC dept will be missed!
pros: great "family like" atmosphere. Had time to relax & unwind after a stressful time frame. good benefits and time off!
cons:
Laid off. Was out in the dark about the Time warner/Comcast conversion..this lead to all of Chatt FTC jobs going to ATL.
Low pay in comparison to other dispatching jobs

pros: Great base and ability to make a lot of money. Some of the managers do care about your development and will invest time into helping you. Lots of training to help you.
cons: Very cutthroat sales environment. You may get a set of accounts but other reps will contact them unless you have active meetings, quotes, notes; and even then your account could get called on. There are several situations of reps fighting over accounts. Its hard to be successful here without  being sleazy.

pros: If your desperate and this is your last resort than it can be a pro just because something is better than nothing. There are 👎 pros.
cons: No more than 20 hours a week making $8 plus commission if you get sales. You have to meet a quota or you lose your job. Its a young highschool type environment lots of goosip. Pay sucks hours suck job sucks.

pros: Great benefits. Community interaction with Comcast Cares and United Way payroll deduction for their campaign. Working for a company with sound business practices.
cons:
Not enough OTJT (on the job training) before being sent off on your own.
Supervisor didn't offer adequate support for position.

pros: I worked at Comcast for 16 years and just retired from them.  Decent paying job with good benefits.
cons: Very stressful, poor training, micromanaged.

pros: money, very easy to make good money, and to get raises if you attend work daily.  you can be late and they have a grace period.
cons: unorganized, horrible management, do not speak your mind, very clique like, very stressful, and very high turnover rate. second worst work environment  ive ever worked in.

pros:
-excellent benefits
- room to grow
- bonus plan
cons:
- abuses people in the interview process; strings them along ,makes them jump throigh hoops then rejects them
- I know 6 very qualified, good people who Comcast won;t give a chance to

pros: full time opportunity if you are desperate; if you have a good job already do not
cons: they hire their relatives and friends as supervisors, when it comes to promotions, regardless of your work history, attendance or prior experience, you will not be promoted unless you brown nose or they are attracted to you in some way or are friends or relatives. They hire external candidates before internal candidates.

review: Good benefits, but stifling for new grads
pros: Great benefits and I love the work I do. Work/life balance is top notch.
cons: Company is pretty bureaucratic. As a new grad, social life is difficult and spirits get dampened by the bureaucracy

pros: Strong benefits and good structure for new sales people to learn about sales tactics.  Very structured learning environment for entry level sales people
cons: Not a good place to be creative.  You must stick to their pre-determined plan or you will get poor reviews, regardless of your success levels

pros: Pay is decent, good benefits, practically free services
cons: No work/life balance. Managers don’t care anything about you as a person (all you are is an employee number). Unreasonable metrics and VERY picky about using their “script”.

pros: High turnover makes thing interesting since you get to meet so many new people during your short tenure.
cons: It's a revolving door. You must use trickery and deception to land sales and make money because you compete hard core against other comcast employees. My territory was about 90% sold and most people either have service or hate comcast.  Take your time and find a legit job.

pros: Some incentives and pto structure.
cons: There’s a million metrics and although they say is unscripted it absolutely isn’t. Commission is always changing up and down so they say you can make unlimited commission but they change rates every month so you won’t make more.

pros: Good benefits learn good customer experience and meet a lot of people in which you can network
cons: No chance of growth ur apart of a company that set goals that u can’t meet that way ur never get a pay increase or move up

pros: Great benefits and 401K matching.   Allow you to work remote which is great.
cons: Product support has fallen off substantially since I've been here.  Most of the products do not work, are mismanaged or both.

pros: Independence and take home van.
cons: pay, lowest wage for the same work in my area

pros: Got to work on AWS services without much resistance.
cons: Restrictive culture where employees were "motivated" by fear instead of a common goal to succeed. Many lay offs and many people left the company to find a healthier culture

pros: free cable and internet, didn't need to work crazy hours, if you're okay with kicking the can down the road, it's fine
cons: tenure and hierarchy gets the best of them; performance reviews are useless

pros: There was always a new challenge waiting for me each day. I was able to reach a good work-life balance.
cons: I didn't feel like I was a part of a collaborative team. I mean, we all worked together, but we didn't work well together.

review: Good place to work. Great benefits, could use some improvements
pros: Great benefits, pretty straightforward, education assistance program and 401k including shares as well.
cons: Growth. depends on who you know. it can be frustrating. The company culture has had a great shift in the last year or so.

pros: Large behemoth with good deep pockets and decent benefits.  This should be good if you are looking for work life balance
cons: Not at all fast moving.  The company is quite hierarchical and process oriented.  They switch direction also quite and bit and really slow to go to market

review: Good benefits, no room for growth or advancement
pros: Good starter job for high school graduate or college student but no potential to move around. Great benefits and vacation pay
cons: No advancement opportunities and upper management not sympathetic to individual situations, dont treat people that work there like people. Treated like robots.

pros: Great perks, decent pay, lots of room to move, flexible to a degree, great co-workers,
cons: work for one of the most hated companies in America, although the pay is decent it isn't enough to make up for the treatment by the customers and the pressures by management.

review: Great job if you can easily conform and take a lot of verbal abuse from customers
pros: Benefits and Perks - Cable TV with premium channels and internet as low as $20/mo
cons: Picking up slack from the outsourcers and dealing with angry customers due to the lack of support from the outsourcers.

review: This is a great company to work for depending on the department.  Given the right area such as sales, tech support.
pros: Great benefits & the employee incentives are plentiful. Again it depends on your department atmosphere and leadership.
cons: Not many other than politics in certain areas

pros: This job is easy to learn but you have to make your numbers!!
cons: Meeting numbers is not always easy. You have to utilize many systems to verify orders.

pros: Great health benefits, tuition assistance and extremely discounted Comcast service.
cons: They really don't care about how about their employees at all. They expect them to live eat breathe and sleep Comcast.

pros: Great leaders in Philadelphia. Best in class products and services. Benefits include discounted internet, phone and TV services.
cons: Little to no advancement opportunities for minorities/women. Micro-managed environment in Comcast Business department.

review: It is what you make it
pros: Opportunities are endless if you are willing to travel. For those who are unhappy here, they should stop complaining and make the most of what you have.
cons: Changes are rolled out backwards. Processes are not fully tested before rolling them out, but then it is too late.

pros: It was a good day when you didn't have to deal with customers much
cons: You typically had to deal with customers who were promised things that you would do that were outside of what you should be doing... Running extra lines, etc. Was fired for not meeting numbers due to upset customers.

review: If customer service is in shambles, guess what working there is like
pros: Free cable. That's it. Nothing more. There were some great people here. Great job if you're 20 years old and don't know any better.
cons: Huge turn over. Dated pricing/quote technology. No, really: totally dysfunctional. In order to get a quote you have to go to someone else, who could give a rats___about returning your documents, or even bothering to respond. Totally unprofessional environment. The Sales Prevention Department was very effective here.

pros: Good company with a lot of benefits. It is more of a career than anything else but I ended up with more children than anticipated due to having triplets. They are great to their employees.
cons: Long hours and sometimes no consideration for personal lives.

pros: Benifits are excellent, lots of freedom, good vacation time, get to take your work van home with you.
cons: Have to be there for 5+ years to make semi decent money, policies are horrible.

pros: Benefits, Career Growth,  Company Culture
cons: Poor Pay, Antiquated Leadership at Region/ Division Levels.

pros: The company allows you to control how you run your daily activities and provides you with the equipment. Good benefits.
cons: The competition within other sales departments within Comcast can make sales challenging.

pros: You get paid an ok amount but it enough to deal with all of the crap that will happen to you in that company
cons: The department sucks, the supervisors are terrible people, the director is too busy to care about his employees, a lot of harassment and unethical practices take place in the ACES department.  They lie and say there are lots of chances for promotions but that is ONLY if they like you.

pros: Almost Free cable. Work can be fun when upper leadership is present.
cons: Upper Management doesn't know what they are doing or what's going on.  Always last min changes or no info. Customers will advise about discount products and we don't have a clue. Fair pay adjusted for all which includes supervisor not mrg and above. Benefit cost continues to grow  every year

pros:
Great employees to work with. 

Excellent services offered
cons:
Went into management and made less money

Company is hated by so many customers

No work life balance. Store doesn't close until 7

pros:
People are great, and easy to get a long with.
Work-life balance is steady.
cons: Somewhat boring work so if you like to challenge yourself then you may want to look for something else. Although, work can sometimes be interesting. It depends on what project you're on.

pros: I enjoyed my team and customers.
cons: Too many meetings and I had multiple stores in Oregon & washington there was too much traveling between stores  and it took quality time from my employees.

pros: Benefits were amazing. Only thing that kept me there.
cons: Too micro managed. I was an inside sales sales rep and absolutely hated it. Incoming calls are definitely not given out fairly which makes you lose out on sales. Which ends up leading to you having to get the late shift.

pros: Benefits seem good, guaranteed base pay plus unlimited commission
cons: Interviewer made it seem like I can get fired at the drop of a hat.

review: Once a great place to work
pros:
Decent pay at higher levels.
Heavily discounted services.
Good educational reimbursement.
cons:
This is department specific NASR: 
Terrible management, unable to escape their own process'
Horrible shot-gunning of discipline.
Stifling environment, that destroys any creativity

review: Not bad experience. but it sucked towards the end
pros: The people i worked with were great and cool to work with
cons: management sucked and didn't know what to do. also always changes commission structure when everyone had a good month

pros: Good company to work for with great benefits, good commission compensation, but low hourly wage.  Many opportunities to receive bonus gifts, etc.
cons: Just switched over from a customer service oriented store to a 'sales' oriented store.  Very stressful environment as you are pushed to make sales.

pros: Good pay while training. Great entertainment benefits i.e. cable, internet, home phone etc.
cons: To hard on most of the positions and they push you to hard and to quick, so you don't really learn the skills enough to be sucessfull

pros: Benefits are good but hard to use when you have no free time
cons: Require every  minute of your day so they can run activity reports.  Management is always in fear of losing there job because of unrealistic targets for the market to support it.

pros: Great employee discount on cable service
cons: HR is not there to support the employees, but rather to act as a buffer to prevent complaints being heard.

review: not a big potential to grow and develop
pros: Great benefits and most people are nice!
cons: Stressful job, small raises, no room to grow, low level management

pros: They care about you as a person and benefits are great with great pay potential.
cons: In a very competitive market, sales goals are a bit unrealistic.  Pay on should be based on per sale not percentages and complex figures.

pros: "Good learning experience for cold door sales. Great benefits and awesome people
cons: Listen to your sales people. These people for the most part are very smart and ambitious. You'll chase the stars away with micro management.

pros: Beautiful Building and Location, hard working people, good overall values
cons: Long hours, lack of family life balance per work load requirements.  Decisions appear to be made on friendships not on knowledge or skill set.

review: Okay - But just okay - stepping stone not long term
pros:
-Steady paycheck
-health benefits, even if they are overly expensive.
-team environment
-constantly changing enviroment (good/bad)
cons:
-demand more and more with less and less time
-low pay compared to other companies
-all about who you know 
-you're just a number in a massive company.

review: I've been working full time with Comcast for 3 years in he retail sales/payment center
pros: I get a check from them
cons: Company has unrealistic quota expectations for sales in a very sensitive business

pros: Your alone most of the day. no boss hounding you
cons: the job is actually very dangerous. Climbing 20 ft in the air as much as we do, its only a matter of time until you fall

pros: The Benefits are great between a work truck and health that's about it. Pay sucks for the job we do and are responsible for.
cons: No room for growth if you don't look like a middle aged white guy your opportunities are slim to none.  Minority EE's that speak their opinion are discriminated against. If you wear a beard or don't smile when they want you too you screwed

review: sales, went from great to meh
pros: Great benefits, allow you to call out for personal reasons pretty liberally.
cons: Commission went from amazing to crap. Most all the top earners left.

pros: Benefits, free cable and internet services, great coworkers.
cons: no work-life balance, salary, not much room for advancement (it's about how you know, not what you know.

review: Not for relationship sales people. Very transactional sales environment.
pros: Great resources to help track and locate prospective customers.
cons: Nothing was sacred in the bullpen working environment.  Had to be careful of other people hearing you talk to prospective customers on the phone.

pros: Great benefits, vacation, flex time, 401k match
cons: Cliquish - if you don't fall in with the right people it doesn't matter how well you perform, you are stuck.

pros: Vacation there really are not many benefits to this company quality services are nice but don’t make up for the lack of pay
cons: Pay, atmosphere is a terrible place to work. The customers usually have more information than the employees do. And if you are looking for a career I would look elsewhere

pros: Great Benefits, incentives, stock options, 401k, free internet and cable, and good pay
cons: Lack of help from leadership, lack of communication, and lack of training and most of all, they will fire you if they do not like you so make sure you kiss a lot of butt

pros: Base salary plus compensation, great training program.
cons: Poor leadership, most sales were not paid out due to terrible installation team not completing jobs and upsetting customers.  Lack of trust in employees as they track you with a GPS enabled Ipad.

review: Good luck getting on permanently. Contractor farm.
pros: People there can be really nice.
cons: Management is firmly embedded, old boys club, good luck getting in. They will work you forever as a contractor and never hire you.

pros: Great benefits that is all
cons: Terrible management, supervisors screaming and yelling at employees and HR not doing anything about it. Upper management not caring what the supervisors do as long as they keep numbers up.

pros:
Good Benefits
Free cable!
Vacations and time off
cons:
Commisions report are always late, dont show accurate the sales and payments, other sales steals orders, basically low commissions based.
High turn over and laid off
Hard to move up in a better position in the company. Sales supervisors dont care about their team!

review: realistic review of Door to Door Sales
pros: I made some income and was not unemployed.  discounted cable and internet
cons:
The Comcast management uses antiquated systems for tracking, obtaining sales leads, managing people, and payroll, which is ironic being a hi-tech company
No consideration fr human needs, no synergy between departments or even interdepartmental personnel, disregard for others time, over work employees to disgruntlement, and an overall feeling of dismay, apathy

review: You work for a goal and you are the only one.
pros: If you want to be a micomanager
cons: If you have ever seen the movie office space (well there you have it)

review: Horrible Company.No Integrity.Worst company I have ever worked for.
pros: Nothing nothing nothing nothing nothing
cons: No structure.Ineefficient people.Nobody is accountable.Does not care about employee, Low employee moral.Does not care about anything else but making money. Poorest customer service. NO concept of ethics. Employees are expected to work 7 days a week. 8-12 hours a day

pros:
Great Benefits
THey feed you on the holidays
Sit at your desk and talk to customers
Free cable,internet,phone
cons:
Low pay starts out with $11
Alot of changes
Have to lie to customers
Smart mouth customers
Working on holidays

pros: Great Perks: Free Cable, Company Events, Contests
cons: Ran like a factory, Not family friendly, inconsistent, High turn over, Not easy to advance

pros: uncapped opportunity to make money as a sales rep, and hard work reflected in your pay check.  Great on board ramp up period
cons: high employee turnover, management had a difficult time buffering the pressure coming from above

review: A communications company that is terrible at communicating
pros: The direct managers are nice enough to deal with and will at least entertain your thoughts questions and concerns. They're pretty flexible with schedules too
cons: The further up the ladder you go the more convoluted the method used to communicate as well as the responses you receive. There is no continuity across managers or c level people.

pros: Health benefits are good and the over job is challenging but self rewarding
cons: Comcast, does not care for financial health or over all morale of none managers. Costumers and employees are just numbers

pros: You get discounted cable, internet, phone, and home security services.  You also get a very reasonable ramp up for commission employees.
cons: High turnover.  Direct Sales Reps turn over as fast as the department gets them.  this effects a supervisors ability to build a team and make their commission pay.  Do not provide the tools to be successful. Management says there is uncapped income potential and this is not the case.

review: Big Company has it's pluses and minuses
pros: Large company that can offer a vast array of experience and challenges to employees looking for them.
cons: A lot of red tape and entrenched mentalities to deal with. Still very much a "cable company."
job title: Senior Director of Payroll, Tax, and Compliance

review: It was a good entry level job.
pros: They worked with my schedule while I was in school.
cons: During that time it was hard to up sell the product because of so many issues with repairs and outages.

pros:
-Great group of people to work with.
-The regional office in Trevose has some perks. There is a gym, video game systems in the break area.
-They do offer training
cons:
-Not much room for growth.
-Low pay 
-The regional office is monitored very closely because it's in the backyard of the headquarters building

pros:
High growth company;  collaborative;  fast paced; great products; diversified organization; community focused; good compensation; results oriented; metrics driven; high accountability 
That is all for the pros.
cons:
Financially focused above all else; customer service challenges; systems and processes are not as simple as they could be 
No other feedback

pros: Great pay! Work with the public! Great benefits!!
cons: You lead astray! Lies!!! No help from managers! There little to no advancement! A lot of employees have been in the same position for over 25 years!! Not loyal to employees!

pros: Pay OK. Great Benefits. Training Class was good.
cons: Culture not good. Quality are stressed but in reality numbers were everything. If you didn't make your numbers, they acted like you weren't even working even if your quality was off the charts. We were told we had a ramp up time to get up to the number but had to reach those numbers day one. They didn't care how you got your numbers as long as you got them.

pros: Ok place to work can be stressful but good compensations and great benefits including free services tv Internet and so on.  Nice people to work with.
cons: Hard work very stressful at times had to meet quotas and call handle time while providing great service.  Didn't always feel appreciated

pros: Pay is good.  Incentives and benefits are ok. Dont have to pay outragous fees the customers do.
cons: They will fire you for no reason. You are number and nothing more.

pros: Great benefits and generous pay - while it lasts!
cons: Comcast has a culture of youth.  Employees over 45 are marginalized by managers and outright bullied by 30-ish hipster coworkers while corporate and HR turn a blind eye.  This is not a place where a mature worker will feel safe or welcome.

pros:
- Safe paycheck
- Big company
- Cool events
- Great name on your resume
cons:
I am only speaking for contractors here, NOT FT employees
- Can cut your hours at any time
- No benefits
- DOn't get paid for sick days and what not
- Pretty bad communication

review: Tenure means nothing today compared to the past.
pros: Good benefits and paid time off.
cons: Just as with their customers, being a long time employee means nothing to the company. New hires receive better compensation today than seasoned techs.

pros: Very time intensive,Everything down to the minute. Good benefits program
cons: They don't practice what they are preaching to new employees. I asked my supervisor for some sales training since they though I should do more upselling. She promised she would but months later the time hasn't come.

review: Great Place to Work if you Don't mind Micro Mgmt.
pros: The bonus' were good when offered.
cons: The management team meant well but overly heavy on meetings, and daily office visits.

pros: If in north Atlanta area great location, bus lines available and parking is plentiful. Restaurants everywhere and convenient to Mall during your lunch break.
cons: Schedule changes, supervisors are great but training is limited due to call volume. No training class everything is OJT bit co workers are available to assist.

pros:
Works on cutting edge of technology
Talented people
Good training
Works on cutting edge of technology
Talented people
Good training
Would like to work again.
cons:
Fast paced. 
Working late hours.
Too many production bridges to support.
Fast paced. 
Working late hours.
Too many production bridges to support.

Fast paced. 
Working late hours.
Too many production bridges to support.

pros: great pay and benefits. company vehicle.
cons: i am the first face a customer of the most hated company in the country sees after being infuriated by customer service. job is incredibly over metric'd. there is no way to do the job honestly without hurting your own numbers.

pros: Decent product. Good markets. Decent pay and insurance. Stock has done well.
cons:
Most hated company in America. 
Pushes their liberal agenda onto their employees and generates a politically charged environment.
Mindbogglingly beaucratic and inefficient system of work flow....Customer is dead last.

review: Great place to work. Tons of swag. Top preforms are compensated amazingly.
pros: As a top performer had a paid vacation and special recognition. Best performers are awarded.
cons: Poor preformers will struggle. Lots of unethical behavior and favoritism. High attrition

pros: Plenty of over time free cable and vehicle
cons: Forced overtime. lack of recognition.  all advancement with in the company is all politics. Pay is below national average you can make ends meet with over time

pros: Commission and health benefits are fantastic! Some people make 3 times their hourly pay in just commission.
cons: Lots of politics and favoritism in the office. You get burned out quick and you are monitored for EVERYTHING (bathroom breaks, hold time, call time, etc)

pros: Good base pay, good insurance, fun people to work with
cons: Construction fallout where even if you make the sale you still lose money for something that is out of your control. Impossible standards and terrible leads

pros: The people I work with are generally nice and positive. Competitive pay, good courtesy services
cons: I have called around 20 mental health providers in my area and although HR claims I have mental health coverage not a single one accepts my insurance

pros: Nice benefits and discounted cable
cons: Low morale, always changing process

pros: benefits,  shift bidding opportunities, turn over so high they will promote you quickly ,  free products, best  product
cons: changing metrics, call routing , turn over, micromanaged, performance goals not realistic to  maintain consistantly

pros: Great Benefits, decent atmosphere if local management is good.
cons: Take advantage of a tough economy by really applying pressure to the front line folks to do double the work while the company rakes in massive profits and gives non existent pay increases.

review: Very political and poor performance management
pros:
Good benefits
Competitive compensation package
Nice work accommodations
cons:
Career development programs are lacking
Those who do well and survive are politically connected, not talented
Very unprofessional culture
Driven by status quo, not innovation contrary to management's rhetoric

pros: Flexible hours, not tied down to an office
cons: Comcast changed comp plan and dropped our salary by around 12k. They also eliminated yearly raises and stock options. Turning into a churn and burn sales job. Poor morale. Can't provide sales promotional material that isn't expired on a timely basis.

review: Focus seems to be toward employees and customers
pros: Great benefits. Good coworkers. Not much else
cons: Low pay, horrible hours, limited opportunities. Constant pressure to meet metrics with no regard for customers.

pros: You got free internet and cable.  They pay was not bad for call center work.  Somewhat laid back, didn't care if you wore jeans, etc..
cons: Seems like the wrong people were managers.  No real lounge area to have breaks.  They were very strict on schedule adherence

review: Loved the work and workers management horrible
pros: Decent pay and benefits workers actually care about customers
cons: Management harasses while you're on the phone with customers

pros: Paid Training, decent hours, great tools and equipment
cons: Poor Management , bad morale no matter when you went. High expectations and metrics making it increasingly hard for technicians to be successful.

pros: Good pay, extremely good health benefits, free cable
cons: Over saturated Sales teams that create a hostile work environment.  Very poor order management processes creating headaches for sales team, customer, and customer support.  Limited Enterprise product set.

pros: Excellent benefit packages. Some free and all services discounted.
cons: Very stressful environment. High expectation to sell constantly. Strict attendance policy. Plan 24 hours in advance to get ill.

pros: Very Flexible on time requirements.  Work started around 11 am and ended around 8 pm.  Good if you are an evening person.
cons: Compensation was about 28k base,  Commission was another 35k but somewhat difficult to hit consistently

pros: Pros of working in Comcast Business Class is that the commission is unbelievably great!
cons: Con's and challenges are the fact that customer service is terrible, residential service is as well. This makes it difficult as a business rep when the customer can't differentiate between the two.

review: Frustrating to deal with constant changing of policies and my particular departments lack of a consistent process.
pros: Very good benefits and stock plan
cons: My department has too many managers, each with their own agenda

pros: Good culture of teamwork, enjoyable contests and incentives used to hit targets
cons: Call center outsourcing doesn't place high emphasis on customer service.  Customer turnover is constant and seems to only be replaced by "new" customers, who were probably previous customers back for a new sales price

pros: They give a lot of sick days, there's many ways to get days off, and the people are really nice. Great benefits.
cons: The only downfall is that its just a boring job, you get yelled at all day on the phone and you have to sit in the same spot.

pros: Good people, free cable, internet. Stock options, decent potential
cons: Long commute for some, some unfair employment practices, some unfair working conditions

review: Its an Okay place to work
pros: One of the Pros is the ability to make commission no matter what department you work in
cons: You have to have ALOT of patience, Mean customers 247. Raises arent good at all.

pros: Employees get free Internet, free Cable, discounted equipment, and discounted Phone services
cons: Unrealistic phone and sale metrics, changes no warning mid-month, no daily metric standing for guidance.

pros:
Pay is good could be better
Room for growth
Company events for families
cons:
Hours/ Shifts not ideal for families
Employees treated as a number only
Metrics unrealistic

pros: Great co-workers and good benefits
cons: Highly political.  Potential for advancement depends on who likes you regardless of performance

pros: Some great people to work with, benefits, free cable and internet. 401(k), medical, and dental.
cons: Warehouse gets screwed, equal raises for poor and hard workers. Hard work doesn't pay off. Performance doesn't reflect promotion more of who you know.

pros: Fairly good employee benefits offered.
cons: Job performance is evaluated solely on the employee's ability to meet or exceed a designated quota for customer sales.

pros:
Good pay
Employee appreciation functions
Great Benefits
cons:
No supervisor or Manager support
Poor training techniques

pros:
Benefits are good.
People are nice.
Work can be challenging if the resources are available.
cons:
Very politic environment.
Management is not truthful.
Promotions are mute.
Pay is not equal to the work you put in.

pros: If you get numbers they leave you alone but that's about it
cons: Was a dsr/xsp for 3 years they constantly change the commission plan and what they want u to do which makes it really hard to stay positive when ur pay is constantly cut

pros: Innovative, Industry leader, great products, looking to change customer perception for the better
cons: Super Political,  Cronyism, high employee turn over

pros: Working with a successful large company with advancement opportunities and position in states across the United States.
cons: Upper management do not treat employees like human beings. You do not feel appreciated for your hard work.

pros: Like doing the work, no one looking over your shoulder. Free cable and internet.
cons: Pay, management, routers, dispatch, everything is a joke and you get nailed for things out of your control which then affects the raise you won't get.

pros: Great benefits, pay, vacation time and management. Work for Comcast if they have an office near you, it's definitely worth it.
cons: The market is saturated with Comcast's service. Being outside sales for Comcast is a mixture of finding current customers and finding people who LOATHE the company.

pros: You get a iPad woooh! -_-
cons: Working for Comcast is like working for a cult!! They pay you to lie to their customers about the services and prices and quality of services , which is trash btw !! So the customers believe you or the other agent and calls back upset and cursing at you because everything is a lie.

pros: Good Benefits.  Nice perks. Treats employees pretty fair,
cons: Sales goals are sometimes unattainable.    It's hard to move up in this company, unless you stay in the same department.  They should offer more training to move up with the company.

pros: Free cable and internet and cheap phone service
cons: Working in the call center is pure hell, supervisors do now want to talk to customers and customers aren't happy with the product so you deal with angry customers all day.

review: Good place to work but bad management
pros: Take your truck home, Employee stock purchase plan
cons: Management constantly changing which means work styles change. They are contracting out more work everyday and cutting in house jobs more and more

review: Its a Paycheck, and free cable
pros: Decent benefits, so so pay
cons: no work life balance, management does not listen or care. cant work the schedule assigned to you? too bad, your screwed.

pros:
Medical, Dental and Vision benefits
Free cable
cons:
The culture encourages dishonesty 
Customer service is not important

review: Favorites is the name of the game
pros: If you are under the right people you can learn alot.
cons:
People are blackballed from advancing for personal reasons.
Pay is unreasonable for the amount of work expected.

review: im a new employee, ill do a full review after a year
pros: free cable and internet service, good phone rates
cons: starting pay was lower than expected, thats the only downside so far.

pros: Free Courtesy Cable, and time off.
cons: They outsource customer service and collections and when customers would call for "service" these people didn't know what they were talking about since not trained properly by company.

pros:
flexible time, some medical benefit, some eye  benefit, some dentist benefits, vacation time is Ok, 
salary is low, but in this economic times, some is better than nothing
cons: no union in the company, so the management do what they want when they want., impossible  to recommend new ways or ideas

review: hire and Fire Mentality 20% make It
pros: The benefits are very good
cons: the hours they schedule door 2 door people aren't home 50% of the time. About 80% eventually get terminated for missing sales goals. 20% make it (honestly???) The big sellers sell the most so they get the most complaints. My moralllllllls won't allow me to be a big seller. They basically encouragge reps to scam customers just to get the numbers. Stay AWAY

review: Hype & promises when you start but then reality sets in
pros: Great benefits! Medical, dental, vision, life, disability.....  and free/reduced price cable, phone & internet services.
cons: Feel like a number. Very large company...no sense of belonging. If you were gone there would be somebody at your desk in days.

review: This company is only still in business as it is a monopoly
pros: Great benefits, good salary, employee perks for performance
cons: If you like management by confusion, constant reorganization this is the place for you.

review: good place to work, however, there are no advancement opportunities within sales and the department changes constantly
pros: decent starting pay/ flexible hours/good benefits/free service
cons: no advancement opportunities/no real job security/ department changes directives constantly without warning

pros: Team work, learning/ training, sups/ managment
cons: starting salary and time it takes to make decent money. Medical benefits are a joke and no where near competitive with other companies

review: Great Honeymoon period, than a complete 180 when manager was faced with pressure
pros: I like my teammates - try to help one another
cons: I saw more than 2 people get railroaded by an LSM that should have been fired years ago. I am scared for my own job. There is no one to go to if you are in a satellite office.

review: Excellent experience with Comcast, benefits are great and employee focused by mid management.
pros: The best expierence is the coworkers, who become like family.  The benefits the company provides are very good.
cons: Unless your in Upper Managament the opportunities for growth are very limited or you know the right person.

pros: perks, benefits, free cable, time off policy
cons: Sr. management creates a lot of "buzz words" but never really follow through. The middle management is busy self-promoting. If you get a job here, ensure you come in at a high enough designation since the management is old school and you need gray hair to grow. Overall, I'd say stay away!

pros: Great Pay, Great incentives, Great work hours
cons: Poor, uneducated management that only focuses on the employees that excel. Terrible on development and no internal advancement opportunities.

pros: Great compensation, first class treatment during training, great benefits
cons: 1/5 of the employees make 80% of the commissions.  If you do not have vendor partners, then you are up a creek without a paddle.

pros: Good people and great work/life balance.
cons: Bureaucratic mess.  Hard to get the simplest things done.  Even IT support is underfunded.

pros: Good Benefits for health care and "extra" perks like cell phone discounts, free cable, etc.
cons:
Locally changes without telling/working with employees.  
A lot of people have a deep seeded hatred with the company and everything associated with it.

pros: Salary and Benefits are great. You can make unlimited bonuses in the sales department.
cons: Forced up sell, even when all instincts and probing tells you what the customer can qualify for. Seems like badgering at times. If you are a bs'er you'll do well. I wasn't.

pros: Benefits are very good - after 90 days.
cons: The culture in business sales -quotas, metrics and results matter more than employees.  Acceptance of high employee churn.

pros: My org is very remote work centered. Engineers are given the freedom to make sound technical decisions.
cons: Lots of layers of management, people-related decisions can be hard to make (raises, promotions, new hires).

pros: good benefits, health care benefits good, 401k matching, free service but you still have to pay for equipment rental.
cons: your just a number, tons of contractors that are not trained, change commission to keep pay low.

review: worked for 9+ years and was shown the door because of my age and i didnt hang out with sups.
pros: good company to work for great job
cons: local managers and supervisers show a lot of favortism to certain employees and remove ones from the company that they fill dont blend.

pros: Great benefits! Average pay scale.
cons: Too many politics and favoritism in supervision and management. Lack of communication between all departments on front end for a communication company.   Metrics are obsurd in all front line positions including technical and call center.  Most individuals that advance are friends  with upper management.

review: Dead-end drudgery, stupefyingly dull, mindless tedium
pros: It's a job...its not especially difficult. Just adding some words now to reach minimum of 20
cons: Endless...robotic job, every customer is justifiably irate, management lies nonstop, at all levels...HR just a shield and a shill for upper mngmnt, commission never paid out what it should have, dumpy facility, sketchy employees, wage decreases, little or no raises even when earned, I could go on...

pros: Some room to grow, decent pay for hard work, not much experience required.
cons: Unprofessional, HR department very lacking, employees concerns never taken seriously, ever changing compensation plan, high school type atmosphere.

pros: Benefits, discount service(cable, tv, phone) and  convenient location. Was able to pick your hours. Friendly people. Was able to learn how to troubleshoot and documentation.
cons: The matrix was very stressful. Change the job from tech support to sales. The systems we used was very slow and cheap. Communication between other departments was lacking. Revolve door and micromanagement was very high. Can't move around other departments unless you know somebody.

pros: Free Cable, Aesthetic Work Space (at Headquarters)
cons: Bureaucratic, Lack of trust, Siloed Business Units, Difficulty in navigating the business, Heirarchy like nothing I have ever seen in a professional workplace, low paying

pros: Good Work Life Balance, Flexible Work Schedules, Good Benefits, Many Opportunities to Learn New Skills
cons: Depending on which Region you work in there are lots of hidden race issues, which hinder the growth some employees over others.

review: Looks great when hired but hard to top out on pay scale.
pros: Helping people fix their cable. Being outdoors. 4 10 hour shifts. Got to take work van home, saving on gas money and miles put on personal vehicle.
cons: Constant change. Unrealistic job performance expectations. Rude customers because of product issues, caused by lack of employee training.

pros: Heavily discounted cable/ internet/ phone services for employees
cons: You can only move up if you know the right people, they don't promote based on performance or potential but rather if you are friends with the management.

pros: Great for a student looking to make money, but still focus on school.
cons: Very stressful. Ridiculous quotas that can be difficult to meet depending on the market you are calling in.

pros: benefits/ starting pay/ day off/ uncapped commissions
cons: No real advancement opportunities/ have made less money each year I have worked at this company/ high turnover/

pros: none this place is a joke
cons: Antiquated technologies, abuse of HR-1B, clueless management, clueless engineers. Pay is absolutely at the bottom of the scale.

pros: Pretty decent hours, pay was not very good. Managements treatment of employees was very bad. Monthly quotas were unattainable at best.
cons: Little pay and no job security. People are hired and fired seasonally to manipulate pay and salaries. Your better off working elsewhere.

review: Not a great place to work for minorities
pros: decent benefits compared to other companies in the area
cons: try to give off the image of inclusive, but the comments made behind closed doors shows it is a false narrative. I would not tell any friend who is not a straight male to ever apply there and expect fair treatment.

review: I think part of the problem is you have people in leadership who have no clue what they are doing.
pros: great people, challenging work, and benefits
cons: Compensation has not caught up with inflation

review: Not all it's cracked up to be
pros: PTO, closed on holidays, free internet and cable
cons: The company only cares about upper management. There is a 10 minute grace period until you are considered late, then my dept was told we had to use our vacation if we were a minute late. It took several calls to HR to fix it. There are monthly surveys to fill out about the company/dept, but nothing ever gets done to address your complaints.

review: Its OKAY If you do not want to Advance.
pros:
The hourly pay is low compared to other call center jobs.
Management is not interested in suggestions from employees.
cons: Comission is paid, which is a plus.

pros: Great benefits - free cable basically.  Bill was arounde $30 a month for everything
cons:
Low pay
Terrible trainer for 8 weeks
Too rigid & not flexible
LOTS of turnover

pros: Great pay, bonuses and good ins.
cons: Company is reactive not proactive they are behind the times in tech for trouble shooting. Horrible upper mgmt.

pros: They pay you pretty well if you haven't gone to college and give you free cable.
cons: For what you do the pay sucks by comparison and if you are smart you'll be criticized for it?

pros: The benefits are good. Free services. Always have new products.
cons: The pay isn't that good for the amount of work. Getting a bad rep for firing people.

review: Not so great place to work.
pros: Stable company that is holding its own.
cons: Dont care about employees all the much and react to everything.  They are now proactive.

pros: Cheap Internet, phone and cable service
cons: Crappy payment.  The top earners only get 0.5 % commission.  That;s half of 1 percent commission to put up with all that abuse on the phone.   They treat the employees and customers like dirt.  They only care about the money.

pros: Great money and bonus pay!
cons: Terrible call center hours of operation without much chance of a shift change.Not enough training and a lot of lies on job duties and schedule

pros: Free Comcast services and pretty decent benefits
cons:
Management; as far as escalated calls go...you're basically on your own
Training doesn't properly prepare you
stressful calls
shifts
constant changes

review: Unrealistic goals, Poor Corporate Leadership, and a company that could care less about employees!
pros: The discount on cable, high speed & phone services were good, not great.
cons: Company values were only written not practiced, this is a complete burn out job with no rewards for leadership!

pros: Commission is uncapped. The potential of how much you earn is totally up to you.
cons: If customer cancelled the service you offered within 2weeks, you loose that commission.

review: I learned a lot about customer service
pros: They pay is very competitive. Benefits are great, you get discounts on all services such as phone, high speed internet, cable, home security. I paid around 50.00 for all
cons: high turnover, managers having pick and chooses. commission structure change all the time,

review: It is interesting to work for comcast
pros: Courtesy video, internet and phone services Health Dental and vision benefits. 401k, quarterly bonuses, multiple offices to go to for assistance.
cons: Lack of communication. Internal employee assistance. Low compensation for such a highly profitable company. Favoritism and politics. Extremely poor management.

review: it changes constantly, so you would need to adapt every day to changes
pros: very good benefits, very good health insurance is not heavy work
cons: in order to move up you need to know management is not what you know is who you know ( sadly )

review: ok job but not a good career
pros: company van not having to go into an office all the time discounted services
cons: there is a lot of things that are out of your hands angry customers, alot of people treat you like trash because someone else was rude to them.

pros: good benefits and employee discounts
cons: 2015 the numbers have been extremely higher where no one is making good commission checks, they are always getting rid of a department and/or relocating it, pay sucks, management doesn't have your back,

pros: Good training program and decent benefits.
cons: Low pay, not a lot of room for advancement, lots of micromanagement, poor work life balance

pros: Comcast has fast bandwidth for a cheap price
cons: Sales people are treated so bad.  This is an operations run company who hires manager who have no industry experience or management experience to lead a senior voice team.  What company does that.  Of course the manager's lack of experience causes the team to fail but only the team gets written up.

pros: Stable, good people, competitive compensation
cons: Everyone is clueless/typical beucratic run arounds

pros: At the time decent hourly rate and great Commission
cons: Poor management and its all about who you know not what you know. Place is high school for adults at the Manassas location

pros: The Pay is good along with the Commission
cons: Training could be better to prepare your for what you will be dealing with from management all the way to the customers

pros: Great training, salary and benefits. Fun atmosphere at office. Great spiffs and interactive employee events. Great bonus structure. I like
cons: Company made competition mandatory. Employees stealing sales. Very high turnover so no peer relationships. Have to use your own vehicle for work everyday.

pros: Good health care, deeply discounted entertainment services
cons: It's awfully hard to help a customer when you're all about the bottom line. Pretend you care and don't help the customer is what's drilled into the representatives. No wonder why everyone hates us.

pros: Haven't had an issue with any supervisors at company. Benefits are great and only took 5 years to get a good shift. Monday-Friday
cons: Need to be ok with upper management cutting commission quarterly. Also management states they care about employees but actions always show otherwise.

pros: Healthcare benefits, discount on Comcast services
cons: Terrible work-life balance for front line supervisors and managers.  Expect you to work 55-65 hours a week.  If you do your job well, they raise metrics and ask more of you with no reward or recognition with no additional support.  If you complain or make suggestions, you're labeled as not being a team player or "owner."

pros: Courtesy services free, flexibile shedule, pay, training and development, stock purchase plan
cons: Customer service, contractors, cross function communication between departments is a complete fail with no urgency to fix.

pros: Not on the phones all day. If you do your time you can move positions yearly. Gives good experience.
cons: Wrong supervisor will make it unliveable. Management, nor HR will help if supervisor has good numbers.

pros:
Great benefits
4 10 hour weeks, so 3 days off a week
Employee discounts on services
Room to grow within the company
cons:
Management changes once to twice a year.
Depending on the current management, it can be a fun environment or horrifying environment to work in.

pros: Comcast acknowledges it would be good to accept the diversity of their multi-cultural employees.
cons: They do so by forming diversity clubs, which encourage culturally diverse employees to gather amongst others of their culture, effectively developing into a segregated workforce.  It's so nice revisiting the 1950s again.

pros: Being able to work for home and choose the hours I would like to work.Love being able to communicate with customers
cons: Low pay and the assistance for help is not readily available which makes the customers frustrated and want to hang up on you

pros:
Good benefits:
401k 6% match 
Stock purchase plan 
Healthcare 
free/reduced cost service 
some good leaders
cons:
Must give up your morals (doing what's right) to hit goals. 
If you have a good leader it makes all the difference, but they are few and far between.

pros: Comcast was a good place to learn about technology.
cons: Career advancement was stifled, unless you are part of the chosen ones.  Afraid to hire good talent because of the cost.

review: Poor Mid Level and upper level management
pros: Great benefits and compensation. Most services free, and those that ar enot, 20-40% off regular price.
cons: Not very career oriented. Want those that work to stay in same group, or leave. Not interested in promoting from within, unless you know someone.

pros: Great Co-Workers; Learning Experience; Meet Great People
cons: Low Pay; Bad Management; Poor Technology; Old System taken over from Adelphia; No Growth; Endless Metrics

review: Was Nice but getting he job was very demanding.
pros: Nice enviroment, with nice people, everyone seemed to get along.
cons: Expected us to pass a test at second day of training, food was kinda expensive.

review: Comcast Is not the best place to work
pros: The Company is an okay place to work
cons: They don't like to look out for the people that are on the phones making the money for them , they don't like to promote within.

pros: Good insurance benefits and 401K plan. Occasional snacks in the lunch room. Free Cable, Data and Phone, can be a nice perk.
cons: Horrible work life balance. They have no concern for customer service. Making the sales number is all that counts, so beware.

review: Great Benefits with a focus on the employee
pros:
Free cable
Great pay structure
Employees are valued
cons:
Customers are not the focus
Too many departments with no direct contact between them

pros: Vacation time and Benefits, Decent Pay
cons: forced to give poor customer service due to lack of options to utilize to help customers, treating people like numbers and dollar signs instead of people.

pros: Good question! I've not found positives at Comcast. It meets a current need. Not impressed with 'leadership' team or processes.
cons: Deceptive practices, management concerned only with metrics which are vague and subjective at best. Systems crash frequently and quality assessments are based on subjectivity of untrained  individuals. Lies and miscommunication abound.

review: Great benefits, and perks like cable and Internet discounts.
pros: Free cable, Internet and phone, time off benefits, training, and work-life balance. Team environment, bonus and commission opportunity.
cons: Customers yell scream and berate you and unless it is sexual or racial management could care less. Supervisors are not available.

review: Great technology, but something is lost in the translation to the customers.
pros: Great benefits,  free cable and internet, and diverse company
cons: Atrocious attrition rate, disconnected leadership, and difficult to transition into different divisions like NBC/Universal

pros: Good Benefits and decent pay
cons: Managers sometimes have no clue on what is going on, they just want project done and to brag about it

review: All about the numbers not the people
pros:
Call center hours gives flexibility 
In job training 
Discounted services 
Fast pace
Changes quickly 
Meet lots of interesting people
Programmer fair
cons:
Lack of work life balance
All about the numbers
Lack family environment
Changes too quickly with lack of info 
HR not approachable 
High turn over

pros: Great benefits. Decent hours. Alot of opportunities if you get in with the right people.
cons: Way too much middle management. Depends on your position. Broken processes and to many departments. Alot of left hand dosent know what right hand is doing.

pros: Headquarters building is very nice. Senior leaders will take the time to mentor interns.
cons: The rate at which they turn interns into full time employees is very bad. I have been at the company 4 years and do not see many full tie opportunities

pros: Lots of fresh air and the scenery always changes
cons: Company lost sight of what really matters....... The Customer Experience

pros: Lots of time off accumulated quickly. Great career and pay if you're willing to cheat lie and steel to get in to management. Otherwise you're treated and paid like a dog.
cons: Walking outside five or six days a week no matter what the weather. Just to have people slam a door in your face and treat you like dirt.

pros: Benefits, career advance opportunity, bonus eligibility, free services, new office, always changing, innovative in certain aspects
cons: No work life balance, compensation low, varies with supervisor, every one is a sales person

pros: Great benefits, fun and relaxed work atmosphere
cons: Been laid off twice due to department relocation, pay not great compared to industry jobs, you feel like a number more than an actual person at times, not much opportunity to move up in the company

pros: Only have to go into office once or twice a week
cons: Bad communication, pay plan cut every other quarter, don't care about employees

pros: Great benefits and great people to work with.
cons: Low pay for amount of stress and work that you do. Senior Management play favorites and so do Supervisors.

pros: If you find a way to make quick sales every two weeks great money.
cons: People who are not doing well do anything to prevent you from making  $$$. Poor management and lack of standards. But it is Comcast.

pros: Fortune 50 company brand recognition. People take your call when you say your with Comcast. Perks, nice parties in house.
cons: Very corporate, competitive, high performance environment with unrealistic sales goals, and endless meetings and time wasting training.

pros: Easy. Stable. Predictable. Always a lot of business changes. Lot's of overtime available. Projects to work on off of phones.
cons: Changes in policy. Other agents that don't follow the policies make your job harder by training the customers poor expectations

pros: Good benefits for health insurance, dental, vision, training is good and plenty
cons: Unable to work remotely, there is no need for a project manager to be onsite to do the job that is required

pros: Flexibility, pay, and benefits
cons: Poor management, lack of direction, and impatience

pros: Great leadership, the company is cash heavy so continually invests in employees and network.
cons: Hunter role, be prepared to grind it out every week trying to set appointments that will hopefully turn into opportunities.  Can be difficult to manage pipeline with longer sales cycles.

pros: none, you dont want to work here. They allow 3rd party companies to destroy their name and risk their customers
cons: Your customers treat you like trash

review: Not bad if you want to stay there temporarily
pros:
great cable discount
pay is ok if you are just coming out of college and you want to be in tv
cons:
no diversity
lack of professionalism from management

pros: Work/Life balance, the product audience scale and access to progressive technology
cons: Bureaucracy, lack of vision, hierarchical management, culture focused on reporting structure, lack of maturity in product development

pros: beautiful building.  solid company.  smart people.
cons: too much politics at HQ.  too little collaboration.

pros: Able to provide service to customers but rushed by management to spend limited time
cons: HR is limited and does not honor the "open door policy" they preach.

pros: got my foot n the door of networking
cons: management dont know there ass from a hole n the ground and they want you to follow there direction????

review: It was an okay company to work for
pros: Free cable and Internet. Discounted service for phones. The people that are there are great.
cons: Pay is low. Work schedule is not flexible. Not much advancement opportunities

pros: It's big enough to move around and there is some room for growth
cons: management seems to not know what's going on. The wait to move is terrible. HR is unreliable.

pros: Fast-paced environment, ability to work on cutting-edge projects
cons: Long hours, too much work for one person, company doesn't appreciate its employees

pros: Flexible schedule, good team.  I worked in HR and things were a little weird, but overall pretty good
cons: Antiquated processes.  Paperwork for pay raises had to be faxed back and forth for mutliple signatures. Such a silly process.  Use technology!!

review: Major disconnect from upper and middle management
pros: Great benefits, co-workers were decent, solid company
cons: The Xfinity security home sales group had extremely poor upper leadership. They could not compete with any of the larger competitors.

pros: Great benefits and vacation package . Good involvement in the community. Family culture among departments. Promoted self promotion. Free cable and discounted services.
cons: Pay is too low for level of work.  High pressure. Sales focused not Customer focused.  Many processes need to be streamlined.

review: Perks, people, and ease of job do not make up for poor company policy.
pros: Great benifits, perks, and people you work with.
cons: Business isn't ran to serve the customer or worker just the corporation.

review: Large corporation with not a lot of upward mobility.
pros: Time off and good benefits. Generally had overtime that could be worked during the holiday season.
cons: Large corporation that was regularly changing structure and process. Pay could have been better. Training could have been better.

pros: Tons of budget money if you have a nose for it.     Lots of stupid employees to outclass
cons: Lots of stupid managers doing desperate things for self-preservation..  re-orgs are non-stop

pros: Great co-workers, free cable services, bonuses
