cons: Communication is terrible.  Expect all employees to be perfect and produce, however they neglect to inform employees of system issues that could impede perfect results and hold them accountable for matters out of there control

pros: Free cable/internet/phone, 401k, stock discount, great entry level job
cons: physically demanding, a large amount of responsibility without the compensation to back it up, poor customer service in other departments making job much more difficult than it has to be.

review: Good place to work but terrible pay starting out
pros:
-Trains you on everything
-Will take people with no experience
-Good supervisor
cons:
-Terrible pay when you start out
-Having to go into dirty homes or worst into crawl spaces
-Dealing with customers and the elements

review: A lot of build up and excitement, with little pay off in the end.
pros:
equipment
lot of hours
free cable
extensive training
paid training
cons:
free cable with no free time to watch it
low pay for the field
over worked
always rushing and always under pressure

pros: I had good hours and they were very accommodating for families. Good Work Life Balance
cons: Not real happy with managment decision regarding the nature of the business. There were times I had to push back on several ideas

pros: The time off benefits are great. They used to offer better perks/discounts, but that has been replaced by a point system website.
cons: The starting salary is never the greatest. The training is usually unorganized or not helpful to your new position.

pros: Good benefits and a lot of different career avenues
cons: Corporate America at its finest. Don't expect your opinion to matter if you have an innovative idea that's outside the box.

pros: The benefits are great. Courtesy account of all products and a great retirement plan
cons: More of a who you know...... not what you know network.

pros: All of the people who work there are close knit. The environment was very relaxed and casual, with little supervision.
cons: It was difficult to take breaks. The job was definitely too much for one person to handle, especially on busy days.

pros: Decent Commission Program. Fair Auto Allowance
cons: Inside Sales people able to offer better deals than outside. If customer calls in they can get a better deal and it cuts you out of a commission

pros: Great Pay base with bonuses...Good people to work with...very diverse and friendly people that work there.
cons: I worked in retention and its hard to try to get customers to stay loyal when some employees have shady sales tactics.

pros: Good time to ride the wave of compensation.
cons: Systems are far behind current needs of business. HR group is terrible. Broken processes that often cost people employment.

pros: Benefits, growth opportunities, core values
cons: Politics, work/life balance, competing agendas across functions affects teamwork, collaboration and the customer experience.

pros: They are focused on technology
cons: Only company I know where you can transfer to a lower potion and get a raise as long as you get in good with the hiring manager. To move up it is more about who you know than your skill set. Starting salary might sound good, but expect a 2 - 2.5% raise each year and hope it keeps up with cost of living and you do not get off shored.

pros: Benefits, vacation, paid time off
cons:
Constant change.
Always looking to squeeze out more profit for itself to the detriment of it's employees and customers.
Corporate mentality.
Definitely not a long term career move.

pros: Reasonable commission structure, decent payouts, and reliable products. Management is well trained and can be very helpful. Cheap service provided to employees.
cons: Unrealistic goals for services customer don't want. Quickly written up for not forcing customers into bundles with home phone service that they don't need.

review: Good money if you can sell, awful at taking care of the customers.
pros: You can make good money. Flexibility of schedule. Lots of room for tailoring personal sales process.
cons: Turn over is highest I ever seen.  Little support provided to do your job effectively.

review: This is the company that helps you understand  corporate America
pros: Free services. Large corporation so very good for resume. The ability to travel and learn other tools.
cons: Doesn't focus on leadership development and the organization does not pay employees what they are worth.

pros: Freedom to work at your own pace, solve problems as you see fit. Benefits are good. Company perks are great too
cons: They are started to micro-manage which is becoming a pain, Long hours or sometimes unreasonable, Communication between departments is poor

pros: Got the job with little experience, good pay for an entry level position.
cons: Not a lot of chances to move up from entry level, although the pay for entry level was good there wasnt much of a chance to build upon that pay.

pros:
Benefits
Earning Potential
Team Members
Company Philosophy
Financial position
cons:
Politics
Greed
Work life balance
Order Entry
Service Delivery

pros: Discounts for universal studios. Bulls tickets, medical benefits
cons: They don’t care about you as a human. I’m being forced to sit right next to a supervisor that makes so uncomfortable that I do not want to come to work.(harassment) She laughed about my anexiety disorder and Comcast listens has done absolutely nothing to help. I’ve seeked legs action that had been confirmed I have a case.

review: Honest review for comcast call center
pros: Friendly people, great environment, awesome incentives, higher than average pay for a call center.
cons: Companies policys and values and pricing although they are trying to change don't fit with the changing times and customers wants and needs as they should be

pros: Free cable free cell phone and flexible show up once a week for meeting from 10 to 1130
cons: Goals are almost unreachable, payscale low comparing to others

review: If you like a fast pace and stressful job ok place to work
pros: Great Benefits and a "Possibility" of good pay
cons: Constantly changing schedules and constanly changing everything period. Can be chaotic at times and stressful.

pros: Commission was nice when you were able to obtain it through sales goals
cons:
if you didn't meet your goals, you wouldn't get the commission for your sales.
co-workers gossiping like every other office.

review: This a good place to work if you're looking for stability
pros:
The company excels in hiring a diverse staff
Good opportunities available for education and training
Good Benefits
Stability
Low turnover
cons:
Salaries not competitive
Networking necessary to get ahead
Work/Life Balance
Unrealistic Expectations
More diversity needed in managment positions

review: Terribly disorganized, very difficult to get anything done, no support from upper management.
pros: The company has very good benefits
cons: Extreme workload, not given the tools to help customers, unethical practices

pros: Great benefit, great pay. full hands on training for everything
cons: They dont stand behind their word all the time. 50% of the supervisors are not open for approach (Slackers). Not many oppurtunity for advancement.

pros: Good benefits, great team environment.
cons: Poor working environment, desks, lighting overall environment.  Not designed properly for what it is being used for.  Things move at a snails pace no matter what it is.

pros: time off benefits and nothing else
cons:
EVERYTHING
*Pay*
*required shift bids*
*training is last priority*

review: The worst pay for a demanding job
pros: Job security,  ok benefits and drive company vehicle
cons: Pay is terrible,  management isn't organized. For a big corporation they should do better for their employees

pros: A company that continues to grow and offers many career opportunities to those who have a career vision.
cons: Otherwise its just a place that provide job opportunities for those who are complicate and never wish to grow.

pros:
- Great pay! $17/hr entry level pay
- Great Benefits; all major holidays off, dental/health, MAJOR service discounts, 2 week paid vacation after 90 days
- Superb  paid training (3 month total)
cons: - Did not seem to put customer first (guilty until proven innocent)

pros: Great hours- Ok pay and bonus
cons: Job on the line when you can't sell the home security product that nobody wants or can afford.

pros: Great, friendly people.  Positive work environment.
cons: Pay is below average for similar jobs elsewhere in the industry.

review: When I first started working here it seemed as if this big corporation made their employee's feel like they were people.
pros: They were good at promoting from within.
cons: The culture shifted, and people became numbers only.

review: Overall a good company to work for.
pros: Good pay and commission structure available to you from day one. Fantastic benefits for you and your family.
cons: Alot of micro management. Constant changing of comp plan to save the company money.

pros: Discounted cable is a plus but they still manage to raise equipment fees on their own employees!
cons: Micro managers, horrible pay, routing calls favorite repractice. They promise you in the beginning to make a ton of money but it's nothing but a glorified welfare check! This office ought to be shut down

pros: Benefits are great. You'll be fully taken care of with medical benefits. Flex pay is great. Although I wouldn't expect to get a vacation when you actually want it. Your commission rate will vary, the company will strive to keep you under a certain amount per year.
cons: Management is awful, processes are antiquated, and they literally have no regard for their customers

pros: They have great benefits and other perks.
cons: If you're looking to advance within this company, don't hold your breath.

pros: Great benefits and good people to work with.  Great products video internet etc and always trying to improve them
cons: Customer service is not good.  Management talks that it is improving but reality is that it is not.

pros: Free cable, Internet, reduced cost for phone and home security system. Cost for healthcare is competitive, stock matching, vacation, tuition reimbursement, and sales commission + salary.
cons: Advancement opportunities are not easily obtained.

pros: Great company, people and benefits
cons: Non stop on the phone and getting yelled by the customers. Extremely hard to take days off due to scheduling

pros: Good benefits, Good Company matto.
cons: No work life balance, Pay can be better for the work you do, lower management dishonest.

pros: used to have good healthcare until our deductible went to 500 from 250. other than that none!
cons: HIGH TURNOVER! Business is saturated. we don't have Verizon Fios so once you are connected with comcast business the sale is over. people steal steal steal contacts! you compete with your own local team. threatened job security every day!!!!  this division needs to be bombed!

pros: Great pay, and benefits.
cons: bad atmosphere and management.  More pressure on sales than on helping the customer.

pros: If you hit all targets you can make money.  Unfortunately goals constantly changes and your opportunity evaporates.
cons:
Micro Managed
Businesses in the territories assigned have been contacted numerous of times.
Long Hours
Compensation program constantly changes

review: New Comcast does not care about employees
pros: Great benefits, nice cable package, 4 day work shift, .. nothing left good to write. have to make this 20 word minimum.
cons: impossible goals, fight for your job daily, upper management will not listen to you, you are replaceable, constant manipulation tactics

pros: Good benefits, opportunity for advancement
cons: Big company slow to change, too many levels have to sign off on decisions, bottom line focused, not people focused.

pros: excellent overall employee benefits -
cons: Company prides self on internal promotion but that is not the case. Worked in call center and the only promotion even with college degree was still within a call center . Company does not really practice what they preach

pros: Fun to learn new technology.
cons: They treat you like an elementary school children. They write you up if you are a minute late getting into work or from break. It is not a professional environment.

review: Go in with a plan or you will get stuck
pros: 401k matching, reduced priced service(no not free as many assume)
cons: Advance difficult, no matter how hard you work if your not a favorite of a sup or manager you'll be in the same position forever

pros: Easy work, easy to learn and complete. People are nice and management is nice as well.
cons: Repetitive, boring. Rules change a lot, teams don't really communicate with each other even though everyone has to work together to complete tasks. It can get chaotic and political.

pros: GREAT benefits, competitive pay, good schedule choices, great co-workers
cons: Everything else. This really is a horrible place to work if you value your stress levels, work/life balance, or sanity.

pros: Benefits, hours, pay, bonuses, the values of the company
cons: Management does not like to take over supervisor calls. They put you in a coaching tool of you do all you can to try n calm the customer.  The moment they here your name in a rumor they fire you.  The company is dramaful.

pros: free cable, well used to be
cons: hourly compared to other comparable jobs

pros:
Decent pay
Outstanding benefits!
Lots of time off
cons:
Not easy to get promoted
Too many metrics to meet compared to other call centers

review: They will milk you dry then throw you to the wolves
pros:
Cheap cable and Internet. 
Nothing else.
cons: Pay, management, career advancement, everything else.

review: Extremely fast-paced and stressful, decent compensation.
pros:
-Fun incentives
-Decent wages
-Culture amongst agents/supervisors is great
cons:
-Compensation plan always changing.
-Micro-management coming from upper-management

review: Divisional IT role perfect for building experience.
pros: Tons of experience, easy to build a resume off of the different applications
cons: As a large company, its hard to make a change.

pros: Benefits are pretty much the only positive
cons: Too many cons to mention. Starting out was great felt like there was room to grow only later to find that was not the case

pros: health insurance and the training program is 8 weeks and you waste a lot of time
cons: everything else management is horrible they still your commission is horrible the level of stress they steal people and want you to deal with them

pros: Free cable, drive work van home.
cons: Starting to have a high turnover in all positions. To many changes the company is making every year affecting your work schedule and life at home. Not able to move up in company because of favoritism.

pros: Benefits are great, 401k, stock options, free cable, insurance options are all great. Selling a great service.
cons: Constant corporate change and oversight. The customer service has given the company a BAD rep.

review: Top heavy hurts customer experience and long term image
pros:
Very good benefits such as:
Tuition reimbursement
Complimentary services
Good Choices for Health Care/Dental
cons:
Management, unwilling to address concerns brought forward from employees not in management.  
A general feeling of being simply a peon is very common.

pros: Flexibility, Uncapped Commissions, Car Allowance, Great Benefits, Great Product suite
cons: Customer Service makes selling services an issue, Utility Company (EPB) has created some very intense competition and took a huge portion of the Comcast customer base.

pros: Good health benefits, great cable discounts.
cons: Hourly pay for service center employees is a joke, and they are constantly screwing with your commission. Doesn't really feel like they value their employees, which may explain the horrible customer service.

review: You have to commit to so much wrongdoing
pros: Salary was decent, although you'll get promised raises left and right, which you won't see.
cons:
i was terminated after becoming chronically ill. 
If you don't play with the right circles, they'll simply look to nudge you out.
Sexual harassment does go on, but you'll be terminated if you even attempt to rectify the situation.

pros: Great benefits, free cable and internet, love the people I work with, great pay and I can't think of anything else that's good here.
cons: Company doesn't care about their employees the way they used to, goals are almost hard to reach. Supervisors don't care anymore

pros: Great Benifits, procedures in place for chain of command. Chances to move and change jobs.
cons: Lots of Down sizing, every 4 years. Workload can be over whelming.

pros: Compensation in terms of Salary, Bonuses, Stock options, and Benefits were exceptional.
cons: Highly political and pressure work environment.

pros: Free cable, low premiums for insurance,
cons: Favoritism, and the difficult comp plan to meet...especially the points.

pros: Great pay and benefits with many opportunities to advance throughout the company in all types of positions
cons: Working ours can be hard to coordinate with life's needs.   Pressure to sell when not in a sales position is very high.

pros: good work environment .. no real dress code.. if you need extra money you can work overtime because you are paid piece production
cons: low wages,, production work /pay per piece so no sick day  or holiday pay..  no compensation for when the equipment breaks down on your assigned job

review: The worst experience I’ve ever had as an employee
pros: My co-workers were the only Pro, but 90% no longer work for Comcast any longer as they have chosen to find better and more ethical employment.
cons: Management and Supervisors were corrupt, manipulative and dishonest. Training was the worst i’ve ever encountered and the micro-management and constant leadership drama created an environment of employee harassment.

pros: Casual work environment that is a little too open. Sometimes it is an inner city lounge!?!
cons: Too casual as "people" come and go as they please! Can you believe lazy people can call "out" and not come in and not get into trouble? Some call center teams are 50% staffed because of the people they hire!

review: Decent folks for not great company
pros: Good work environment and decent folks. Wish the company's reputation was better
cons: Not that many except for the perception that they are money suckers with bad service and bait switch tactics

pros: amazing benefits, treated well. Training (depending on the trainer) is complete and useful. Highly recommended, you will be ready to hit the floor.
cons: change is constant, very political...you really need a rabbi. If you take FMLA plan on being let go.

pros: Amazing benefits package and pay is good if you get to quota or over
cons: This role is strictly hunting down new business. Comcast has a high penetration in the market so it's becoming increasingly difficult to fine new prospects

pros: innovation, amazing benefits, really great product to offer
cons: it's risky to offer your differing opinion in meetings as there is little or no support of employees by leadership

pros: Benefits, Medical, Dental, Vision - Work Environment.  Overtime Pay
cons: Little support or Training - Department is overwhelmed with Heavy work load. Understaffed. Several Employees resigning due to overwhelming workload, stress, inadequate support and unrealistic expectations for production. Unrealistic Numbers. Work-Life Balance.

pros:
-Benefits (vacation, flex time, carryover...)
-Team moral and participation
-Great products and services
cons:
-Micro managing
-Company standards too high
-Commission structure
-High turnover rate

pros: Great pay, good benefits, the co-workers are great. Hours are decent. Vacation time, hollidays and flextime is excellent. Some overtime available.
cons: Customers are extremely rude and irrate 90% of the time. Very disorganized. Overtime is sometimes manditory for less senior staff.

review: Big company with very weak leadership= unhappy clients & sales force.
pros: Good Benefits with a lot of perks.
cons: Horrible customer service, you want to ruin your reputation, do sales for Comcast.

pros:
Quarterly bonuses
Holiday Pay
Free service (if you take it)
If you work during a PPV you get to watch it free
cons:
Advancement
Unprofessional
Trying to force everyone to become a sales person
There are always problems with the service when sports events are on

pros: Virtually free cable, Freedom of an outdoor sales environment
cons: Ever changing compensation plans; Customer chargebacks; Below living wage base salary; residential sales;  Customer care steals sales; Payouts are based on installations completed, not sales made.  Low installation completion rates!

pros:
- decent support
 - decent management
cons:
- door-to-door sales on the business side
 - no leads
 - lots of cold calling and long hours into the night on the business dide

pros: Good benefits and free cable
cons: Good old boy network, as long as you suck up to your Director you will be safe. They don't properly account for your sales. They have violated so many Labor Laws

pros: A company that doesn't let money stand in the way.
cons: Large and very corporate don't always listen to the middle management people

pros: They have good management and many activities to facilitate inter-department cooperation
cons: There're too many contractors, who might not feel the company as home since there warefare and benefits are terrible

pros:
Great Sales Training Program
Opportunity to learn how to interact with anyone at any given time.
Opportunity to build a thick skin
cons:
As soon as your numbers drop your out.
Very strict sales matrix.
Very little chance of promotion.

review: I like the perks and the people but the pay is mediocre at best.
pros: Almost free services, benefits, vacation/time off, flexible hours
cons: PAY! If you aren't in sales expect to start out at a low hourly rate, compared to other companies.

review: worst job I have ever had
pros:
Free cable...seriously the best benefit  
Health care is good   not much else  to add on the pro side
cons: Pay is below market

pros: One of the positive aspects to Comcast is the fact their salaries and benefits are competitive
cons: One of the negative aspects to Comcast is the fact that as an employee you can be pigeon-holed in roles despite training and experience in other areas.

pros: Benefits package and pay.  Work location
cons: Leadership, constant changes to process, low moral

pros: Good benefits. management is really supportive. Ample opportunity depending on what site you work in.
cons: Stressful customer service interactions. A lot of employees were out for stress related reasons.

pros: Good benefits, large company for people that like moving around like myself, once your in people are willing to help you advance.
cons: You have to wait a year to switch positions, could use more structure...

pros: Great benefits, good people, great products.  Different positions available if you have the knowledge skill sets.
cons: Pay can be better, Need to know someone to advanced further into leadership, can be overworked for the pay you get within leadership.

pros: Job security...everyone needs/wants cable. can't think of anything else
cons: Rampant favoritism. They don't pay as well as people think.

pros: great perks, great pay, take home truck, awesome discounts on cable..they love to promote
cons: not alot of help to get the time u need to do the job neatly in its entirety

pros: The pay and benefits were great, and they had frequent bonuses and raises
cons: Way too much restructuring, your boss could change every few months along with your role

review: Company does not stand by their employees due to history of poor customer service
pros: Good Benefits, lot of avaliable shifts
cons: Must lie to customers about fixing their issues, bad computer software, unclean work environment, never cleans rugs and you will always sneeze

pros: Clear emphasis on new technology, good benefits, some folks have very flexible work times, gotta love having ping pong tables around.
cons: Lack of standards for support systems such as work request and ticket systems.  Multiple tools for teh same job.

pros: great medical, dental, vision and service benefits (cable tv, internet & phone)
cons: Too poor service areas and too many unhappy customers

pros: Benefits, ipad, phone, days off, good commission
cons: stuff constantly changes, goals go up you get paid less, goals go down you get paid more, you have to work where they want you to work, have to work in rain and snow outside

pros: The family atmosphere. I really loved that.
cons: The consistent brokenness of the systems that support the customers. It frustrates the customers and it frustrates the workers.

review: Comcast is the leader in the industry
pros: interesting technology and a leader in the cable industry
cons: brings most Engineering staff in as contractors and does not convert many of them to actual Comcast employees

pros: Good benefits, some nice opportunities
cons: Huge company, you can get lost and loose visibility as an employee, got let go after promises of new projects and opportunities and had no idea it was coming. I have no idea what happened.

pros: Good benefits , they are working to make the environment better , lots of commssiom opportunity if you are on top of your sales
cons: Environment of  a call center , old building,  sr. manager are distant from employees

review: The C in Comcast is for change
pros: Good benefits package and good pay
cons: The hours suck, the metrics are stringent, and no one knows what's going on. Your job today may be completely different tomorrow.

pros: Active in a lot of areas
cons: Too many chiefs who have been there too long and still try to do the same thing the same way as 25+ yrs ago

review: TSC department Comm Ops Field Liaison
pros: Great company ! Amazing perks ! Benefits are also bomb ! Quarterly bonuses are always a plus as well.
cons: Hard to build or grow with the company. The department was very unorganized. Favoritism was often shown amongst management.

pros: The work to life balance is not bad at all.  Company benefits are the best in the industry
cons: Management is a bit hands off. Policies around lead contention can be improved

pros: Free Cable for those who live in service area. That is all I have , otherwise I guess you can say a paycheck?
cons: lack of communication, frontline the last to know, treated as a number non competitive salaries , no opportunities for promotion or growth.

pros: Your co-workers are nice and you can buy lunch on the premises and theres a gym
cons: Comcast was a horrible place to work they made you fight to get paid commissions you earned even if your right and the mistake was on their side.  Almost impossible to move up and become supervisor because they prefer to hire outside of company.

review: Don't bother wasting your time...especially with business services
pros: The co-workers are nice people
cons:
Back stabbing personal, non communication from supervisors to employees or temp workers. Lack of compassion for personal.
Dishonest VP

pros: Fun people, nice office. The stock programs and 401k are good.
cons: Sales expectations to high. You end up hawking the ghettos where no one has any self control, being a total shark.

review: regular employees are great, managers are brain dead
pros: The regular people, benefits, salary, work itself.
cons: Managers need better training, don't know how to run a customer service based company. All management thinks about is money and numbers.

pros: Decent pay and benefits.   Free cable for those in their service area
cons: Poor and ineffective leadership, no Free cable for those outside of service area

review: Great Company to start your IT career
pros:
New technologies
Smart peers
No Micromanagement
Great benefits
Work/Life Balance for full timers
cons:
Not Competitive Salaries
Promotion poor
Too many managers
Too many phone meetings, more in room meetings helpful

pros: Great Benefits and cool people
cons: Constant changes to the pay structure and pricing. If the office stops doing well, expect micromanagement

review: Initially very positive - allowed to make changes
pros: Good benefits, very stable company
cons: Communication is tough with a company this large and some of the numbers are very difficult to obtain

review: It was the worst job I have ever had
pros: The benefits were very good,..once they kicked in.
cons: Lack of training, lack of knowledge between managers, and different segments of company.Lack of belief in employees, lack of trust, lack of faith, lack of opportunity but the most important item, lack of customer service (everyone hates you - Comcast that is!  .I could go on but the company isn't worth my time.

review: Work schedule a little rough, but still a good job
pros: Great benefits, lucrative, good co-workers.
cons: understaffed, a bit underpaid for the work, and cant always get a break during the day.

pros: I had lots of opportunity to advance my position. If the opportunity is there take it.
cons:
Low salary 
Constant change in policy , and procedures, doesn't allow employees to master their skills.

review: Everyday was a new experience working in the field
pros: Meet interesting and unique people everyday
cons: Kind of dangerous due to working after dark on the streets in areas that are not the best.

pros:
The benefits are really good
The company has many positions for those willing to relocate
The company works to be part of all the communities
cons:
Growth potential is limited
Culture can tend to be socially sub-grouped within departments

pros: The only Pro is Discounted services for employees.
cons: Not much room to advance. No structure in place to help employees do their job correctly. Most people learn things on their own.

pros:
Reduced cost if cable, not free but close.
401k matching ,health benefits.
cons: Poor pay for the work done on the tech side. Scheduling customers for impossible times and overworking and pressuring techs. Management does not stand behind their people.

review: Average place to do contract work
pros: Good opportunity to work with advanced technology and intelligent people.
cons: Poor working environment and management seems disconnected from attracting / retaining highly skilled contractors.

pros: the products. they do have great products for the value and the availability is getting better.
cons: grew too fast, hired too may and people stepping all over each other. The management says they care but really, only as good as your last month.

pros: Killer view from the 40th floor in center city
cons: They are evil. My job was to make sure they maintain their huge monopoly

pros: Extremely good benefits such as discounted services and a take home vehicle.
cons: Management was strictly by the numbers (metrics) and they didn't really care about the good work done. They focused on the negative.

pros: great benefits, great people to work with
cons: corporate america, taking local jobs and moving them to outside centers of excellence. Used to be very community oriented, no longer. Customer relations have suffered.

pros: Benefits are great and job is great.. pay is great ..the company is a fun company to work for
cons: Starting shift 3 to 12am ..the job is stressful and with no weekends off for one year

pros: I worked as a technician for several years with Comcast. The training was good and the pay and benefits were competitive.
cons: Mandatory overtime, Working in the weather good and bad. The local management and the corporate management have a  disconnect.

pros: The fact that they are a company that you can work at. Good benefits if you qualify for it. Good I guess
cons: Below average pat for the position. Local management and national management not on same page. High turn over for that position

pros: Management does not care about employees, pressures employees to make unrealistic goals, management chosen because of internal friendships instead of ability.
cons: Pay was okay, met some nice people.

pros: The people that you work with are very nice! It was a great environment to be a part of.
cons: Comcast doesn't have a great reputation for customer service, so youll personally receive backlash for that.

pros: Awesome benefits and the pay was decent (if in the appropriate department)
cons: Shady management. Paid women less then men. Treated people of color poorly. Stability was only certain of you were acquaintances with management.

review: Not as terrible as you may think
pros: Free cable, decent pay, plenty of time off
cons: Middle and upper management is very odd, only focused on numbers that can't be met

pros: Superb benefit package, offers add to work life balance
cons: No appropriate response needed to employees voiding processes, salaries could reflect market share closer

pros: This is s great company, very diverse, they offer OT a lot so that's a good way to save money. They are very generous to their employees.
cons: They're not organize, things changes everyday there's no set way to things

pros: Great company with dedicated, driven leadership and a great suite of products.  Lots of opportunity if you're willing to move.
cons: Very focused on financials, which doesn't always align with their goals of providing better customer service.

pros: Good pay, benefits, Hershey Park, and almost free cable.
cons: The company is always trying to reduce staff.  My job was in jeopardy three times in ten years.

pros: Great insurance good perks recognition for good numbers
cons: Horrible hours commission control and very little cultural diversity

pros: Great location, office, and benefits. Huge company so plenty of room to move around if you can network right.
cons: Lower base salary and bonuses compared to other companies. Some departments can have you working 60-80 hrs/ per week and some 30-40.

pros: The Money is ridiculous, and the benefits are tremendous
cons: I was let go because I was on track to make $70,000 for the year.  If you're not tracking to make $100,000, they kick you to the curb.

pros: Benefits, training, full time work
cons: The never ending change, the company policies were confusing, and rules and regulations were never set in stone

pros:
-Uncapped commission potential
-Innovative product 
-Good support from peers
cons:
-Frequent turnover causes issues with  training new team members.
-Lack of consistent instruction from management.

pros: If you want amazing discounts for cable service then work for them.
cons: The number metric they expect from you is at the mercy if the products don’t within a month or the customer don’t call in for any and everything.

pros:
Great company to work for, I really enjoyed my time there
Fexible schedule, good commission's, curtesy services, truly the best cable product out there.
cons: starting over from scratch each month can be a bear...

pros: Benefits Like Healthcare, 401k, Stock Options, Free Cable, Internet, Low cost Home Security and Landline.
cons: Stressful work environment, Some Store Managers deem unsuitable for their role, mostly due to poor internal promoting .

pros: Company has great benefits and courtesy services
cons: Always changing commissions structure making agents work overtime to meet numbers. The queue for sales agents is more like for billing agents. It should be named Inbound up selling representative

pros: They pay was high and there was extensive training.
cons: Going door to door is not a very good experience and there is not the support to do well so very high turnover.

pros: You get a lot of vacation time.
cons: Pay is very low. They don't promote from within. No room for growth, no time for a personal life.

pros: Good benefits medical, dental, 401k
cons: Cost of benefits verse pay, you can’t afford to live if you take the benefits.

review: Bad management at a good company.
pros: Pays more than McDonalds if you're desperate.
cons: Backstabbing managers and supervisors quick to throw you under the bus.

pros: Great company to work for overall
cons: Business Service Enterprise Department was still under development; constant change in managers and management styles did not allow for adequate, productive direction and time to develop true enterprise sales

review: Great company but there is still a lot of work to be done to improve customer satisfaction
pros: Great benefits and perks like free cable and internet service.
cons: Be prepared to be yelled at and verbally abused by upset customers

review: Customer focus gone, sales focus here to stay
pros: Decent pay when compared to the market and good benefits.
cons:
Ever increasing push to get sales in a dying industry. Pushing home phone service, of allthings, on customers to make up for lagging sales in an industry that is increasingly going to the internet for it's TV needs.

New hire training for technical repair agents now includes more weeks of sales/upselling training than technical training.

pros: benefits are decent, the actual work is good
cons: revolving door, fire at will, aggressively paranoid management, micromanagement, they drown themselves in red tape and thusly deliver subpar customer care year after year

pros: Almost free cable and benefits. Bonuses are great and you can win prizes.
cons: Instant depression when walking in to building and you get beat up on phone all day.

pros: Amazing Benefits, Company has a lot of revenue, Stock price well
cons: Many reorganizations, a lot of managed services, culture is outdated

pros: The Employee benefits are awesome.
cons: The management department can be slightly unprofessional and the computer systems are always on the fritz.

review: My experience has not been so great. They are micro-managers that do not respect others.
pros: My experience has not been so great. They are micro-managers that do not respect others. I was not pleased the treatment I was given
cons: My experience has not been so great. They are micro-managers that do not respect others. I was not pleased the treatment I was given

pros: None.. Discounted services. Nothing's special about it. Still have to pay some for services.
cons:
Rude unfair management. Was deducted healthcare amounts from my last paycheck even though I never had my healthcare through them. They promised me twice to refund it and it's been 4
Weeks since they first promised and never refunded my money. Complete joke working here.

pros: Decreased cost of Cable internet and phone
cons: Overburdened by upper management and unreasonable metrics as well as constant reductions in the abilitiy to make metrics and achieve income bonuses.

pros: Company car, office, salary, discounted cable.
cons: Management, company red tape, on call 24/7, in state travel, across the board performance raises (not based on performance).

pros: Great money, lots of perks and bonuses like gift cards and tickets to concerts and sporting events,  alot of good coworkers
cons: Strict metrics, hard to get help when needed when you have problem with an account or system issue

pros: 401k.A lot of good people.  Ii is very challenging job dealing with upset customers but can be very rewarding.
cons: They kept changing commission structure. We also had to bid on shifts every six months.

pros: Money, ability to work from home
cons: Management, hardly any racial diversity. All Caucasian club.

pros: Training pay is unmatched. You're well compensated.
cons: Just like many call centers, if upper management isn't a fan of you personally, you'll go nowhere.

pros: Employee discount on services, benefits are ok, Buying power, forefront of technology and always pushing for new, cool technology
cons: Disjointed decentralized leadership model, not as much advancement for opportunity that you would expect from a company this large

pros: Excellent benefits, Courtesy Services

pros: I can work from home an help the company customers to perfect service until.completion an being a part of a company an having responsibility making money an recruiting more clients
cons: None working for this company is all game to increase

pros:
Competitive wages
Part time is actually 25 hours a week
cons: Training is far away from anyone not in Peirce or King county, they don't care about your needs, training is vauge and difficult to grasp even for intelligent people.

review: Great Benefits at the cost of Moral Guilt
pros: Great Benefits, Sales Incentives, Competitive Pay
cons: Poor Communication from Leadership, Reprehensible Political and Moral drive of Comcast, Dated Products

pros: The pay is decent, the benefits are great. It's a great job to get your foot into a big company.
cons: There is no room for advancement and management doesn't seem to help out with it.

review: Good pay and benefits don't outweigh the stress of the job.
pros: Good pay and benefits. Opportunity to grow.
cons: No flexibility. A lot of micro managing. They changed your work schedule every few months. Hours and days changed.

pros: Great benefits, take home truck
cons: Upper management has no idea how to improve productivity so they use the "try anything" approach, micro management, unethical practices, bad communication within company

review: Tough job that can be good for the right person
pros: Good money and incentives. Great employee discount. Fun environment. Tons of free swag
cons: Will have you testing your morals every day. Constant abuse from customers. Hated company by many

review: Decent work if you can get it.
pros: The pay is fair for a call center position.
cons: You have to constantly be playing office politics to get anywhere or even to just get an achievement award.

review: Probably what you would expect from working for a large company
pros: Good work / life balance
cons: Incompetent leadership; lack of professional growth opportunities.

review: Yearly increases are good, but they want you to be availble all the time.
pros: Stable company, good benefits, free cable.
cons: Unreasonable expectation to be available around the clock.

pros: Being the largest cable provider, its possible that you do end up in a good group.
cons: old school middle management. Ppl have been there not for being great, but being too lazy to try something new. Non committal HR.

pros: Great benefits- free services matching 401k
cons:
Management doesn't have a clue - send out new products before completely tested
Must learn on the fly

pros: Competitive salary, excellent 401K and benefits.
cons: The corporate sales department is terribly unethical, geared toward closing the sale no matter what. Customers complain about lack of support, missed install dates. Senior management is well aware of the problem, tells the sales staff not to answer calls after the sale is made.

pros: free cable, benefits, the people you meet at work
cons: not treated fairly, hard to move within the company unless you kiss butt and they are stingy with pay

pros: Good pay not the best but good. The people you meet there end up to be more like family.
cons: Will fire you at the drop of a hat. I went to HR to file a claim for Sexual Harrassment 6 months later I was let go for something they said I did.

review: The worst employment experience I've had
pros: The compensation guarantee for the first four months is good but after that it sucks. There really is nothing good about being employed here unless you don't mind losing half your sales due cancellations to poor installs
cons: Terrible management at the local level (Indianapolis). Comcast does not know what "customer service" means and the local management doesn't care

pros: Good benefit packet, not mico-managed, growing company, and Fortune 50 Company
cons: Low pay, poor customer service, very fugal in providing cars and equipment to employees

review: It was great at first until  the commission structures change to prevent you from making money.
pros: Your peers who work with you are great.
cons: Upper management does not care anything about how they pay you.

pros: Their high speed internet service along with DVR and cable service is among best in the idustry
cons: Pay could be better along with opportunity for advancement. Micro managing by some supervisors made it difficult to do your job

pros: Good option of benefits including 401k and stock purchase. Upward potential and fairly good training.
cons: Time frame crunch. Sometimes dealing with frustrated customers because of poor customer service on phone.

review: Decent Benefits; Difficult Understanding from Management.
pros: Decent benefits, Static schedule, some flexibility.
cons: Management turns a blind eye to facts, while sticking to antiquated numbers and statistics. No room for advancement. Any employee who speaks to customers is forced to sell.

pros: Good work/life balance.  Great employee benefits including free TV/Phone/Internet.
cons: Total compensation is lower in comparison to other Cable Companies.

pros: great employee benefits and bonuses.
cons: job security.. the company is always going through changes. My job was transferred to Atlanta, Ga twice until I was eventually just laid off without being placed in another department.

pros: Salary, Bonus and benefits, overall comp plan..
cons: Very aggressive sales management and demanding work life. Serious pressure on daily activities and sales pressure.

pros: Good benefits. Not having to be in the office all day
cons: Changes in quotas and commission pushed away good reps

pros: Great co-workers, casual dress environment, good training
cons: The way metrics can affect your commission. Metrics are high and confusing system. Schedule was only 11-8 no other option for first 6 months

pros: Good Pay, nice building, nice food
cons: Worst company to work for!!! Don't waste your time. Lack of communication. No interaction with upper management yet lot of expectations. They walk with their heads high and yes lot of dirty politics. Management is very quick to blame their failures on you.

pros: OK benefits. Nice perks. People are ok.
cons: They are very strict with who is where and when. Management is meh. They promote bad behavior too.

pros: Great pay, great if you want to make lots of money fast, very hard to sustain, number increase to where its hard to keep up.
cons: you have to be self motivated, and no work-life balance.

pros:
Amazing coworkers
Decent pay rate
Nice location 
Good hours
Fun training 
Good benefits
cons:
Unrealistic goals
No commission despite high quota & promise of commission
Bad/manipulative business practices 
Terrible management

pros: I thought the benefits were excellent and the time off policy was also very good. I found my bosses to be very flexible
cons: Constant re-organization that didn't produce any lasting results

review: It is a big ship headed towards world domination
pros: Innovative competitive successful diverse ambitious
cons: Can be aloof about employees individual needs and bounderies

pros: The perks are great.
cons: The interoffice politics are jaded. The actual work is terrible, brought back my depression.

pros: Great money if your willing to work 60 or 70 hours a week
cons: Never had more than 1 day off a week. My days started around 6am and sometimes didn't end till 11pm or later

pros: Benefits, training. No micromanagement.  Rewarded based on performance.
cons: Advised to lie by management to potential customers.

pros: Bonus money. Friendly staff. Open door policy.
cons: High production numbers needed. late hours.

pros: 4 day work schedule
cons:
Required work till all work is completed. 
Low pay

pros: The benefits are okay: Courtesy services, medical and dental.
cons: Comcast eliminated positions across West Division last August/September/October of 2018. Comcast Leadership called it “optimization” to a sharred services model. Many tenured employees lost their jobs, “termination without cause”. Impacted people could look for opportunities within Comcast; typically with a 50% pay cut! Give Comcast 18 years and they make you start over again!

review: Comcast- Great Start by not a place to stay
pros: Benefits and industry learning potential
cons: Poor management/leadership and total lack of career path

pros: They pay pretty well and offer lots of overtime.
cons: They suffer from the same problem most large companies suffer from...  Lack of communication.

review: Comcast is an ok place to work but would not recommend for the unnecessary stress that comes with it.
pros: good benefits, great contests, good time off. management tries to work with you a little bit
cons: too stressful, company expects too much for the little pay, company shows no interest in fixing chronic issues.

pros: LOW STRESS/ Decent Pay good managment
cons: LOW OPURTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT/ feedback on issues non existent form corprate office

pros: There are absolutely no reasons. Comcast has the tallest building in Philadelphia, and  rest of the satellite offices are managed very professionally.
cons: It is all the time fire fighting with no planning or thought. In my 1.5 years, there was not a single town hall meeting.

review: I can do it in one word.  Chaos
pros: Decent benefits and stock options
cons: directionless, or more precisely, too many directions, attempting to do too much at the same time.

review: Nice place to work but too far
pros: Great working environment. Great for college students
cons: Living in Atlanta it was too far to travel. Position was only part time. Very weak commission structure.

pros:
- Quarterly Bonuses
- Courtesy Services
- Plenty of paid time off
cons:
- (Personal) Too far to travel from home
-  Employee  Tools are faulty 
- Sales are enforced more than technical

review: Fast paced environment but not well-organized at times
pros:
1. Lots of on-going projects.
2. Career growth opportunity
3. Good salary and Benefits
cons:
1. Hard to know the tasks priorities at times when lots of things are happening.
2. Lots of politics in management.

review: Some things good some things bad
pros: Great benefits and pay rate, good people surrounding you.
cons: Always someone breathing down your neck, you are constantly watched and monitored. No trust from management to employees

review: Good way to learn a city.
pros: A good way to learn how to get around a new city. Pay was fine for your responsibilities.
cons: The days could be longer than what you are scheduled. Communication from supervisors to subordinates was slow at times.

review: management sucks, but benefits are great
pros: free cable and internet. paid time off and great insurance
cons: at least in sales, it seems that management don't really know what they are doing.

pros: Benefits, stability, schedule, salary, not much else to say the politics are great if you're on the correct side of things.
cons: Nepotism, metrics, pressure, expectations, supervisors performance, senior staff culture, don't get pigeon holed

review: Ok job to get career started in sales.
pros: Good benefits. Good work\life balance.
cons: Underpaid, bad training, corporate changes infrastructure too much.

pros: Free services, great vacation benefits on day 90,4.5 match on 401k.
cons: the call volume is low, a lot of outsourcing, they are delaying a new comission plan and the current one is broken.

review: Large company but a lot of change
pros: Large, well-known company, good opportunity to grow and move into other roles.
cons: A lot of change, layoffs, new initiatives depending what area of the business you work in.

pros: Free tv, Internet and phone service
cons: Not feeling valued as an employee

review: Very unorganized with a high turnover rate. But they do pay well and offer a lot of benefits.
pros: Pay and Benefits. nice atmosphere.
cons: Unorganized. no direction after training.

pros: Great pay, Awesome co workes
cons: Poor managers, typically did not know anything about the products the employees were selling.

review: Good benefits but the job is telemarketing
pros: Benefits are good, get to have food and perks of a sales job (phone, laptop, etc.) They also pay for mileage you use on your vehicle.
cons: The telemarketing culture is hard and some of the sales reps will be given "referral partners" by the managers so they get sales practically guaranteed, while you're working your bum off to cold call and generate your own sales.

pros: Pay rate Is very nice
cons: Shifts suck. Either have work to 12am to get weekends off.  Or have off days in the  middle of week. The supervisors are never at there desk

review: Too BIG to offer quality customer service and product support
pros: Benefits, pay, comp services, discounts
cons: Poor customer service, great products but poorly managed

pros: Great benefits and incentives
cons: Unstable schedule. You will constantly be changing shifts, this is not the job if you have kids and don't have proper arrangements.

pros: Free cable was nice. Started out as a great company to work for, who cared about its customers
cons: You are just a number in a huge conglomerate. Middle management has it's hand tied. They make it nearly impossible to assist customers, and would prefer to outsource every position to squeeze out every penny.

pros: Good work environment. Great employee discounts. Home dispatch.
cons: Expectations way too high for pay scale. Highly restricted Overtime but still expected to make customers happy.

pros: Great work responsibilities and exciting industry
cons: not high level of accountability

review: Decent benefits to handle angry customers
pros: Pay and benefits were pretty good.
cons: Customers expected to get into a disagreement about their bills and did not seem to trust Comcast very much.

pros: Opportunity to grow, if you make it
cons: Constant pressure with metrics now changed. If you miss one metric you get put on progressive discipline which leads to termination.  The metrics they use to evaluate you are never right.

review: extremely stressful place to work and be happy
pros: Free parking. Decent pay and benefits
cons: Company does not care about anything but selling.   The more you can lie to a customer the better you are thought of.   Many on medication due to very high stress.   Would love to see on undercover boss.  Also another wells fargo situation

pros: Opportunity to make a lot of money if you exceed your monthly quota
cons: No residual income every month quota resets can have bad months and it hurts your pocket

pros: Comcast gives great benefits and allows for great sales potential.
cons: Base is low compared to others in the industry. Upward mobility is slim to none.

pros: Flexible Hours. Good Benefits and expense reimbursement. Good people
cons: Heavily saturated market. Too much competition from fellow employees. Difficult process after making a sale.

pros: The benefits are great and if you want to be involved in the community there are plenty of opportunities.
cons: The compensation is below what the market offers and the opportunities for advancement are about who you know. If you go to HR there will be retaliation even though the company preaches against it.

review: Comcastic but Not Where It Counts
pros: Peers; Bonuses; Benefits; Overtime; Independent work
cons: Day to day experience is too dependent upon one's leadership; metrics make it difficult to deliver a good customer experience.

review: Not a bad place to be
pros: Great people, good to working parents, good benefits
cons: Comcast/Uni merger changed a lot, more corporate, less flexible

pros: Highly discounted TV and Internet.
cons: Management is  too focused on being politically correct. If someone is a bad fit for the team instead of removing them they continuously coach to the year end review. You can show up to this job, do the bare minimum, and get promoted. Those that aspired to do more and get better we’re punished.

pros: down to earth people, pay was decent, benefits were oookkk
cons: hated company by the public and company does little to nothing to change that. makes you ashamed to say where you work

review: Good place to work and advance
pros: Large company, opportunity for advancement
cons: Human Resources tends to be on the  side of the leadership team regardless of the facts.

pros: Great benefits and courtesy services, huge discount for services while working there.  Commission pay is great
cons: Hourly pay could be higher, need to be more flexible with shifts

pros: Great Benefits, Fun Environment, Good Bonus Incentives, No Micromanagement
cons: Base Pay, Work life balance, Favortism

review: Nice perks, high pressure to sell
pros: Free cable and internet, decent benefits
cons: Low base pay, high pressure to sell

review: overall good company to work for
pros:
good benefits
decent pay
easy to get promotion
company vehicle
cons:
lack of interest from management
decent pay
slow to react to change
lack of latest equipment

review: A mixture of good and bad.
pros:
Pro #1: Team Oriented
Pro #2: Friendly
Pro #3: Promotional Opportunity
cons:
Pro #1: Lack of General Knowledge
Pro #2: Dull & Repetitive

review: Was a pleasant experience for the most part
pros: Great people to work with always provided assistance.
cons: The departments aren't all on the same page.

review: It had been good until i had a concern. And they weren't understanding at all
pros: Working by myself and meeting people
cons: The supervisor caused lots of stress daily

pros: Good initial training, great bonuses
cons: Continually changing metrics, ever increasing requirement to sell

pros: Free internet, tv and phone after paying for the equipment. Good time off. Great health benefits.
cons: Corp industry. Too many chiefs and upper level positions that could be better structured locally.

pros:
Comcast is fast-paced and energetic
Great management tema
cons: Sometimes it is too fast-aced - we end up with conflicting #1 priorities and confusion on the front line as a result.  More investment needed in Customer Care tools.

pros: They will pay you and give you a nice benefit package.
cons: Too much of a daily grind, too many meetings every week, feels like you are being baby sat.

pros: Good Benefits and company perks.
cons: Very low pay. Inconsistency in career advancement. Very difficult to trust upper management on pay raises. They do not hire quality people on purpose, they hire bodies to answer phones.

pros: deeply discounted cable and internet, being on the cutting edge of technology in the industry
cons: bottom line, employees are numbers not people

pros: nice co workers, job is garanteed because there is always work to be done. Good benefits
cons: bad management, force employers to work even on their days off

pros: They give u alot of freedom snd they do t micro manage.
cons: Everything else, they people the staff its really not a good place to work..

pros: Salary and benefits ok.
cons: Management does not give you the tools you need to help resolve customer issue.  Worst corporate management team I have ever worked for.

pros: commission, benefits, perks, incentives, vacation time
cons: power tripping management, self concerned human resources dept, not focused on helping and saving customers, no loyalty to long time employees

review: Fun place to work for the most part.
pros: Free services were provided from day one.
cons: I felt that they could of done better on insurance for the employees.

pros: Good coworkers, ability to move around the company and advance if you work hard
cons: Customers can be demanding and public view of the company can be negative, some employees contribute to the negative view of the company

pros: Pay was tolerable. Bonuses and vacations were a plus. Also the occasional free lunches. You also meet many people .
cons: Management are highly corrupted. Unprofessional workplace. Occasional fights. Supervisors are unqualified.

pros: Free service. .nice benefits. Meet lots of people on daily basis
cons: Negative atmosphere. .customer complaints..everything is about money. Make it easier to make customers happy

review: They are cutting commisions, raising goals, and in a growing market making packages more expensive
pros: A lot of vacation days flexible hours
cons: read my review there are many cons

review: Not bad, but definitely not great either
pros: Benefits, fun coworkers, occasional catering, spiffs and contests.
cons: Bad management, Very little encouragement to promote and move forward, Rubrics and metrics.

pros: Good benefits, full time job, PTO is awsome.
cons: no place to grow, sales quota was pushing me to worry more about selling than to actually fix the problem.

pros: The pay was good. Had great incentives
cons: They wanted you to make monthly goal. If you missed by two you were fired. Under management only looked at you as a number not a person. No life balance

pros: There is nothing positive about working here. Nothing.
cons: Poor management. No advancement opportunities. Very demanding job. You literally take call after call from customers yelling at you and there are no tools available to you to help them. Management does nothing to help you. This place is terrible,  If you care about yourself at all do not work here if you don't have to .

pros: Free comcast services, medical benefits etc, commission pay for sales (full time only)
cons: Poor management, decreases in commission pay, hard to promote within, no individual pay raises, poor training, terrible work environment and staff (not all but plentiful)

pros: Its a large company
cons: I hate working in a store, it's not real sales, more of just customer service.  Not a professional environment.  I feel like I work with a bunch of High school kids.

pros: Courtesy Service (Video, Internet, Phone, Home Security & Mobile). Great 1st job for new graduates. Work/Life balance improves for tenured employees.
cons: Monotonous. Little to no room to advance. Pay increases plateau after five years.

pros: Direct co workers, commission
cons: Out sourcing, no proper training, verbal abuse on a daily basis, not enough resources to do the job

pros: Decent Salary and Benefits and Training, most colleagues and management are nice
cons: Too much micromanagement, accountable for every minute.

pros: Great Company and Benefits
cons: Expectations are not realist at all. Company throws you out on the phones and doesn't really help you grow with the company. They just want you to be a full-time employee.

pros: Benefits / company vehicle / tools/ stocks/ 401k match
cons: Over worked and underpaid. Taking on all the roles of other departments

review: Shady Company - Terrible Sales Tactics - Unethical - Great Money!
pros: Money is good, however you now have to sell in a really shady way to hit increasing goals with decreasing commissions.
cons: Everything else. Management is terrible, they foster a uniquely unethical sales environment, where it seems as everyone tries to over unethical each other.

review: Good place to work if you want free cable tv
pros: The people are friendly and the work culture isn't too bad.
cons: The pay scale sucks--they should pay more and give us an option on the free cable tv.

review: Their employees come last and so so their customers
pros: Good pay and benefits package
cons: Claim that they are customer focused, but are willing to mislead customers to get sales

review: It was a good place to work, they had some kinks if you will being new to business to business telecom sales.
pros: Great prices on products, so they are very competitive.
cons: Need more serviceability, many businesses couldn't get their service.

review: Had to deal with a lot of mood swings.a lot of snitching
pros: great benefits,good medical, free cable and internet !!!!!!!!!!!!
cons: terrible managers, terrible raises, terrible moral...

pros: Worked in the mailroom and pay was fair, hours were reasonable, Relaxed work atmosphere and environment at least for me.
cons: Human Resources department was not the best in this office. Sometimes the people I worked for were very demanding.

pros: discount cable services, company vehicle, meet new people
cons: Overly Corporate, everybody feared for their jobs daily. Regardless of what makes sense, everything is done in such an odd way.

review: Equal pay for equal job   negative
pros: friendly people to work with
cons: Non discretionary pay scale. Doesn't pay the same in same the dept with identical job titles

review: World largest Cable, Phone and Internet Provider
pros: Financially Solid Company that continues to grow and acquire the Competition.
cons: You don't hit your numbers you will be removed.  High Stress with massive layoffs of tenured higher paid management.

pros: Good Management - Great Co-Workers - Excellent Incentives
cons: Challenging Processes - Outsourcing...Tripping Over Dollars To Save Pennies - Customer Service...Oh Well-

review: unneeded stress....feeling of unappreciation and indespensable...security does not exist with this company....
pros: benefits are great...pay is good
cons: you are just a number....no understanding or care for their employees....acknowledgement of good is nonexistant...

pros: Easy Money, Bonuses Weekly,Great PTO
cons: Pettiness,Lack of Leadership From Upper Management

review: Great benefits and perks but horrible management
pros: Great benefits and perks. Bonuses were good.
cons: Horrible management. No clear goal objectives and little communication and resources to accomplish projects seamlessly. No opportunities for career growth.

pros: Great on-going projects. Good working culture. As a fresher, I was given time to learn and excel the needed skills for the project. Encouraging colleagues.
cons: Lack of communication between the teams in the same project.

pros: The one thing I really liked was tons of paid vacation time due to lots of agents.
cons: Metrics can be a hassle In the call center but that's expected.

pros: Very good benefits, discounted cable, access to mobile tablet
cons: Inflexible schedule, commissioned sales, employee held responsible for many customer situations that are beyond the employees control, high turnover

pros:
Benefits are good.
Meet new people daily
Flexible schedule
Good training for beginners in direct sales
cons:
New hire sometimes struggle and feel lost
Working in all types of weather conditions and expected to make quota
Work life balance is sometime overwhelming

pros: free internet and steep employee discounts with other companies such as Verizon Wireless.
cons: The job itself wouldn't be worth doing for twice the pay but the benefits package was hard to give up.

pros: Flexible Hours, Great Pay, Benefits
cons: They need to have a better relationship with the install tech. You don't get paid until they install your orders.

review: Need to work on customer service and communication between dept
pros: Good pay and benefits
cons: Not enough communication between dept.  the make it to hard to help the customer.  Customer seem to hate Comcast

pros: Company offers good perks and ok benefits
cons: Leadership lacks communication, interpersonal skills and training as supervisors.  Also very low wages (non competitive)

pros: Good pay benefits package discounts on services
cons: Management does not play fair when you qualify for a promotion it is all about favorites

pros: company vehicle decent pay for the most part its hard but rewarding.
cons: lots of outdoor work during bad weather, some customers homes make you want to go and shower.

pros: Benefits, lots of flexibility, good facilities
cons: It can be a numbers game

pros: Decent pay and benefits as well as perks; community outreach
cons: Environment, lack of teamwork, lack of effective communication between departments, lack of solid policy

pros:
Employee discounts for services
Good benefits
Lots of paid time off (Vaca, Holidays, Flex days, Floating Holidays)
Gym facility at HQ in Philly
Nice cafe at HQ in Philly
cons:
No loyalty to employees
Hard to move around in positions

pros: The way pay was decent and, at the beginning, you could work your own hours so long as you were making your sales goals.
cons: Management became very uptight and they increased sales goals while lowering commission.

pros:
- Incentives to boost your money
- Hourly pay with commission once a month
- Good benefits
- Very good discount
cons:
- Commission structure changes constantly 
- Foot traffic is main source of sales and it is inconsistent

pros: Good pay, great benefits 401K.
cons: Crazy work hours. Very arbitrary evaluations.

pros: Small Team, Fast training, Benefits start after 90 days
cons: Work load is far reaching beyond the scope of the position with no additional compensation. Communication between departments is aweful

pros: Co-Workers were awesome and they were always giving opportunities to earn free stuff
cons: Very sales driven, would walk around the call center multiple times a day to see how far along you were

pros: provides 3 months of training - classroom and actual ride-along.  you'll have a taste of the real job towards the ride-along days.
cons: the pay is low in relation to the physical work.

pros: Pay is decent, lots of flexibility, good ESPP, 6% 401K match
cons: Simply a number with this company, hard to move up as they already have the people in place that they want to receive promotions

pros:
NPS is taken seriously
Product is best in the industry
cons: Start pay is very low, sub $15 per hour for non-management

review: Difficult place to excel in your career
pros: Free cable, free internet. Cafeteria has delicious food.
cons: Poor management, unequal treatment of employees, uneasy environment, little room for growth

pros: Free cable is the only good thing you get from working with comcast
cons: No career building or help to advance your career within the company.

review: Never worked for a company that reward mediocrecy
pros: Free cable and commission is nice
cons: Unprofessional and company structure/ policies do not make sense.

pros: Great team, laid back environment, a lot of freedom
cons: Poor management, sometimes poor working conditions

pros: None, really, horrible environment to work on
cons: They are outsourcing all positions, threat employees like slaves.

review: Very well run corporately.  However, local management has no clue.
pros: Run very well from the top.
cons: There is a disconnect between corporate and local leaders.

pros: decent benefits, adequate amount of time off
cons: poor compensation, company only cares about the bottom line, not the employees, poor from line & middle management, no support from management or HR, front line employees too empowered to do, say, & act as they wish with no repercussions, management has hands tied to do their job, yet are held accountable

pros: The company provided services and employees are vested from day one.
cons: The shifts did not lend to a normal life. Plan to spend most holidays working.

pros: Pretty much the only perks are discounted services.
cons: Comcast's leaders are not even slightly concerned about creating a convenient experience for their customers, they're main focus is generating revenue positive transactions.

pros: a lot of benefits and discounts.
cons: the pay is low for all the stress you take on. You are stuck in each position you enter for a year.

pros: The free cable, internet, home phone services and low priced benefits are by far the only reason to ever work for this company.
cons: If you enjoy working for a company that intentionally mistreats it's employees and customers, you'll love working for this company.

pros: The benefits are good. The free cable and internet is good - just pat a discount for equipment
cons: Disconnect with top upper management. Communication could be better.

pros: great people to work with
cons: the company is really disorganized.  too many changes made to quickly, the customers end up being the ones to suffer

pros: The money was ok but not great. I had to look elsewhere to keep up with cost of living.
cons: Demanding too much. Metrics set up that you can't achieve.

pros: Benefits and work with you on hours and vacation time. Training
cons: Updates for hiring into another higher step is not done very well

pros: Systems are generally stable, good knowledgeable people to work with.
cons: Under pays and doesn't promote from within sadly. Lets key tools go far out of date before updating.

pros: Pay was good if you hit or went beyond sales goals.
cons: Angry customers, lot of hours. Miscommunication between departments developed angry customers.

review: It's great, but it's not bad either
pros: Great benefits and the pay has been recently increased. Flexible scheduling for emergencies as well
cons: The company does not provide the employees with all the tools needed to assist customers.

review: One of the worst companies I have worked for.
pros: They have good benefits due to their size.
cons: Inconsistent management, processes and policies. It seems like they reward mediocrity and are focused on following outdated processes that are NOT productive or profitable. Management is more concerned about keeping their jobs rather than excelling and moving forward. Comcast doesn't pay you enough for what you have to go through for them.

pros: Good benefits with medical and 401k plus discounted home services.
cons: The work/life balance is non existent.  A lot of pressure to hit goals but this should be expected with any large publicly owned company.

pros: The ability to get bonuses by upselling and interdepartment contest
cons: Micromanaged to the point of not being able to your job, run your own department, family means nothing, your health means nothing- you are nothing but a number

pros: They’re very helpful but sometimes rude in the process
cons: They’re always packed it’s better to schedule an appointment

pros:
You get to work with others on your same team at times. 
Decent work hours with overtime.
cons:
Supervisors only look out for their best interest.
Promotions are based on favoritism.

pros: Matching 401k, company stock, flexible hours
cons: Health insurance was surprisingly expensive, you have to keep an eye on your commsions so that you don't get cheated, upper management is very untrustworthy, sexual harrassment reporting is a joke

pros: Good teams, good pay, flexible when needing time off.
cons: bend over backwards for customers who have no appreciation and treat you like dirt

pros: Coworkers and immediate management is great. Family feel.
cons: Underpaid and over worked. Once career ceiling is met . It's kind of hard to move anywhere . High ranking low pay.

pros: Lots of opportunity to grow and advance one's career.
cons: The compensation is subpar compared to industry standards. The management runs the company as if we were still in the 1980's.

pros:
Good management 
Good team to work with
cons: A lot of bosses that lost the initial factor of being a leader

pros: Benefits are pretty good; Free cable and internet

pros: People most of them are great

review: Company that is sinking and Sinking
pros: good benefits, free cable internet and low price home phone
cons: they are moving jobs all over the country and therefore people in my town is losing their jobs.

review: It is easy to get lost in such a large company
pros: Nationally known,has good medical benefits
