pros: Decent pay. Three days off. Company work van. Free cable service.
cons: Sometimes your metrics are entirely out of your control and there's not much you can do about it.

pros: the pay is ok , decent benefits, and great office
cons: disorganized, non communication , and DRAMA. So many people in one office tends to spark high school like drama.

pros: Good work atmosphere, paid on performance, promote within the company.
cons: No part-time positions offered, micromanagement, quotas

pros: great company, phenomenal leadership, great benefits and perks
cons: rotating shifts, no leadership development (takes too long to be promoted to next level), no work life balance

review: Overview of Comcast in Washington DC area
pros: There is a person to go to who is responsible for everything at Comcast
cons: Limited senior management experience beyond cable environment.  Too many knee jerk changes.

pros: Overtime was great, made some good relationships
cons: Management was horrid and did little to help the growth of the company and employees

pros: Lots of opportunities for overtime
cons: Have a high turn over and really stretch the technicians thin

pros: Benefits! Lot's of perks and the Company listens to employees. Open door policy.
cons: Room for growth takes a long time! many internal post is highly competitive.

pros: Good Benefits and vacations....I really don't have much to say about.
cons: The training was very short. The pay is very low.  Managers are not concern about their employees

pros: it waa great to learn problem solving and analytical skills.
cons: management does not take care of you.

pros: it depends on what supervisor you get if you will have a good experience.
cons: not much room to grow, constantly fighting to keep your job month by month

review: Awesome chaotic - Worst company to work for
pros:
- Big company and good revenues.
- Nice headquarters.
cons:
- Poor quality of workforce. 
- Heights of inequality on all grounds. (Equal opportunity and open door policies are just for papers)
- Very un-professional.
- Laid back.

review: Great pay, difficult to work for
pros: They have a lot of accelerators for those who are exceeding sales goals.
cons: Management is very tight and difficult to work with.

pros: Decent pay, great benefits, give you a good amount if vacation time
cons: micormanage, its random knocking on residential doors, techs suck and the product sux!

pros: Uncapped commission is the best thing.
cons: They can change the commission payout structure anytime they want. They always make it lower.

pros: Good benefits, guaranteed hours jhh
cons: Structure among different channels of companies, sales reps compete against each other whether online over the phone or in store

pros: Tons of benefits and opportunities
cons: A lot of stores are under staffed and management is questionable

pros: Good people and training with plenty of benefits.
cons: Depending on the call center, limited opportunity and lower-end pay.

pros: Free cabe... Thats all i got really.
cons:
Lets see
No real training 
system is overly complicated 
No team work
managers just worried about their commission check. To hell with the issues of the store.
no support.
no accountability 
and no real feeling of wanting to come to work.

pros: Nice office, nice people, overall great company to work for. Good benefits
cons: Some of the manages can rub you the wrong way.

pros:
*Salary is ok
* Free internet, TV and Telephone is as part of employee benefits
cons: *Bonus is not exiting. It is very less

pros: great benefits, ability to move up in the company is endless, perks are great
cons: the pay for internal employees getting promoted verses them hiring an outside employee is not the same

review: Most New Sales Employees at Comcast Fail!
pros: Great benefits and pay can be good if one hits quota.
cons: Quotas are very hard to attain.  Most get fired several months after ramp up period.  My whole team of hard workers (-1) is gone!

pros: Solid product.  Good pay and benefits.
cons: Installation of products was difficult to manage and impacted future growth of accounts.  Management is not realistic about sales expectations and quotas.

pros: Fantastic discounts on cable, internet, and phone service. Discounts on Universal travel packages.
cons: Advancement within the company incredibly stagnant if you don't know the right people.

pros: work with great people, fun office parties, abilty to grow & learn
cons: strict upper management who  may not always be open to new suggestions or opportunites for lower levels

pros: Great with time off, Paid  days off, benefits are affordable and amazing
cons: Very Stressful, Customers can borderline harass you. You have to develop a thick skin , and pay is not well.

pros: Stable career, good benefits, decent work life balance
cons: Limited opportunities for growth. Lack in technical innovation

pros: Great structure and benefits when you get the minimum time requirements
cons: You can get lost in the shuffle if you don't make yourself stand out

pros: good pay great amount of PTO
cons: more work you do the less you get

pros: exciting place to work. always improving products.
cons: Can sometimes be a little unorganized.

pros: It is really a friendly env and it is very interesting to work at Comcast.
cons: nothing much to tell abt cons and commute is very hard to travel to office.

pros: Open choice of technology good access to training materials. Management responsive to employee feedback
cons: Tech career progression not up to industry standards. Leadership agrees to bad delivery timetables

pros: Great benefit package overall. PTO is great,
cons: Pay is not as competitive as other companies in the valley.

pros: My manager there was amazing
cons: I did not like the little pay for the amount of work we had to do to get sales.

pros:
-loved my general manager
-while working there really became family with most of the go workers
-met some amazing customers
cons:
-assistant manger took over and everyone hated him
-they don’t take pride in their best employees
-unprofessional the way they act upon situations that could be handled

pros: Benefits are good include cheap tv and internet
cons: Pay scale is not good for the work proformed

pros: An employee has the potential for growth.
cons: It can be challenging to transfer internally.  The internal transfer process has dramatically improved, it is still cumbersome to get through.

pros: Lots of support, progressive company, trying to find and develop new revenue streams
cons: Very slow moving for what the company wants to accomplish

pros: Work Life Balance is Amazing, the Workload is Manageable, Salary is Good, Benefits are GREAT.
cons: There is NO Professional development.  This location was far from my home.

pros: Good for a single person.
cons: I’m the type to go over and beyond but doesn’t seem to matter. Can’t get any positions unless you are liked by management. Wouldn’t recommend working here if you have kids or a wife. Most guys here are divorced within 2-3 years.

pros: You get a lot of customer interaction
cons: Comcast sets you up for failure. Too many metrics that are humanly impossible to meet. Many beyond your control.

review: Benefits are good. Commission is good.
pros: Commission, benefits, chance to move uo.
cons: Lack of respect from managers and supervisors. Low hourly pay.

review: Management is very helpful and always ready to assist.
pros: They have very goog benefits
cons: The hours are not always the best as you may have to work week-ends and holidays.

review: Harsh, uncaring, aggressive, micro-management, close minded.
pros: Health benefits are very good, as is the dental benefits and cost for prescriptions.  The vacation plan is similar to most company's.
cons: Aggressive company, has lost the definition of contribution from employees.  A company that concentrates on the bottom line more than on the employee.

pros:
Good benefits
Higher than average pay
cons: They don't tell you during training just how much they expect you to sell on every call

review: Comcast is the Best Place to Work
pros: Comcast practices diversity and focuses on hiring minorities
cons: the minorities are held to the call center and not able to advance

review: Be prepared to join the working poor
pros: Great discounts, paid time off, extensive training program, effective trainers, good work life balance
cons: pay ridiculosulsy low, no opportunities for growth, hours suck

review: Ridiculously demanding, overly structured work environment
pros: free cable, customer behaviors provide for great stories for friends
cons: teathered to desk, cannot pee without signing life away.

pros: Benefits were good. Health insurance and 401K were competitive.
cons: Micro managed by leadership. Compensation below average. Long hours and rude customers.

pros: Performance based, room for growth
cons: unpredictable hours, too much weight on numbers and metrics, management was unsupportive of reserve military duty.

pros: Potlucks, free swag, free cable. Low cost internet and phone
cons: Hours are horrible. They will right you up for being 30 seconds late

review: Good benefits but in the end poor work/life balance.
pros: Good people and good benefits.
cons: Unrealistic and immovable deadlines.  A lot of after-hours work.

pros: Easy sales for the most part. Cheap Comcast services.
cons: They keep restructuring the pay tables to be lower.

pros: schedule was cut and dry, work specified hours with little flexibility
cons: wages were just too low

pros: Excellent salary and I love the people
cons: Consistency in process and procedures

pros: I get free cable and internet
cons: They like to cheat their customers. We are taught to do whatever it takes to keep customers on the service.

review: Fantastic in the beginning but the last year or two is extreme micromanagement
pros: Free cable and Internet and great healthcare
cons: Work/life balance is impossible. Always on call

pros:
Good benefits, nice manager, good vacation, loved working with an IPad.
Excellent health insurance, stock options
cons: Micro managing, stress!, sales constantly dropped due to construction

pros: Free Cable TV, Phone and Internet
cons: unreasonable levels for meeting/achieving commission for sales.

pros: Good multiplier after hitting 100%,  Employee Stock Purchase, 401K
cons: Construction issues, lack of communication between technician and sales causing loss in sales and customer frustrations

pros:
Endless opportunities to learn
Free cable
cons:
Pays under market average
Unclear advancement parameters
Management ineffective

pros: Benefits are good. A lot of theming with the guests and children
cons: The pay is not the best for all of the work you do.

review: Too Much Stress, too little pay
pros: Courtesy Services, giveaways, incentives, fun activities.
cons: Grueling work, conflicting metrics, large amount of work under major time constraints.

pros: Great Benefits, industry leader, potential to learn
cons: The biggest con is the extremely long hours, a lot of grunt work with little time to step back and absorn

pros: The people are the best most of the time
cons: Benefit costs are through the roof.  Knock off $3 per hour on your hourly wage.

pros: great benefits,nice people, customer service,perks coworkers
cons: pay, management, communications, internal operations reputation

pros: Good Benefits, Bonus and RSU's
cons: Very low merit increases, too many contractors verses employees, no organizational charts, all network relationship based

pros: Free cable, internet and phone. They also provide uniforms like shirts, pants, bennies, caps, and boots. Take home vehicle
cons: some of the metrics are hard to obtain

pros: They have great benefits for your family
cons: They only care about the work not the employee

pros: decent benefits, some opportunities for advancement
cons: poor management, unrealistic expectations, low pay

pros: great benefits and PTO days
cons: Customers are very brutal. It can take a toll on you mentally and sometimes, keeps you from wanting to go to work everyday.

pros:
Pay is ok
Had weekends off
cons:
Hard move departments 
Management was hard to deal with
Treat you like a number

pros: helping others in seeing the value of what they have
cons: not being able to do everything a person wants to make them happy

pros: Services at a phenomenal discount - full pkg. almost next to nothing
cons:
Hours - mostly 12-9 pm, once out of training, you are told you can get better hours in a few months. Reality, it is more like a year, then you get to bid for your hours. 
Some supervisors are not a good fit to work with.

pros: Great benefits, including nearly free cable and internet. Decent pay for the job role.
cons: Very stats driven. Must meet increased quotas quarterly. Can be stressful if not sales/quota oriented.

pros: comcast has great infrastructure and benefits people Phildephia know how to lead
cons: Leaders and Management from middle management confused and there is nepotism going on

pros: The knowledge I gained while working for Comcast is amazing.
cons: Some of the customers house and environments are not safe.

pros: ok pay and Ive seen growth within the company
cons: communication on policies are not clear. reprimand without opportunities for growth.

pros: Pay is okay I guess. Good employee discount, basically free cable, internet, home phone and home security   and really good co-workers.
cons: Everything else! You have to work nights and weekend! Mangement is a serious joke. They say that you are " empowered " but you really arent. You sit on the phone all day to get yelled at!

pros: Employees and culture were great, got along with most
cons: No first call resolution, customer rarely able to request a supervisor and actually get to speak with one.

pros: The benefits are very good.  the  people that i worked  with made coming to wor bareable.
cons: there is no room for growth.  they dont have a good work/life balance.  extrememly stressful

pros: Free cable and Internet service
cons: Short lunch break, management not around when needed
